loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 47-year-old divorced father of two children. He is a Palestinian refugee who started  his own business in 1995, with long experience in fixing car bodies (fixing and painting bodywork) to support his family and provide them with the necessary living needs.

Khalil is getting old as he himself said, and he doesn't want to spend the rest of his life alone. So, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his marriage legal fees and prepare his house for this occasion. He is seeking a caring mother for his beloved children, and a supportive wife to spend the rest of their life together.

He is still hoping that in the future, he can buy his own garage and expand his working sector.

loans.use: To get married in order to have a caring mother for his beloved children and a supportive wife to spend the rest of his life with

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en:
Ailene is 39 years old and married with four children.  With three children in school, Ailene works very hard to provide for them.

Ailene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Ailene has been in this business for 17 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Ailene would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Simora

texts.en:
Simora works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Simora requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 39 years now.

Simora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Bay

texts.en:
Bay, 57, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire.

Bay has been running a food store in front of her house for 20 years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying appliances and good quality food, such as meat and noodles, to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business will run smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy appliances and good quality food, such as meat and noodles

loans.name: Qapaq Niño De Huaynapata - Coya Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QAPAQ NIÑO DE HUAYNAPATA - COYA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Qoya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luciana ella es soltera y tiene 66 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.

Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Qapaq Niño de Huaynapata--Coya Communal Bank, located in the Qoya district of the province of Calca in the department of Cusco.

The member, Luciana, is 66 years old and single, and she has two children.  She works in her business raising and selling animals.  She raises and fattens guinea pigs and chickens, then sells them at different street markets.  She gets her children ahead with this small business.  Her dream is to have a retail space to sell guinea pigs and chickens.

Luciana's requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and guinea pig and chicken feed.

The businesses of the other members are snack sales, animal sales, a grocery store, and a restaurant.  The members attached to the group photo had permission to have their picture taken after the meeting because of work.

Luciana's grateful to those who share her dream through this loan, and she promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and guinea pig and chicken feed

loans.name: Yut

texts.en:
Yut, 28, lives in a remote area of Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. He is a married man who has two dependent children. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crops to the local dealers. He is able to make a net profit of USD 5.00 per day on average. So far, he has been involved in this type of business for nearly 10 years. 

Yut wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system.  Because there is inadequate money, he has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, he hopes to have clean energy to power her household lights, TV, and radio. 

He is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided him a special interest rate lower than its' general loan rates. 

He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for a solar energy home system

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is forty years old. He is married and has one daughter, and he has his own business. 

Igor has been growing vegetables in greenhouses for 16 years. On the 60 acres of land he grows cucumbers, tomatoes, cabbage and potatoes. Igor is a very hardworking and responsible person. He wants to develop his business further.

Igor is asking for a loan of 30,001 UAH  to build a new greenhouse. The loan will help him to get bigger harvest in the upcoming season, increase his profit, and take better care of his family.

loans.use: to build a new greenhouse

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store, will increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a larger stock of food and beverages to sell at her store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. The eldest is 32 and the youngest is 15. Erlinda lives with her family in the town of Concepcion, Iloilo. 

Erlinda has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than five years now. Fishing is a lucrative venture in their place.

Erlinda is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and a new battery for the boat motor. With a loan, Erlinda and her husband will be able to improve their catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Erlinda has hopes of making their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and a new battery for the boat motor

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Tha is a 43-year-old divorced woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has one son. She earns a living running a general store, which she has done for 10 years. 

Tha would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionary, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionary

loans.name: Cuong

texts.en:
Cuong is 36-year-old married man living in Ho Chi Minh City. He has two children. He and his wife earn a living running a food stall, which they have done for six years. 

Cuong would like to take a loan to buy good quality foods such as meat, noodles, and beverages, to sell from his stall. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and increase the turnover in his business. 

He also hopes that through the loan, his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and enable him to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy good quality foods, such as meat, noodles, and beverages

loans.name: Trong

texts.en: Trong is requesting a new loan to buy fabric and materials to make towels. Trong's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in further expanding the size of his business, attracting new customers, and increasing his sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric and materials to make towels

loans.name: Luong

texts.en:
Luong is a 48-year-old married woman. She lives with two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

For five years, she and her husband have run an Internet shop.

Luong would like a loan to purchase a new computer and upgrade hardware for her shop. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new computer and upgrade hardware for her shop.

loans.name: Jesus Yosimar

texts.es:
Jesús, de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado, está casado, su esposa no trabaja, tienen una hija pequeña de 4 años. Jesús, es empleado, trabaja como vigilante en una gasolinera todo el día y hay ocasiones que también trabaja de noche. 

Él solicita el préstamo para comprar arena, cemento, madera, laminas, entre otros materiales, para reparar las paredes y techo de su casa, que actualmente se encuentran en mal estado y no es seguro.

Jesús sueña con darle una excelente educación a su hija y que además, pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jesús, age 27, went to school through the ninth grade.  He is married, and his wife does not work.  They have a little four year old daughter.

José is employed, and he works all day as a watchman at a gas station.  Sometimes he also works at night.

He is requesting the loan to buy sand, cement, wood, metal sheeting, and other materials to repair the walls and roof of his house.  It is currently in bad condition, and it is not safe.

Jesús dreams of giving his daughter an excellent education.  He also dreams of being able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, wood, metal sheeting, and other materials to repair the walls and roof of his house.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao, 33, is a married woman and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. Her husband is a telephone repairman. 

Thao started running a beauty shop ten years ago.  She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more nail polish and hair dye. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more nail polish and hair dye.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep is a 59-year-old married woman. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a driver for hire. 

For 20 years, she has run a business of selling building materials.

Diep would like a loan to purchase building materials to sell to her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is a 31-year-old single woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She earns a living running a general store, which she has done for 12 years. 

Thanh would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Tuyen

texts.en:
Tuyen is a 42-year-old single woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She earns a living running a soft drinks store, which she has done for 10 years. Tuyen would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of soft drinks to stock her  store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of soft drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria operates a second-hand clothing store, which she has been doing for four years. Many people shop at her store every day and she earns an income.

Maria requested a loan for $1,000, which she will use to buy additional stock, such as shirts, shorts, and school clothes. Running a business has made Maria independent because she can be responsible for herself and can also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, shorts, and school clothes

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married and has two children who attend school. She is from Litein, Kenya, a community not known for farming but she is earning a living through agriculture. For the past five years, she has been practicing mixed farming. Because of the experience she has, she commands a lot of respect from her fellow farmers and she is regarded as a mentor. The income from milk, eggs, and tea selling have allowed her to earn a good income. To earn extra income, Betty engages in a small personal business. 

Betty passionately loves dairy farming.  Milking and feeding her co makes her very proud. Through selling milk, she has seen very good returns and the demand for milk has been expanding. Through extensive use of her mobile phone, she has been receiving orders from customers, then sending text messages to her customers when milk is ready for collection, and because of using ICT, she has had a comparative edge in her dairy business. Demand has been overwhelming and she needs an extra breed of cow to satisfy fully the demand. 

Betty requested a loan, which she will use to buy a quality dairy cow. She wants to buy a distinct breed that is easy to manage and has a natural ability to produce rich creamy milk. The dairy cow will be producing between 15-20 liters of milk a day. The increased milk production will translate to more income and Betty will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. When anybody listens to Betty speak, one would be forgiven for thinking that she is an expert in dairy farming but because of her passion and determination she intends to beat all odds. This loan will permanently change Betty’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Maria to improve her business. Maria opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like long-sleeve and short-sleeve shirts, shorts, and school clothes. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family. She is happy with this loan because it is offered to poor people and will improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy long-sleeve and short-sleeve shirts, shorts, and school clothes

loans.name: Candelario De Jesus

texts.es:
Candelario, de 59 años de edad, está casado y tiene 2 hijos, él y su esposa son pequeños agricultores, su esposa tiene una venta de tortillas.- Candelario desde muy pequeño aprendió a cultivar maíz, oficio que también enseño a sus hijos desde muy temprana edad.-  Todas las mañanas junto a sus hijos caminan aproximadamente 3 kilómetros para llegar al lugar donde tiene los cultivos.

Candelario y su esposa desean ampliar el negocio de las tortillas y el préstamo quieren utilizarlo para comprar más maíz y un granero, esperan abastecerse de materia prima para todo el año, por medio de la venta de tortillas mejoraran su situación económica.

A futuro quieren hacer  reparaciones a su vivienda ya que con el paso del tiempo ha sufrido daños.
texts.en:
Candelario  is 59 years old, married, and has two children. He and his wife are small farmers. His wife sells tortillas, and at a very young age Candelario learned how to grown corn. He taught this trade to his children when they were young too. Every morning he walks about 3 kilometers to his fields with his children. 

Candelario and his wife want to expand the tortilla business and will use the loan to buy more corn and a granary. They plan to stock up with enough raw materials for the entire year and will improve their financial situation by selling tortillas. 

In the future they want to do repairs to their home as it has deteriorated with the passage of time.

loans.use: to buy more corn and a granary.

loans.name: Gregorio De La Paz

texts.es:
Gregorio, de 40 años de edad, desde hace dos años aproximadamente,  vive solamente con sus tres hijos, ya que su esposa lo abandonó hace algunos años, sus hijos están estudiando.- Gregorio es comerciante de ropa, hace algunos años decidió dedicarse a éste tipo de negocio, anteriormente era pescador, pero decidió dejar ese oficio para cuidar más de sus hijos.

Gregorio, quiere ampliar más su negocio y necesita comprar más variedad de ropa, porque para Diciembre siempre aumentan las ventas, viaja un kilómetro todos los días para llegar a su lugar de trabajo, su horario es de 7:00 am a 5:00 pm.

El anhela poder adquirir su propio local para poder comercializar su ropa e incluir además, la venta de zapatos.- Gregorio, sabe que ampliando su negocio percibirá mayores ingresos, para darle a sus hijos una vida estable y a la vez que tengan la oportunidad de poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Gregorio, age 40, has been living alone with his three children for approximately two years.  His wife abandoned him some years ago.  His children go to school.

Gregorio sells clothes.  Some years ago he decided to devote himself to this type of business.  Previously, he was a fisherman.  However, he decided to leave this trade in order to give more care to his children.

Gregorio wants to expand his business more.  He needs to buy a greater variety of clothing because sales always increase in December.  He travels one kilometer every day to get to the place where he works.  His schedule is from 7:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.

He yearns to be able to get his own place to be able to sell his clothes and also include shoe sales.  Gregorio knows that by expanding his business he will get greater income in order to give his children a stable life.  At the same time, they will have the opportunity to be able to continue their education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of clothing.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children. She has a business of operating a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She serves all kinds of people in her restaurant. Margaret has been in this business for the last 16 years. She takes care of additional family members, and she works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, rice, cooking oil, beans, cassava, etc. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring of buying land to start farming. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food and utilities.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, cooking oil, beans, beef, cassava, etc.

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Jemima, at 60 years of age, is a charismatic and helpful woman who works in her farm that she began out of the need to generate income in order to help her family get ahead. She has spent the past 10 years of her life farming. She sells eggs, maize, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. 

Jemima is a go-getter, and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and feed her animals. She is so close with her animals that she has nicknamed one of them “Kipara,” meaning "no feathers on the head." 

Jemima wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her poultry business, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings), which she will use to buy additional poultry. With your loan, Jemima will be able to expand the poultry section of her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. She is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. Jemima dreams of a secure future for her children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry

loans.name: Emmalyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Emmalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen foods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Emmalyn is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

Emmalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy traditional clothing.

loans.name: Miguel Pascual

texts.es: El amplio perfil que le ofrece la carrera de Administración de Empresas es lo que motivo a Miguel a estudiarla, desde que se dio cuenta que existía la carrera le llamo la atención. Lo aprendido lo aplica en su trabajo como agente de ventas su familia lo apoya en todo momento. Miguel ya está a punto de terminar su carrera es por esta razón que solicita el préstamo para comprar una computadora y con ella realizar su trabajo final de su tesis y lograr obtener su licenciatura. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta realizar una maestría sobre Formulación de proyectos.
texts.en:
The broad range of opportunities that the field of Business Administration offers is what drew Miguel to study it; ever since he became aware of this field it attracted his attention. He is applying what he is learning to his job as a travel agent and his family is constantly supportive of him.

Miguel is now about to finish his studies and he is requesting a loan so he can buy a computer which he needs for his final thesis to earn his degree. His future plans include earning a Master's degree in Project Design.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Conie Group

texts.en:
Cornelia is the featured borrower of the Conie Group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines seeking a better income to support their families.

She is a 50-year-old widowed mother of three.  She came to Lebanon to work as a housekeeper after her husband passed away.  She wanted to provide her beloved children a better living and education.  That's why she is working hard to unite with them in the future.

Her acquired loan will be sent to her family in the Philippines to pay for her beloved children's increasing school expenses. 

Cornelia is the second lady from the right with a black top,  Elvie is the first from the right, Akinha is the second lady from the left with a white veil, Jennifer is the lady at the center wearing eyeglasses.

loans.use: to pay for her beloved children's increasing school expenses.

loans.name: Ivania Del Carmen

texts.es: Ivania continua con la venta de ropa nueva y también usada, asi mismo se apoya con los ingresos de su esposo para los gastos principales de sus hijos quienes asisiten a la escuela, ivania es una clienta que viene mejorando su inventario atravez de créditos, con este nuevo préstamo invertirá nuevamente en su negocio para seguir adelante e ir mejorando las ventas ofreciendo mas variedad de productos, comprara pantalones, camisas, pacas variadas de ropa usada.
texts.en: Ivania continues with her sales of new clothing and also selling used clothing. With this she along with her husband's income supports the main expenses of her children who go to school. Ivania is a client who has been improving her inventory through loans. With this new loan she will invest once again in her business to progress and improve her sales offering a greater variety of products. She will buy pants, shirts and various bales of used clothing.

loans.use: to invest in her clothing business. She hopes to increase her sales and get ahead.

loans.name: Angelee

texts.en:
Angelee is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Angelee is 25 years old and has two children who are in school.

Angelee has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Angelee requested a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell in her fruit stand.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Angelee has been in this business for six years. In the future, Angelee would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell in her fruit stand

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 60 years old and married with four children. Elsie works very hard to provide for them.

Elsie runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Elsie has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Elsie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Hung

texts.en:
Hung is a 61-year-old married man living in Ho Chi Minh City. He has one child. He and his wife earn a living running a general store, which they have done for 17 years. Hung would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods and beverages, to stock his general store. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and increase the turnover of his business. 

Hung also hopes that through the loan his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and enable him to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods and beverages, to stock his general store.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a rope making business in the Philippines.

Helen requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her business. Helen has been in this business for 15 years now.

Helen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte _74 Group

texts.es:
Jovita es una mujer de 27 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 4 años, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Cotoca’ ubicada a 18 kilómetros de la capital; es una pequeña ciudad conocida por sus comidas típicas y su artesanía, especialmente de cerámicas. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo. Con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Jovita es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo amarrado, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español por el comercio (segunda de la derecha, blusa rosa, pantalón azul). Su vida la realiza con su hijo de 4 años, viven en casa de sus familiares que es propia y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Sus ganas de triunfar la obligaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; tienda de videos, venta de vajillas, venta de celulares, venta de carne de pollo, venta de flores, servicio de té y taller de costura, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de marcas como; Maybelline, Loreal Paris, CoverGirl y Revlon. Los productos más vendidos son; esmalte de uñas, maquillaje, mascara para pestañas, lápiz labial y otros. “emprendí este negocio porque vi la necesidad de mis amigas que fueron mis primeros clientes, luego de a poco fui encontrando clientes nuevos…” comenta. Esta es su primera actividad su segunda actividad comercial es la venta de refrescos y empanadas los fines de semana en una feria cercana a su domicilio. Su sueño es tener una tienda propia de cosméticos y atender a mucho clientes. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de cosméticos por mayor para tener mayor oferta entre sus clientes. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que  Jovita solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos por mayor para ofertar mayor variedad a sus clientes de temporada
texts.en:
Jovita is 27 years old, single, has a 4 year old son, and runs a business selling cosmetics. She is entrepreneurial, a good mother, cheerful, optimistic, happy, has a good attitude, committed to her work, responsible and hardworking. 

She made her business in the town of Cotoca, located 18 kilometers from the capital; it's a small city known for its traditional foods and handcrafts, especially ceramics. It has a warm, tropical, and humid climate, with temperatures varying throughout the day between 21-35 C. 

Jovita has a brunette complexion, a short stature, and long, black, tied-up hair. Her mother tongue is Guarani and she she speaks Spanish in her business (second from the right, pink shirt, blue pants). Her life has fulfilled with her 4 year old son. They live in their own house with their family and have drinking water, electricity, and a sewage system. 

Their desire to succeed made them form a bank with people who have businesses such as: video store, selling silverware, selling cellphones, selling chicken meat, selling flowers, tea service and sewing workshop, to request a loan and expand their businesses. 

Jovita's business is selling cosmetics from brands such as: Maybelline, Loreal Paris, CoverGirl, and Revlon. The products she sells the most are: nail polish, makeup, mascara, lipstick, and others. "I started this business because I saw the needs of my friends who were my first clients, then little by little I found new clients..." she comments. This is her first business; her second commercial business is selling sodas and empanadas during the weekend at a fair close to her house. Her dream is to have a proper cosmetics store and tend to lots of clients. She wants to start an investment in her business through buying wholesale cosmetics in order to have a better selection for her clients. This is the 4th sequence of loans with this institution in 5 years that  come to fulfill this business.

It's for these reasons that Jovita asks for a loan in order to buy wholesale cosmetics to offer a better variety to her seasonal clients.

loans.use: to buy wholesale cosmetics to offer a better variety to seasonal clients.

loans.name: Cherry Ann

texts.en:
Cherry Ann is 26 years old and married with one child. With her child currently in school, Cherry Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Cherry Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft drinks, biscuits, noodles, shampoo, and bath soap to sell.

Cherry Ann has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft drinks, biscuits, noodles, shampoo, bath soap, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Cherry Ann would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft drinks, biscuits, noodles, shampoo, and bath soap to sell

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is a 49-year-old married woman with eight children. Four of her children are in school, and she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Leonisa has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Leonisa has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Leonisa has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Leonisa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Raul Ernesto

texts.es:
Raúl, de 28 años de edad, está actualmente casado y tiene un hijo de dos años, su esposa es ama de casa.- Raúl, trabaja en su negocio de venta y reparaciones de llantas, hace algunos años atrás el taller era de su papá, pero su padre se lo heredó, él vive a cinco 500 metros del negocio y su horario de atención al cliente es de 6:00 am a 5:00 pm.

Raúl, ha solicitado el crédito para comprar más llantas, el negocio es rentable y percibe buen margen de ganancias, el sueño de Raúl, es ampliar más su negocio y poder emplear a miembros de su familia que lo necesitan, también que su hijo siga estudiando y pueda ir a la universidad.
texts.en:
Raúl is 28 years old, married, and has a two-year-old son. His wife is a housewife. Raul works at his business selling and repairing tires. Several years ago the business belonged to his father, but his father bequeathed it to him.

He lives less than half a mile from the business and he sees customers from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  Raul has asked for this loan so he can buy more tires. The business is profitable and he earns a good margin on his sales. Raul's dream is to expand his business further and to be able to employ family members in need. He also wants his son to be able to continue with his studies and go to university.

loans.use: to buy more tires.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with six children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and is 53 years old.

Helen has an internet café business in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to pay her internet and electric bills. Helen has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay her internet and electric bills.

loans.name: Monica Iveth

texts.es:
Mónica, de 28 años de edad, es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora, se dedica al comercio, ella estudió enfermería, pero debido a los altos índices de desempleo que existen en El Salvador, ha decidido vender ropa, para sustentar a su familia. 

Actualmente vive con sus padres, ellos se dedican a la elaboración de artesanías, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad.- Mónica, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa y joyas en distintos lugares, como en la capital y otros lugares cercanos.- 

Además, desempeña su profesión, solo atiende a personas conocidas en su cantón, porque no tiene tiempo para atender a más. El préstamo será utilizado para comprar más ropa y joyas, ya que para época navideña la venta de estos artículos incrementa, y del ingreso que obtenga podrá darle una mejor alimentación a su hijo y podrá comprarle lo necesario para que estudie el próximo año. 

El sueño de Mónica, es tener un empleo estable en el ministerio de salud pública, en donde pueda tener un salario seguro y mayor al que tiene actualmente.
texts.en:
Mónica is 28 years old. She is a hard-working and enterprising youth who works in commerce. She studied nursing but due to the high levels of unemployment in El Salvador she decided to sell clothing to sustain her family. She currently lives with her parents who make handicrafts. She is a single mother of a 7 year old son.

Monica has been selling clothing and jewellery for 6 years in different places, such as the Capital and other places that are nearby. She also works in her profession, only taking care of people that she knows in her canton as she does not have the time to look after others.

The loan will be used to buy more clothing and jewellery as with the Christmas season sales increase. She will be able to provide better food for her child and buy what is needed for his studies next year. Mónica's dream is to be employment in the Public Health service where she could have a steady salary and more than what she has now.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and jewellery as during the Christmas season the sale of these articles increase.

loans.name: Santos Andres

texts.es:
Santos de 39 años de edad, es casado y tiene cinco hijos, cuatro estudian en la comunidad y uno ya tiene su propio hogar y es independiente. Estudio hasta 1er grado de educación básica, dejo la escuela debido al conflicto armada que hubo en aquella época. Tiene más de treinta años de casado, su esposa es ama de casa y traba los días de semana cuidando una casa en la comunidad.

Santos es agricultor de granos básicos, aprendió de sus padres que lo llevaban con sus hermanos a trabajar, desde que se casó se dedica a criar ganado y cerdos de engorde; también es albañil y cuando trabaja de lunes a sábado sus hijos le apoyan en el cuido de los animales, cuando no trabaja los cuida él y se dedica a l cultivo.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar una vaca y cuatro cerdos de engorde, también para repara las instalaciones donde tiene los cerdos. Sueña con aumentar su producción y cubrir la demanda de carne en la zona además que sus hijos logren estudiar y tengan la oportunidad que él no tuvo.
texts.en:
Santos, 39, is married and has five children. Four study in the community and one has their own home and is independent. He went to school until the first grade of elementary school and left school due to an armed conflict he had at that time. 

He's been married for more than 30years. His wife is a housewife and works weekdays taking care of a house in the community.

Santo is a farmer of basic goods. He learned from his parents and applied that to work with his siblings. Since he married, he's earned a living taking care of cattle and pigs for fattening. 

He's also a mason, and when he works from Monday to Saturday his children help him take care of the animals. When he's not working, he takes care of them and is dedicated to their care.

He's seeking the loan to buy a cow and four pigs to fatten, and also to repair the facility where he keeps the pigs. He dreams of increasing his production and covering the demand for meat in the area, as well as hoping that his children are successful in school and have the opportunity that he did not have.

loans.use: to buy a cow and four pigs for fattening and also to repair the facility where he has the pigs.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married with six children, three of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. Betty resides with her family and has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. 

She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 14 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to purchase more bags of charcoal. Betty works from home seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

She is aspiring to build her rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.es:
Ricarda de 61 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, le quedaba muy lejos la escuela, era muy difícil llegar y sus padres no la motivaron para que estudiara. Tiene 40 años de haberse casado, su esposo es agricultor y en ocasiones trabaja como albañil. Creció ayudando a su padres en las labores agrícolas y de la casa.

Desde que tenía ocho años trabajo con su padre en la siembra de maíz y frijol, desde que se casó cría cerdos y pollos de engorde que vende en la comunidad y en las zonas aledañas; sus hijas le ayudan con la venta de tamales y pan tres veces por semana, le cuesta mucho ya que vive bien retirado de la comunidad más cercana.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar una novilla que pretende desarrollar y reproducir y cuatro cerdos para luego venderlos al peso de sacrificio. Ricarda ha propuesto mejorar el piso de su casa, tiene nietos pequeños y quiero lo mejor para ellos por eso guarda las ganancias de la venta de pan y tamales.
texts.en:
Ricarda is 61 years old, married and has 5 children. she did not have the opportunity to study as she lives far from any school and it was difficult to get there. Her parents weren't motivated to have her study. She has been married for 40 years. Her husband is a farmer and sometimes works as a bricklayer.

She grew up helping her parents with their agricultural work and the housework. She worked with her father in growing corn and beans since she was 8 years old. Since she got married she has raised pigs and chickens to sell in her community and in the neighboring areas. Her children help her with the sales of tamales and bread three times a week. It is a lot of work as they live quite a way from the nearest community.

She is requesting the loan to buy a calf which she wants to grow and reproduce and four pigs to fatten and slaughter. Ricarda proposes to improve the floor of her house as she has small grandchildren and wants the best for them. So she saves the profits from the sales of tamales and bread for this.

loans.use: to buy a calf and 4 pigs.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet, 24, is a smallholder mixed farmer from Kisii, Kenya who is married to a nice 28-year-old man. They have been blessed with three kids so far. She is very hardworking and focused. Her primary income sources today are milk, eggs, and bananas, among other crops. 

Linet is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry. This expansion seeks to enhance her family's financial security. The more hens she acquires, the more assets under her name and the more income she makes through egg sales. The hens will also bring other numerous benefits including chicks, manure and feathers. The income from this investment will enable Linet to take better care of her family and pay for her children's education. 

Lend $25 to improve the quality of life of a wife, a mother, and a progressive lady farmer in Gesusu village.

loans.use: To pay for poultry

loans.name: Laurinda

texts.en: Laurinda is taking a loan of $800 USD to improve her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as coffee, sugar, salt, cigarettes, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and noodles. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600 USD. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar, salt, cigarettes, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and noodles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase coconuts, cashew seeds, and flowers to increase his profits and continue sending his daughters to school.

loans.name: Purification

texts.en:
Purification is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling ice and frozen foods in the Philippines. She is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials and packs of frozen foods to sell for her business. Purification has been in this business for 6 years. She earns more income from a general store.

Purification has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 56 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Maria has a food vending business in the Philippines. Maria requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. Maria has been in this business for two years. In the future, Maria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
An 800 USD loan is offered to Teresa to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital of 300 USD. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like beer, oils, slippers, water, cigarettes, Coca Cola, Sprite, coffee, sugar, salt, milk and bread. She is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk.

Teresa has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business and she is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy beer, oils, slippers, water, cigarettes, Coca Cola, Sprite, coffee, sugar, salt, milk and bread for her kiosk.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo est mère de deux enfants, elle est mariée et âgée de 26 ans, elle fait le commerce des habits pour enfants depuis 2009 et alimentations générale depuis 2013. Elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois  en gros au grand marché de Lomé ou elle les revend en détaille. Avec ce crédit elle veut acheter 10 unités d’habits pour nouveaux nées et 21 unités d’habits pour enfants. Les revenus lui permettront d’aider son mari à faire face aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Adjo is the mother of two children, married, and 26 years old. She has been selling children's clothing since 2009, and various food products since 2013.

Adjo gets her supplies once a month at the big market in Lomé, where she resells them at retail. With this loan, Adjo wants to purchase 10 pieces of newborn clothing and 21 pieces of children's clothing. 

The earnings from this will allow Adjo to help her husband provide for the family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 10 pieces of newborn clothing and 21 pieces of children's clothing

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is 31 years old and is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Suzette has a general store business in the Philippines. Suzette has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Suzette has been in this business for six years. In the future, Suzette would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jayro Adalberto

texts.es:
Jayro de 26 años de edad, es soltero y tiene un hijo de un año de edad,  estudió hasta 8° grado de educación básica, es un joven emprendedor que trabaja para mantener a su hijo y a su madre que padece de una enfermedad respiratoria y él compra sus medicamentos. 

Jayro es comerciante, desde hace un año vende pescado fresco en su comunidad y en las zonas cercanas, tomó la iniciativa al no encontrar trabajo, además cuando era mucho más joven solía ir con un amigo a pescar y al regreso vendían fácilmente lo que atrapaban. Jayro viaja cerca de dos horas a la playa para comprar el pescado se va a las 3:00 am y toma el autobús.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar una motocicleta usada que le vende un amigo le servirá para movilizarse a las comunidades ofreciendo su producto. Su sueño es construir una casa de adobe y poco a poco ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Jayro is 26 years old, single, and has a one year old son. He completed an 8th grade education. He is an enterprising young man who works to support his son and mother who is ill from a respiratory illness and he buys her medicines. Jayro is a businessman who has had a business selling fresh fish in his community and in nearby areas. He has had his business for a year. He started the business on his own initiative when he couldn't find work. When he was younger he used to go out with a friend to fish and upon their return they easily sold what they had caught. Jayro travels 2 hours to the beach to buy the fish, getting up at 3 AM and taking the bus. He seeks a loan to buy a used motorcycle  that a friend is selling that he could use to go to nearby communities to sell his products. His dream is to build an adobe house and little by little improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Rosaline, a hardworking, very honest and warm-hearted farmer who hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya, an area that has one of the best weather patterns on earth that favors farming. Rosaline is the proud mother of six lovely children whom she adores and always protects. Rosaline's upbringing was very challenging, and because of this, she promised herself that she would work hard to get out of poverty. That is why she started farming six years ago. Through farming, she has been able to earn a decent income. Rosaline is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard so that her six children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life. 

Rosaline is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming so that she can use the excess space on her land. She dreams of buying more land and increasing her horticultural farming. Accessing funds is very difficult for a woman in Africa, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, Rosaline is optimistic that her dream will be realized and her life will completely change. Through the income from horticultural farming, Rosaline will assure her children of a bright future and will be able to pay tuition fees for her siblings who depend on her. Through your loan, the promise of supporting small-scale farmers will be achieved.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Delmy Emely

texts.es:
Delmy,  de 41 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado, es casada y es madre de tres hijos, el primero está estudiando en la universidad, el segundo está cursando bachillerato y el ultimo estudia tercer grado.

Delmy, trabaja en un tiendita propia, donde vende productos de primera necesidad, también tiene una pequeña granja de pollos de engorde, la cual le genera ingresos adicionales para el sustento de su familia, sus hijos también le ayudan en los ratos libres, su esposo trabaja en un pickup transportando gente desde el pueblo hacia su comunidad.

Con el crédito, comprará mas productos para surtir la tienda y otra parte del dinero la ocupará para hacer reparaciones en la granja, ya que debido a las lluvias se dañado un poco, ella espera que reparando la granja podrá obtener una mejor producción.

El sueño Delmy, es mejorar la producción en la granja, como también en la tienda y de esta manera generar mejores ganancias, para darle a sus hijos una vivienda digna y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Delmy is 41 years old.  She studied up to the 9th grade, is married, and is the mother of three children.  The first child is studying at the university, the second is a high school student, and the last child is in third grade.  

Delmy works in her own little store where she sells staple goods.  She also has a small barn for fattening chickens, which generates additional income to support her family. Her children also help in their free time.  Her husband works as a driver; transporting people from their village in to the community.

With part of the loan, Delmy will buy more products to stock up her store.  The other part will be used to make repairs to the barn, because the rain has damaged it a little and she hopes repairing it will allow her to get a better production. 

Delmy's dream is to improve production in the barn as well as in the store, and thus generate better profit in order to give her children a decent home and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock up her store and  to make repairs to her barn.

loans.name: Progresan Con Honestidad Group

texts.es:
Margoth tiene 24 años, madre soltera de un menor hijo de dos añitos. Decidió vender pollo broaster, salchipapas por necesidad con el único propósito de darle lo mejor económicamente a su familia.
Con el tiempo y esfuerzo ha implementado su negocio con ventas de bebidas (gaseosas), actualmente su negocio está ubicado en un lugar céntrico que le permite tener mayor clientela. Anhela seguir mejorando su negocio para ello el crédito lo invertirá en comprar mesa y renovar sus utensilios.
Está muy agradecida por el apoyo que recibe de los inversionistas KIVA
texts.en:
Margoth is 24 years old.  She is a single mother to a 2 year old son.  She decided to sell broaster chicken and kebabs since it was the best financial option for her family.  

With time and effort, she has expanded her business to sell drinks (sodas).  Currently her business is located in a central location that allows her to have more customers.  She hopes to continue improving her business, so she is requesting a loan to purchase tables and update her utensils.  

She is very grateful for the support she receives from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tables and utensils.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a woman eager to get ahead. She is a 54-year-old mother who lives with her family in the Litein area of Kenya. She is blessed with three lovely children who are her greatest motivation in life to persevere because she wants to provide them a better future. Annah was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. She is an early riser who goes to her farm to earn a living. 

Annah has space on her farm to use for dairy farming. She respectfully requests a loan to buy a dairy cow. Litein is an area that has a large population and there is a high demand for milk. Annah, being an enterprising person, wants to take full advantage of that need and earn extra income. She hopes that this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and expand her milk-selling business. Annah plans to open a very large milk-selling business in the nearby shopping center and to package milk. She wants to be economically empowered. She knows that accessing funds is challenging, but with partners such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, she feels relieved to know that all her dreams will be achieved and she will be able to provide a secure future for her children and improve her family's living conditions. Annah patiently awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Thelma is 28 years old and all three of her children are in school.

Thelma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Thelma has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Thelma has been in this business for six years. In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
Florencio de 49 años de edad, es soltero y tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos estudian y uno traba en un almacén de productos agrícolas en la ciudad y es quien lo apoya con los gastos de la casa. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que creció solo con su madre y ella no tenía como pagar sus estudios.

Florencio es comerciante, se dedica a vender bebidas frías, pupusas, carnes y demás en las ferias que se desarrollan en la comunidades y tiene 15 años trabajando de esta manera, antes trabajaba descargando cargas de camiones que transportaban mercadería. No tiene un lugar fijo de trabajo ya que depende del lugar donde se desarrolle la feria, los días que no hay feria trabaja como jornalero y albañil.

Solicita el préstamo parar comprar carnes, maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, bebidas y demás para su negocio porque en la comunidad se acercan los días feriados, además le hará unos arreglos al local donde tiene su negocio. Florencio tiene pensado comprar un terreno para poder sembrar sin tener que alquilar.
texts.en:
Florencio is 49 years old, single, and has three children. Two of them are in school and one works at an agricultural products warehouse in the city. He is the one who helps out with household expenses. Florencio did not have the opportunity to go to school as he was raised by a single mother who did not have the money to send him to school. 

Florencio is a merchant, and he sells cold drinks, pupusas (stuffed tortillas), meats, and other things at the local community fairs. He has been doing this for 15 years. Before this he worked at unloading truckloads of merchandise. He does not have a fixed workplace since he goes to wherever the fairs are being held. On days when there are no fairs he works as a day laborer and bricklayer.

He is asking for the loan so he can buy meats, corn, cheese, pork rind, drinks, etc. for his business because soon there will be many fairs in his community. Additionally, he will make some repairs to his stand. He is also planning to buy a piece of land for planting so he will not have to rent.

loans.use: to buy meat, corn, cheese, pork rind, soft drinks, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and has three children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes at the market and has been in this business for 11 years. 

Josephine applied for a loan of 1,100,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works in her shop six days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to start importing used clothes from Japan. 

Josephine resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is 30 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Angelica works very hard to provide for her family.

Angelica runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, detergent soap, sanitary pads, noodles, cooking oil, vinegar, bath soap and toothpaste to sell.

Angelica has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items including those listed above.

Angelica would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, detergent soap, sanitary pads, noodles, cooking oil, vinegar, bath soap and toothpaste to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Caught between unemployment and land fragmentation, many of Kenya’s young people struggle to make their way in the world. But Janet, 37, who is based in the Litein area of Kenya and is a mother, has been practicing mixed farming for the past eight years. She has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. 

Janet passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated, “Feeding my cows." Her hobby is milking Seroi (her dairy cow). She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot fully meet it. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. 

The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to a higher profit margin and an increased income level. Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. 

Janet is very visionary, and she intends that in the near future, she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling, and also through selling dairy products such as yoghurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Johanna Maricela

texts.es:
Johanna de 27 años de edad está casada y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, quería seguir estudiando pero no tenía como pagar sus estudios. Su esposo es albañil, él su hijo y suegra viven con Johanna. Ella es comerciante, se dedica a vender ropa de manera ambulante desde hace 4 años, aprendió trabajando con su hermana mayor cuando la acompañaba en la ruta de venta. Su horario de trabajo varía dependiendo de lo que se tarde en terminar los oficios del hogar.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar por mayores camisas, faldas, ropa interior masculina y femenina y pantalones cortos; de esta manera le sale más barato y tiene un mayor margen de ganancias en la venta. Su sueño es tener un puesto de venta fijo para no tener que andar cargando la ropa, también espera construir su casa para vivir con su familia.
texts.en:
Johanna is 27 years old, married, and has a four year old son.  She has a high school diploma.  She wanted to continue her studies, but she did not have a way to pay for school.  Her husband is a construction worker.  She lives with her husband, her son, and her mother-in-law.  

Johanna has worked for four years as a street vendor selling clothing.  She learned the work from her older sister when she went with her on her sales route.  Her work schedule varies depending on how long it takes her to finish her housework.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase shirts, skirts, shorts, and men's and women's underwear at wholesale, so they will be less expensive and she can have a larger profit margin on her sales.  Her dream is to have a fixed sales location so that she does not have to walk around carrying the clothing.  She also hopes to build a house to live in with her family.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, skirts, shorts, and men's and women's underwear at wholesale.

loans.name: Jia

texts.en:
Jia is 17 years old and is the third child of five children in the family. Her mother Virgie supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Jia is studying toward a Bachelor of Science degree in Agriculture and is currently in the first year of this four-year course.

Jia is borrowing 5,500 PHP to pay her tuition fees for the second semester of the 2014-2015 school year.

When she graduates, Jia plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира является учительницей в средней школе своего села района Шахритус. Ей 41 год. Она замужем и имеет детей. Муж и старший сын находятся за пределами страны на заработках. Замира намерена улучшить финансовое положение семьи и для этого планирует начать новый бизнес в сфере животноводства. Она при дворе имеет коровник, в котором держит дойную корову с теленком для нужд семьи. Теперь она хотела бы выращивать маленьких бычков и телят для дальнейше продажи. На свои сбережения Замира уже приобрела 200 вязок соломы, а для закупа скота она нуждается в кредите. Поддержите Замиру в начинании нового бизнеса.
texts.en: Zamira is a secondary school teacher in her village in the Shahrituz district. She is 41 years old. She is married and has children. Her husband and oldest son work abroad. Zamira intends to improve her family's financial situation and, to accomplish this, is planning to start a new animal husbandry business. She has a cowshed in her yard, where she keeps a dairy cow with a calf for family needs. Now she wants to fatten up young bulls and calves for subsequent resale. Zamira already purchased 200 bales of hay with her savings and needs a loan to buy livestock. Please support Zamira in starting her new business.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to start her own business

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 27-year-old married mother of one child who sells accessories and clothes to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of her family. She has a good reputation among her customers for she is a hard worker and ambitious woman, as she always hopes to expand her business to increase her income and improve her living conditions. 
Besides her business, Khadija always dreams to visit the holy places, thus she is requesting a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to achieve her dream.

loans.use: to visit the holy places.

loans.name: Villa Lopez Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 51 años de edad, soltera, tiene 4 hijos de 20, 15, 10 y 8 años y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de pan tradicional.
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por el creciente comercio informal en todas las áreas, de clima cálido tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura promedio que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados. 
Maria es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español para el comercio (de rodillas al centro, usa blusa azul). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos, todos estudian en la escuela y ayudan en el negocio, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con electricidad, agua potable y alcantarillado. Sus deseos por prosperar en su negocio la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de sándwiches, artesanía en yeso, venta de refrescos, librería, venta de ropa, venta de fruta y venta de tomates, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la panadería, que realiza en su domicilio para comercializarlo en el mismo lugar y también realiza entregas por mayor a tiendas. Sus variedad más horneadas son; Tanta Wawas (hecho en  forma de hombre, mujer, escalera, animalitos, etc.), Pan Chamillo (Se lo prepara con harina integral de trigo), Bollo Preñao (pan dulce, centro de mermelada), el cuñapé (a base de queso), el sonso (a base de yuca), el pan de arroz (a base de harina de arroz), y otros. “mis recetas son herencia familiar, antes trabaja con mis hermanos, actualmente trabajo con mis hijos…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una panadería completa y grande. Ella desea realizar la compra de harina de diferentes tipos (de arroz, de maíz, blanca, etc.) por mayor, para tener material con el cual trabajar en las fiestas navideñas y de año nuevo. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 25 años que viene realizando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de harina por mayor para satisfacer la demanda de temporada.
texts.en:
Maria is a 51-year-old woman, single, she has 4 children who are 20, 15, 10, and 8 years old, and her business is to make and sell traditional bread.
She is entrepreneurial, a good mother, cheerful, optimistic, happy, with a good attitude, responsible, and hard-working. She has her business in the South region of the city, which is characterized by growing informal trade in every area. It has a warm and humid tropical climate, with an average temperature that varies throughout the day between 21-35 degrees centigrade.

Maria has a dark complexion, long tied black hair, short stature; her mother tongue is Guarani and she speaks Spanish when selling (she is on her knees in the center, wearing a blue shirt). She shares her life with her children, they all attend school and help with the business. They live in their own home, made of brick and cement, which has electricity, potable water, and a sewage system. Her wishes to prosper with her business led her to form a "bank" of people with businesses such as: sandwich sales, plaster craftwork, beverage sales, bookstore, clothing sales, sale of fruit and tomatoes; to ask for a loan and expand her business. Her business is the bakery, which she has in her home and sells in the same place, and she also makes deliveries at wholesale to stores. Her most popular selection of baked goods are: Tanta Wawas (made in the shape of men, women, ladders, small animals, etc.), Pan Chamillo (prepared with whole wheat flour), Bollo Preñao (sweet bread, with a jam filling), cuñapé (made with cheese), sonso (made with yucca), rice bread (made with rice flour), and others. “My recipes are my family inheritance, I used to work with my siblings, now I work with my children…”she says. 
Her dream is to have a large and fully-fitted bakery. She wishes to make a purchase of different types of flour (rice, corn, white, etc.) at wholesale, to have ingredients to work with during Christmas and New Year’s holidays. This is the first loan sequence with the institution, for 25 years she has been doing this work independently.
It is for these reasons that Maria asks for a loan for the purchase of flour at wholesale to satisfy the demand of the season.

loans.use: to purchase more flour at wholesale to satisfy the demand of the season.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is single and has a buy and sell feed business in the Philippines.

Belinda requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed to sell.

Belinda has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Belinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed to sell.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Cecil successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Cecil's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is taking a loan of $1000.00 to improve her business. She is married and she is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as sugar, salt, milk, cigarettes, coffee, noodles, slippers and fish. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.00. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, milk, cigarettes, coffee, noodles, slippers and fish.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru:
Дилафруз 30-летняя замужняя женщина, имеющая маленьких детей. Ее муж работает на стройке. Сама Дилафруз год назад начала животноводческий бизнес, чтобы помогать мужу в обеспечении семьи. Она занимается выращиванием коров и быков. Одновременно Дилафруз работает уборщицей в школе. Она трудолюбивая и усердная женщина, стремящаяся работать во благо сеьми. 
Дилафруз сейчас в своем скотном дворе имеет одного лишь быка и для продолжения деятельности ей необходимо закупить еще пару маленьких бычков. С такой целью она обратилась за кредитом и ожидает финансовую поддержку, поскольку собственных средств не имеет.
texts.en: Dilafruz is a 30-year-old married woman, who has young children. Her husband works at a construction site. Dilafruz started her own animal husbandry business a year ago to help her husband provide for the family. She is involved in fattening up cows and bulls. Concurrently, Dilafruz works as a janitor at a school. She is a hardworking and diligent woman, aspiring to work for her family's well-being. Now Dilafruz only has one bull on her livestock yard and needs to buy a couple of young bulls in order to continue her business. To achieve this goal, she requested a loan and awaits financial support because she does not have her own means.

loans.use: to buy a couple of young bulls in order to continue her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to further stock her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es comerciante, desde hace 18 años vende tamales actividad que aprendió trabajando con su madre y es ahora su única fuente de ingreso; en la actividad le apoyan sus hijas a quien también está enseñando a trabajar pues ellas son las encargadas de vender los tamales a los vecinos, por lo general trabaja 4 días a la semana.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción, cemento, arena, ladrillo y demás para reparar su casa, construir una pila para recoger agua y construir una habitación. Rosa solo espera tener salud para trabajr y dar estudio universitario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a vendor who has been selling tamales for 18 years. She learned the job working with her mother and it is now her only source of income. Her daughters support her in her work and she is teaching them the job, since they are the ones who sell the tamales to the neighbors. In general, she works four days a week.  

She is requesting this loan to buy construction materials, cement, sand, bricks and such to repair her house, build a tank to collect water and another bedroom. Rosa only hopes to remain healthy so she can work and send her children to university.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, cement, sand, bricks and such to repair her house, build a tank to collect water and another bedroom.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en: Rona is a young mother to her four year old son. She is from Carles, Iloilo. Out of her child's needs, she learned to invest in fishing together with her husband. Fishing has been their source of income for four years now. She is asking for a loan to buy crude oil as fuel for their fishing boat. It is the means so they can continue fishing without delay. Rona is confident that they can continue to expand their business with the help of the loan. In the future, she hopes to have other other business options to increase profitability.

loans.use: to buy crude oil.

loans.name: Mehrangez

texts.ru: Мехрангез молодая девушка 24 лет. Она не замужем. У нее есть высшее образование. Она работает в  ЗАО Хумо кассиром .  Она  обратилась  в МДО Арванд узнав о  новом продукте «Тахсил» решила для  своего лучшего развития воспользоваться этой услугой и приобрести  компьютер. Заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Mehrangez is a 24-year-old young woman. She is not married. She has a college education. She works as a cashier at the Humo microfinance organization. She came to MDO Arvand upon learning about a new product, called "Tahsil," and decided to use this service for her personal development and purchase a computer. She is grateful in advance for the support and trust.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Yuri Xiomara

texts.es:
Yuri de 22 años es soltera y no tiene hijos, estudió hasta bachillerato y por el momento vive con sus padres. Yuri apoya a sus padres en el negocio familiar, ellos tiene una panadería y atiende a los clientes que llegan a comprar a la casa, cada una de las personas que vive en la casa tiene una función específica para salir a tiempo con las tareas del hogar y las del negocio antes de salir a repartir los pedidos.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar harina, maneca, levadura, jaleas y demás para elaborar pan con el dinero en mano podrán realizar en un menor tiempo todas sus proyecciones. Yuri sueña con tener un negocio propio don de perciba mejor las ganancias, construir su casa y tener una familia.
texts.en:
Yuri is 22 years old, single, and has no children. She studied up to graduation from high school and, so far, still lives with her parents. Yuri helps her parents in the family business; they have a bakery and she attends to customers who come to their house to make purchases. Each person residing in the home has a specific function to carry out in household tasks, including those of the business, prior to departing to deliver the orders.

Yuri is requesting this loan to buy wheat flour, lard, yeast, jelly and other ingredients for baking bread. With the money, they will be able to fulfill all their production plans in a short time.

Yuri dreams of having her own business and receiving better earnings, constructing her own house and having a family.

loans.use: purchase wheat flour, lard, yeast, and jelly for the family bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a land surveyor device for his work

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is a 41-year-old married mother of three who started her own business five years ago. Her business has to do with selling women's accessories, beauty creams and perfumes, in addition to selling mobile phone prepaid cards.

Samia is a hardworking woman who puts so much effort into supporting her family and covering their increasing living needs, as well as spending her free time in something useful. Samia is well known in her region with her good reputation, in addition to the special quality and prices she provides.
