Samia is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her mobile phone prepaid card capital, especially before the coming Christmas and New Year seasons where they are highly requested by her customers to contact and send greetings to their beloved family members and friends.

Samia hopes to stay capable of increasing her business capital and expanding her working sector to cover as much as she can of customers' requests.

loans.use: To increase her mobile phone prepaid card capital, especially before the coming Christmas and New Year seasons

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 50 years old and has eight children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Cecelia is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Cecelia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her cattle.

Cecelia has been raising cattle for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cecelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her cattle

loans.name: Armi

texts.en:
Armi works hard to support her family. Armi is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Armi requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Armi has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Armi would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Estelita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Estelita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Estelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Mirzoahmad

texts.ru: Мирзоахмад житель кишлака Гулистан Шахристанского района. Мирзоахмад  занимается с детства скотоводством. Он женат. В настоящее время он отец пятерых детей. У него сыновья выросли уже зарабатывают самостоятельно в Российской Федерации. Мирзоахмад сотрудничает С МДО Арванд с 2006 года. Он хочет улучшить свою семейную жизнь в  лучшую сторону.  Он хочет получить кредит на покупку скота, но для этого у него хватает собственных средств. Он обратился в МДО Арванд для получения кредита. Он заранее благодарит за поддержку и сотрудничество.
texts.en: Mirzoahmad is a resident of the Gulistan village of the Shahrituz district. Mirzoahmad has been involved in animal husbandry since his childhood. He is married and currently a father of five children. His sons have grown up and already earn a living independently in the Russian Federation. Mirzoahmad has been partnering with MDO Arvand since 2006. He wants to improve his family's life. He wants to obtain a loan to buy livestock because he does not have enough of his means to make this purchase. He came to MDO Arvand to obtain this loan. He is grateful in advance for the support and partnership.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Kamolliddin

texts.ru: Камолиддин   родился  в кишлаке  Нофароч   Истаравшанского  района в семье  дехканина. Ему 30 лет. Он  женат  и имеет троих  детей.  Камолиддин  занимается  животноводством и земледелием. Кроме того он работает строителем на стройке. Камолиддин хочет увеличить численность голов скота. Он обратился в МДО Арванд для получения кредита.Камолиддин очень доволен и он заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en: Kamolliddin was born into a dekhan farmer family in the Nofaroch village of the Istaravshan district. He is 30 years old. He is married and has three children. Kamolliddin is involved in animal husbandry and farming. Besides this, he works as a construction worker at a construction site. Kamolliddin wants to increase his livestock headcount. He came to MDO Arvand to obtain a loan. Kamolliddin is very happy and grateful for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to increase his livestock headcount

loans.name: Mirna Lissette

texts.es:
Mirna de 24 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 7, 5 y 2 años de edad que están estudiando 2nd y kínder en la escuela de la comunidad, el menor no estudia. Ella no estudió porque sus padres no podían pagar el estudio, con ella viven sus padres, una hermana y tres sobrinos además de sus hijos.

Mirna es ama de casa y trabaja como empleada doméstica desde que tenía 8 años de edad, comenzó trabajando en las casa de sus vecinos y hoy en día tiene 5 años de trabajar en la ciudad donde trabaja 14 días seguidos para tener derecho a un domingo libre que aprovecha para estar con su familia. Se queda donde trabaja ya que su jornada empieza en la madrugada y termina en la noche y no tiene el tiempo ni el dinero para viajar todos los días.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar un  terreno donde piensa construir su casa, ya tiene una parte del dinero y le falta el complemento. Sueña con tener su propia casa y dar el estudio a sus hijos para que tenga la oportunidad que ella no.
texts.en:
Mirna is 24 years old, single and has three children, aged 7, 5 and 2. They attend, respectively, the second grade and Kindergarden of the local elementary school, while the youngest stays at home. Mirna did not go to school because her parents could not afford to send her. She lives with her parents, a sister, three nephews and her children.
Mirna is a homemaker and has been working as housekeeper since the age of 8. She started working in the neighbor's house and nowadays has been working in the city for five years, where she works 14 days straight to be entitled to one Sunday off, which she takes advantage of to spend time with her family.
She lives where she works because she starts home at dawn and gets back at night and she does not have the money or the time to make this journey every day.
She is asking for the loan to buy a lot where she intends to build a house. She has saved part of the money needed but is still missing some for the full amount. She dreams of having a house of her own and giving her children the education and opportunities that she did not have.

loans.use: to buy a lot where she wants to build a house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, lime, propane gas etc. for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 38-year-old married mother of three children who has worked from her house for five years as a hairdresser and cosmetics saleswoman to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family.

Lina is a hard worker and ambitious woman who is trying desperately to develop her business and provide her family with better life. Therefore, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with cosmetics to satisfy her customers, as she wants to cover her child's necessary surgery. She wishes her child will get well soon as she hopes to open her own beauty salon in the future to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with cosmetics and to cover her child's necessary surgery

loans.name: Uniendo Fuerzas Group

texts.es: El grupo “UNIENDO FUERZAS” está conformada por socios responsables en sus cuotas de grupos. Cinthia tiene 33 años de edad es soltera con una hija de 04 años educando. Ella presta servicios de fisioterapia  en una clínica de rehabilitación hace unos años y a la vez presta servicios particulares a domicilio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para su vivienda. Su mayor deseo es construir su vivienda. En el grupo cumple la función de tesorera. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Cinthia es la que tiene a su hija en brazos.
texts.en:
The Uniendo Fuerzas group is made up of members who have been responsible with group loans.  Cinthia is 33 years old, single, and has a four year old daughter who attends school.  She has provided physical therapy services at a rehabilitation clinic for years and also provides in-home services.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase construction materials for her home.  Her greatest hope is to build her home.  She is the group's treasurer.

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan provided.  Cinthia is the one in the photo holding her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en: Dilbar is an industrious and smart woman who was born in 1979. Dilbar is married and has two children. Her husband is an entrepreneur. Dilbar has her own business where she sells food items. Dilbar has been busy with this business for more than seven years. She is very sociable woman and gives each customer her individual attention. Dilbar wants to increase her working capital for the New Year season to attract more customers. Dilbar is asking for a loan of 15,000 TJS to buy food items as eggs, sugar, butter, bread, rolls, and candies. She awaits your support and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: To buy food items as eggs, sugar, butter, bread, rolls, and candies.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is married with six children. All her children go to school. She also takes care of her sister. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees. She has a business of selling milk and bread. She has been in this business for three years. She works from her home seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves, and defaulters. She has applied for loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bread and milk. She is aspiring to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy jerricans of milk and loaves of bread

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 48-year-old married mother of eight children, four currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Josephine has a business making dried fish in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish and seasonings for her business.

Josephine has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish and seasonings for her business

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is a 53-year-old married mother of four children, one still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jovita has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. Jovita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Jovita has been in this business for 18 years. Jovita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Samoun's Group

texts.en: A local farmer living in Kampong Speu province, Samoun is 56 years old and a mother of five children. She grows rice on one and a half hectares of land. She earns additional income by working for others for a fee. She earns her about 25,000 KHR per day. This is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of four members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's health with sanitary facilities.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est née en 1969 à Sagbado. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle fait le commerce de petits poissons il y a 15 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au Ghana. Avec ce crédit elle peut aller 2 fois mois au Ghana au lieu de 4 fois  et peut acheter 2 douzaines de poissons et avoir plus de stocks. Ceci lui permet d’avoir plus de revenu et aider son mari à faire face aux charges de familles.
texts.en: Afi was born in 1969 in Sagbado. She is married with four children. She has been selling small fish for 15 years. She buys her supplies in Ghana. This loan will make it possible for her to go to Ghana less often, only twice each month instead of four times and to buy two dozen fish which will give her more stock. This will enable her to make more income and to help her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy two dozen fish and one packet of sachets.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Это Мавчуда. Ей 37 лет. Она живет в маленьком городке гордо носящий имя великого писателя и героя Республики Таджикистана Мирзо Турсунзаде. Мавчуде разведена с мужем живет одна с детьми. Она зарабатывает на жизнь и кормит своих детей за счет своих услуг. Она предоставляет услуги портнихи. Место ее работы является ее дом. Она дома принимает заказы. Для нее работать дома очень выгодно и удобно. Мавчуда может заниматься домашними делами, следить за детьми и шить. Сейчас возникли проблемы, по которым она не может продолжить свою работу. Ее швейная машинка сломалась и ей срочно надо приобрести новую. Мавчуда не хочет терять источник дохода и прости кредит, чтобы приобрести новую машинку.
texts.en: This is Mavjuda. She is 37 years old. She lives in a small town, proudly named after the great writer and hero of the Tajikistan Republic, Mirzo Tursunzada. Mavjuda is divorced from her husband and lives with her children. She earns a living and provides for her children by providing her service. She provides seamstress services. Her home is her place of work, where she accepts orders. It is very convenient and comfortable for her to work at home. Mavjuda can concurrently be involved in household work, watch after the children and sew. Now she has run into problems, due to which she cannot continue her work. Her sewing machine has broken down and she has to urgently buy a new one. Mavjuda does not want to lose her income source and is requesting this loan to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine in order to retain her income source

loans.name: Volida

texts.ru: 32-летняя Волида является жительницей района Б.Гафурова города Худжанд. По профессии она швея и занимается швейным делом на протяжении 5 лет. Ее муж мастер по ремонту домов. Двое дочерей учатся в школе, а сын еще маленький, ему 5 лет. В районе, в котором живет Волида в зимний период отключают электроэнергию и дают по лимиту. Поэтому с началом зимы Волида в доме использует отопительную систему, работаеющего на угле. К сожалению сейчас в их семье нет сбережений, чтобы запастись углем и в связи с этим Волида решила получить кредит. Без данного кредита их дом лишится теплоты в суровую зиму. Поэтому Волида очень надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: 32-year-old Volida is a resident of the B. Gafurov district of the city of Khujand. She is a seamstress and has been involved in sewing for 5 years. Her husband is a housing repair contractor. Two of their daughters attend a school, and their son is still very young - he is 5 years old. In the district, where Volida lives, electricity in turned off and provided in minimal amounts during the winter period. This is why, with the onset of winter, Volida uses a coal-based heating system at home. Unfortunately, now her family does not have savings to stock up on coal, and this is why Volida decided to obtain a loan. Without this loan, their house will be left without heat in a severe winter. This is why Volida truly relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy coal in order to heat her house during the winter

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with a daughter who is in school. She also takes care of her mother. Charity sells soft drinks on a retail basis at the market. She has been in this business for the last 10 years, working seven days a week. She also weaves mats for additional income. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more pineapples, watermelons, passion fruit, and oranges for making juice, boxes of mineral water and crates of soda. Her business challenges includes electricity costs and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to get a better kiosk so as to attract more customers. She lives in rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: To buy oranges, passion fruit, mangoes, crates of soda, and watermelon

loans.name: Ayyad

texts.en:
Ayyad is a 27-year-old married man from Khanyounis who lives with his wife in a small house. He works as an employee in a local firm and earns a low income. Ayyad wanted to improve his family living conditions and increase his income so he decided to find an additional job. He opened a stall for selling toys in the city. It is a good business and provides the family with a good income. 
Ayyad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him to buy more toys for his stall. This will increase his sales and also his income. 
Ayyad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more toys to resell in his stall.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 49 years old and has eight children. Avelina is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Avelina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Avelina requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Avelina has been in the business of pig fattening for four years now.

Avelina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 49 years old, married and has four children, one still in school.

Merlinda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Merlinda has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Merlinda would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es: Rosa es comerciante, vende frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal de su comunidad, aprendió de su madre que se dedica a la misma actividad,  tiene una pequeña granja de pavos que quiere mejorar y recibe ayuda económica de sus hijos cada 15 días. Solicite el préstamo para comprar alimento concentrado y otros productos para terminar de criar a los pavos de la granja. Rosa quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y para ello trabajara duro en su granja, ya que le da muy buenos resultados.
texts.en:
Rosa is a merchant who sells fruits and vegetables at the municipal market in her community.  She learned from her mother who worked doing the same thing.  She also has a small turkey farm that she wants to improve.  She receives financial help from her children every two weeks.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase concentrated feed and other products to finish raising her turkeys.  Rosa wants to improve her quality of life, so she is working hard at the farm, since it is giving her very good results.

loans.use: to purchase concentrated feed and other products to finish raising turkeys.

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en: Residing in Kampong Speu province, Sophy is 25 years old and a mother of one child. She earns income to support her family by rice cropping. This is the first loan for Sophy from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get the loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's health with sanitary facilities.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Latré Amivi

texts.fr: Amivi est âgée de 34 ans, elle est née à Lomé. Elle est mariée et sans enfant. Elle est coiffeuse et vend aussi des mèches. Ce crédit lui permet d’acheter 3 et démi douzaines de mèches. Elle s’approvisionne trois fois part mois au grand marché de Lomé. Ces revenus lui permettrons d’aider son mari apprendre ne charges les dépenses de la famille
texts.en: Amivi is 34 years old, she was born in Lome. She is married with no children. She is a hairdresser and also sells hair extensions. This loan will enable her to buy three and a half dozen locks of hair. She buys her supplies three times each month at the big market in Lome. This income will enable her to help her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy three and a half dozen locks of hair.

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.en: Reyhan is 48 years old. She is not married. Reyhan lives with her elderly mother in the Agdash region. She has ran a business selling clothes for 25 years with help from her mother, and she also earns additional income from raising livestock. This loan is important for her to purchase new stock of winter clothing to cover her customers' orders. Her products are on display at her home and she also works as a street vendor on an order basis. Reyhan's  monthly income from this business is 300 AZN. This is going to be her second loan and she has good loan history.

loans.use: to purchase new stock of winter clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish balls, kikiam, siomai, hot dogs, cooking oil and seasonings

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 38 years old, married and has four children, three currently in school.

Paulina is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Paulina requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins, feed and other supplies for her livestock.

Paulina has been raising livestock for six years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Paulina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, feed and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 46 years old and married with two children.  

Rosalinda is in the agricultural business, farming bananas in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Rosalinda has been farming bananas for 20 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is a 33-year-old single father of two children, ages 2 and 5. He runs a produce business where he buys and sells beans, bananas and maize. He started the business in 2010 and works four days a week and nine hours a day.
He was motivated by the profitability of the business. He mainly sells his goods to people in Kyotera and surrounding areas. He hopes to use the loan to buy beans and corn to sell since he is buying them cheaply this season. He will be able to make good sales later in January. 
He faces a challenge of limited capital and lack of enough storage facilities which affect his crops. He is described as an honest and hard-working businessman.
He appreciates the services offered by lenders.

loans.use: To buy beans and corn

loans.name: Komlan  Casimir

texts.fr: Casimir est né en 1986 à Lomé. Il est marié et père de trois enfants. Il fait le commerce de maïs depuis 2009. Il s’approvisionne  2 fois par mois au marché de Wahala. Avec ce crédit il va acheter 4 sacs de maïs pour augmenter son stock. Les revenus de son activités lui permette de faire face au besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Casimir was born in Lome in 1986. He is married with three children. He has been selling corn since 2009. He buys his supplies twice a month at the market in Wahala. With this loan he will buy four sacks of corn to increase his stock. The income from his business enables him to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of corn.

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en: Thuy, 34, lives with family members in a rural area of the Kampong Speu province. To tackle her family’s hardships, she grows rice on two hectares of land. Her husband is a blacksmith. She can earn about 30,000 KHR per day. This is Thuy's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of eight members to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family can live healthier than before.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Mashhura

texts.en: Mashhura was born in 1977. She lives with her husband and three children in Tajikistan. Mashhura’s children are non-adults. She is the main feed-keeper of her family as her husband is a rental worker and has a small income. Mashhura has run her business more than 10 years. She has been busy with buying and selling food items. Mashhura sells food items in a shop, which is located near her living house. She works hard every day for 10 hours. Mashhura is asking for a loan because she needs your financial support. She must pay for the education of her children in school. She is asking for a loan of 1,200 USD to pay for the education of her children. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en: Nilufar is a married mother of four children. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. Nilufar is the smarter member of her family. She has been busy with animal husbandry. Nilufar started this business one month ago because she needed money to support her children with all necessary things. She feeds cows at her house where she has a big cowshed. Nilufar is going to increase the number of cows she feeds and in this way develop her business further. Nilufar is asking for a loan of $600 USD to buy a cow. She awaits your kindness and in advance thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buya  cow to increase her herd

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married with two children, one of whom goes to school. She takes care of additional family members. 

Grace has a boutique business and has been in this business for 6 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,100,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She works in a shop and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel de 45 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo que está estudiando. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, su esposa es ama de casa y solo ella y su hijo viven con él.

Manuel es agricultor desde que tenía 15 años de edad, acompañaba su padre a trabajar en los cultivos pero también trabajaba como jornalero. Heredó de sus padres 30,000 mts cuadrados de terreno que los cultiva desde hace 5 años. También es comerciante de ganado, comprar animales flacos y los engorda para después venderlos.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar 6 reses de repasto que piensa vender más adelante ya engordadas. Manuel espera le resulte la inversión pues piensa alimentar los animales con los residuos de las cosechas.
texts.en:
Manuel is 45 years old, married and has a son who is studying. He did not have the opportunity to study. His wife is a housewife and only her and his son live with him.

Manuel has been a farmer since he was 15. He accompanied his father to work in the fields and he also worked as day labor. He inherited 30,000 square meters of land where he has raised crops for the past 5 years. He is also a cattle businessman. He buys thin animals and fattens them to sell later.

He is requesting a loan to buy 6 cattle that he is thinking of selling later on when they are fattened. Manual hopes that the investment is successful as he wants to feed the animals with the remains of the harvest.

loans.use: to buy 6 cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new stylish clothes to resale.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Dairy farming is more of a passion for Cynthia than a business. She started pursuing her passion in the year 2009. She is a hard-working and honest farmer who is based in Kapkoros, a remote village in the Litein area of Kenya. She is a proud mother. For the past six years she has been making a small living through mixed farming. Her primary source of income has been selling milk and eggs to the nearby market. She also engages in a personal business or “side hustle” as she likes to call it, to earn additional income. Cynthia passionately loves dairy farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is accessing funds to increase her business. Through Juhudi Kilimo, an organization that supports enterprising farmers, she acquired her first loan which she used to buy an additional cow. She paid the loan back fully. She also benefited from training and the impact of the first loan cannot be underestimated. Cynthia is seeking another loan from Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva lenders, to buy a quality breed of dairy cow. The cow she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 15-20 liters of milk a day. A liter of milk costs 50 KES; this means she will be making 11 USD a day. From this loan, the life of Cynthia will permanently change and she will be able to secure the future of her school-going children. She will also assure her aging parents of a secure future. Cynthia waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, three in school. She sells milk at the market, both retail and wholesale She serves all kinds of people. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She takes care of additional family members and she works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy milk, loaves of bread and margarine. Her major challenge includes perish-ability of milk. She aspires to buy a better refrigerator to keep her milk fresh. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses includes food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy milk, loaves of bread and margarine

loans.name: Nida Group

texts.en:
Nida Group is a group composed of three Filipino ladies wishing to acquire a loan from Al Majmoua. They work in Lebanon to provide their families a better living. They decided to join hands and establish the group because they need support with their financial expenses. 

Nida is the featured borrower of Nida group; she is a 45-year-old married mother of five children. She has worked hard to provide them with the best education for a bright future. Nida came to Lebanon to work as a housekeeper, but her acquired income isn't enough to cover their increasing living needs. Thus, she started her own Filipino cooking business to increase her income and make sure she can develop her children and family's living. Her acquired loan will be invested in developing her cooking business, especially for the coming Christmas and New Year seasons where she must be ready for customers' requests, and she will send part of the loan to her beloved family to enjoy the coming Holy Seasons.

Nida is the lady at the center of the picture with pink top. The other members include Evelyn (on the left with grey top), and Rose Marie (on the right with purple top).

loans.use: to invest in developing her cooking business, especially for the coming Christmas and New Year seasons

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en: Jovelyn is a general store owner who has run her business for 10 years and still aims for continuous growth.To help realize her goals, she is seeking a loan of PHP 5,000.She will use this loan to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, bread, canned goods and cooking oil to sell. She believes that through her requested loan, she could obtain greater income, educate her youngest child and sustain their basic necessities. Jovelyn is looking forward for approval of her requested loan.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, bread, canned goods and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita works hard to support her family. Rosita is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Rosita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Rosita has been in this business for 20 years now.

Rosita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Liua

texts.en: Liua is a 69-year-old widow with eight children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 10 years. Liua needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2004. Liua will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, and a spade

loans.name: Sabinah

texts.en:
“When women come together, they are powerful,” says Sabinah, a 26-year-old farmer who has two children and lives in the village of Igoji in the Nkubu area of Kenya. 

As a girl, she watched women in her village mobilize to replace traditional thatched roofs with waterproof corrugated iron. The memory of this collective effort led her to join Gicici self-help group. 

For the past four years she has been actively involved in mixed farming, and because she is from rural Kenya, gender roles still adhere and women do the heavy work of fetching and carrying water and fuel wood, in addition to household chores, childcare, and tending crops. Many are left to run farms alone while their husbands migrate in search of paid employment. This has not been a setback because Sabinah has been making great profits in farming. 

Nkubu is one of the places that has favorable conditions that favor horticulture farming; that is, good climate, soils, transport system, and market. Sabinah has always wanted to diversify and start horticulture farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is lack of funds to get the business off the ground. 

She is requesting a loan to start horticulture farming. Through Gicici self-help group, which is a group where members co-guarantee each other to secure a loan, she joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a micro finance that supports young and enterprising farmers. 

With your loan, she intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers, and potatoes. Proximity to an airstrip will allow her to transport the produce faster to an international market, hence making more money. This loan will improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for labour to hoe his fields, plant out seedlings, buy fertiliser, transport and store food products.

loans.name: Mi Cajero Group

texts.es: El grupo “MI CAJERO” está conformada por socios dedicados al comercio minorista. Jacinta tiene 47 años de edad es soltera con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas gaseosas comida rápida hace varios años en el quiosco que tiene en las afueras de su vivienda.  El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas productos golosinas gaseosas galletas y frutas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Jacinta es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste chompa marro y polo azul.
texts.en:
The “Mi Cajero” group is made up of members who work in retail sales.  Jacinta is 47 years old.  She is single, with three dependent children.  For several years she has worked selling snacks, soda, and quick meals in a kiosk that she has outside her home.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of more products: snacks, soda, cookies, and fruit.  

The group is thankful to Kiva investors for the loan that was granted.  

Jacinta is the third one from the lefthand side, dressed in a brown sweater and blue top.

loans.use: to buy more snacks, soda, cookies, and fruit.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: José tiene 44 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos. José es un hombre emprendedor y muy dedicado a su familia, quien desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio de su negocio de tienda y venta de cocos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de cocos, cereales, golosinas, pan dulce, aceite, etc. para aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 44 years old and lives in his own home, together with his partner and his two children.  

José is an enterprising man who is very dedicated to his family.  He wants to improve their living conditions by means of his store and coconut sales.  Because of this, he is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the bulk purchase of coconuts, cereal, snacks, pastries, oil, etc., in order to increase his income and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, cereals, snacks, pastries, oil, etc., to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.name: Virgen De La Puerta Group

texts.es: Irene tiene 27 años de edad es conviviente con una hija educando. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de queso hace 07 años. y a la vez presta servicios de domestica. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más queso para obtener mejores ganancias. En el grupo “VIRGEN DE LA PUERTA2 cumple la función de presidenta. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Irene es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste polo celestes y chompa negra.
texts.en:
Irene is 27 years old.  She is in a live-in relationship and has a daughter in school.  For seven years she has worked buying and selling cheese, while also working as a domestic worker.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of more cheese, in order to get better earnings.  

She has the role of president in the “Virgen de la Puerta 2” credit group.  The group is grateful to Kiva investors for this loan.  

Irene is the third one from the lefthand side, dressed in a light blue top and a black sweater.

loans.use: to buy more cheese

loans.name: Jonibek

texts.ru: Чонибек родился в семьи дехкан. Ему 30 лет. Чонибек  женат  и имеет двоих детей. Чонибек  вместе с женой живет дружно и счастливо. Они стараются воспитать своих детей хорошими людьми. По профессии Чонибек шофер. У него есть грузовая машина. Ежемесячно он зарабатывает 2000 сомони, предоставля услуги по перевозке грузов. Ещё он занимается  животноводством и дехканством . Чонибек сотрудничает более 3 лет с МДО Арванд. Он хочет получить  кредит для расширение дехканства и животноводства.  Заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Jonibek was born into a dekhan farming family. He is 30 years old. Jonibek is married and has two children. Jonibek and his wife live amiably and happily. They try to raise their children to be good people. Jonibek is a driver and owns a truck. He earns 2000 somoni per month by providing transportation services. He is also involved in animal husbandry and farming. Jonibek has been partnering with MDO Arvand for over 3 years. He wants to obtain a loan to expand his farming and animal husbandry businesses. He is grateful in advance for the support and trust.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to expand his farming and animal husbandry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a small pick-up, more cocoa plants, crops, a wheelbarrow, a crowbar, a shovel, and a new chainsaw

loans.name: Esfuerzo De Mujeres Group

texts.es: El grupo esfuerzo de mujeres estas conformada por socias dedicadas al comercio minorista. Geronima tiene 56 años de edad es soltera. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas comida gaseosas hace 02 años en un puesto de mercado. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más frutas gaseosas agua y el mejoramiento de su puesto de trabajo. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Geronima es la que tiene puesto su mandil blanco
texts.en:
The “Esfuerzo de Mujeres” [Women’s Effort] group is made up of members who work in retail sales.  Geronima is 56 years old and single.  She has worked selling fruits, meals, and soda for two years in a market stand.  She will use this loan to buy more fruit, soda, and water, and to improve her stand.  The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for this loan.  

Geronima is the one wearing a white apron.

loans.use: to buy more fruit, soda, and water

loans.name: Shaiymbu

texts.ru: Шайымбу погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Шайымбу есть 10 коров, 15 овец и 0,19 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает люцерну. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Шайымбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 25 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Шайымбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Shaiymbu repaid her loan after using it as directed. She is grateful to the Kiva Fund and everyone, who helped her with the financing. Today, Shaiymbu's farm contains 10 cows, 15 sheep and 0.19 hectares of owned land, where she grows alfalfa. In order to further develop her business, Shaiymbu requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 25 sheep to increase her livestock headcount. Shaiymbu plans to invest the earnings from this loan into further increasing her livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy 25 sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a crowbar, crops, a machete, a spade, and gloves

loans.name: Chhunly

texts.en:
Chhunly is an 18-year-old freshman at a university in a city. His major is information technology. He is from the Tbong Khmum province of Cambodia. Chhunly’s farmer parents earn income by growing peppers in the province. 

Because he is short of finances to pay his tuition fees, Chhunly decided to take a loan. With the loan, he will be able to successfully graduate and have a chance to find a good job to help his family. 

After graduation, Chhunly wants to work in a private company.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Good Samaritan Public School Group (D)

texts.en:
Nengneichong is a humble person who supports her family by weaving traditional wraparounds for sale. She earns around 3500 INR per month from her weaving. Her family is made up of six members including four children. She sends her son to Good Samaritan Public School at Saikul village. She and her son are pictured with their hand raised. She is the featured borrower of the group.

 Nengneichong's husband is a carpenter whose income is just enough to pay for the household requirements. To supplement her husband's income, Nengneichong weaves beautiful wraparound skirts and sells them to generate income. She has been a very supportive mother and wife and shows great interest in bringing up her children with good formal education. 

Like all other mothers, Nengneichong also wishes her children to become successful in their future educational and professional life. She has been giving her best for her children. As their income is fixed within limits, it is difficult for her to pay annual fees for all her children at one time especially at the beginning of a new session. So with the Kiva loan, she will pay the annual fees for her son, pictured with her. She will also pay for his textbooks, exercise books and school uniforms for the new session. 

Nengneichong is very happy and content with the loan. Her financial pressures are now diminished. The rest of the group members also have the same goal: to get the loan to pay for their children's annual fees. They are very happy and say, “thank you so much, Kiva.”

loans.use: To pay for annual school fees, textbooks, exercise books, and school uniforms for the session 2015.

loans.name: Gpt Juboo Ndiémane Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Juboo Ndièmane, associe cinq femmes qui logent dans le même village et évoluent dans le stockage. Madame Astou, la deuxième à partir de la droite, en foulard vert sur la photo,  est la présidente, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle a acquis une expérience de plus de 8 ans dans ce domaine. Elle vient pour la première fois solliciter ce crédit pour augmenter son stock. Avec l’argent, elle pourra acheter du mil, des arachides, des haricots. Elle pourra le revendre dans quelques mois avec plus de bénéfices. Elle appuie dans la dépense quotidienne du foyer et l’éducation des enfants.
 Astou désire diversifier son activité en y associant l’élevage d’ovins et de caprins, pour cela, elle pense continuer sa collaboration avec l’IMCEC qui l’aide déjà.
texts.en:
Group Juboo Ndièmane is an association of five women residing in the same village, who work in storage. Mrs. Astou, the second woman from the right in the photo, with a green scarf, is the group’s president. She is married with children.

She has gained over eight years of experience in this business. She is coming to request a loan for the first time. She wants to increase her stocks. With the money, she will be able to purchase millet, groundnuts, and beans. She will be able to resell them in a few month at a profit. She contributes to the household’s daily expenses and the children’s education.

Astou wants to diversify her business by adding sheep and goat husbandry to it. To do so, she thinks she will keep collaborating with IMCEC, which already supports her.

loans.use: to purchase cereals, millet, beans, and groundnuts, which will be stored and then resold.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Nancy works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Nancy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru: Уктам родился в кишлаке  Ниджани города Истаравшан  Согдийский области в семье механизатора. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Вместе с семьей они живут в доме из 4х комнат. Он с детства увлекался животноводством. Он работает учителем в сельской школе. Он имеет в дехканском хозяйстве 1,8 гектар земли, из них 0,4 гектар винограда, и 1,4 гектар выращивает овощи и лук, корм для скотов.  В животноводстве и дехканстве ему помогают жена и его племянники. Он хочет получить кредит для покупки скота. Он заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Uktam was born into a family of mechanic in the Nidjani village of the town Istaravshan of the Sughd province. He is married and has three children. He lives together with his family in a 4-room house. He has liked animal husbandry since his childhood. He now works as a teacher at a village school. His farm contains 1.8 hectares of land, where he grows grapes on 0.4 hectares and vegetables, onions and livestock feed on the remaining 1.4 hectares. His wife and nephews help him with the dekhan farm. He wants to obtain a loan to buy livestock. Uktam thanks MDO Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for labor for transplanting

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children and one goes to school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a drug shop at the market and sells on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last two years.

Miriam has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 600,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more drugs, vaccines, and syrups. Her major challenge includes changing prices of drugs. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land and also educate her children to university level. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: To buy drugs, vaccines, and syrups

loans.name: Leydee

texts.en:
Being a responsible housewife, Leydee has been engaged in cooking and selling snack foods like hamburgers and refreshment foods within the local community. She is 28 years old and blessed with two children attending school. She and her husband aspire to improve their standard of living to give their children a better life. 

To further improve her business, she needs an additional working capital of PHP 6,000 to buy ham, bread, cheese, eggs, seasonings, mayonnaise and other ingredients she needs in preparing snack foods. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy ham, bread, cheese, eggs, seasonings, mayonnaise and other ingredients needed

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en: An old woman living in Kampong Speu province, Khorn is 60 years old and the mother of four dependent children. To support her family's conditions, she grows rice and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family can live in health.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a tractor as mechanical labor and labor for weeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more perfumes, women accessories, and makeup to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Ivoga

texts.en: Ivoga is 41 years old and married with 2 children. She owns and operates a shop, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 5 years. Ivoga needs a loan to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, shoes, and clothes. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, shoes, and clothes

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es: “RENACER” es un grupo conformado por socias dedicadas al comercio minorista. Greta tiene 55 años de edad es casada con un hijo educando en la universidad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas cosméticos y productos naturales en su vivienda hace 10 años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería ropa perfumes joyas en fantasía fina por campaña navideña. Su mayor deseo es lograr que su hijo termine su carrera profesional. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas  KIVA por el crédito brindado. Greta viste casaquilla ploma.
texts.en:
“Renacer" is a group made up of members who work in retail sales.  

Greta is 55 years old and married.  She has one child studying in the university.  For ten years she has worked selling women’s clothing, cosmetics, and natural products.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of more merchandise: clothing, perfume, and nice costume jewelry for the Christmas season.  Her biggest wish is that her child would finish his professional degree.  

The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan.  

Greta is wearing a gray warm-up jacket.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing, perfumes, and nice costume jewelry

loans.name: Azada

texts.en:
Azada is 51 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents in the Agdas region. Her father is a teacher and her mother is a housewife.

Azada has been in farming for 15 years, planting vegetables. Now she would like to improve her little business. For this reason she needs a loan of 1,200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat).

With this loan, Azada wants to buy fertilizer and seeds. She is thankful to Aqroinvest and Kiva for the loan and for helping her develop her business. In the future she wants to build a big greenhouse to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Noeun's Group

texts.en: Noeun, 47, is a mother of two children living in Kampong Speu province. She earns income to support her family through rice cropping and it earns her about 25,000 KHR per day. For Noeun, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family can live in a healthier way than before.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Pao's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Speu province, Pao is 32 years old and a mother of one. To support her family, she grows rice as her single source of income. She can earn about 25,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Pao with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions to make them healthier than before.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Nuris

texts.es:
Nuris es una mujer de campo y madre de 2 hijos por los que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de pollos.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar algunos pollos para cría y materiales para la adecuación de un galpón que tiene su familia

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para ella y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposo y sus hijos.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a una mujer trabajadora con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Nuris is a country woman and mother of 2 children, for whom she has had to go through a lot of adversity in her life. Nevertheless, she has always had the strength to get ahead and to continue progressing with her family.

For a while she has been wanting to start a business raising and selling chickens. That is why she is applying for economic relief to buy some chickens to raise and materials to fix up a shed that her family has.

With this new business, she will be able to generate income for her family, which is everything for her, and she will be able to improve the quality of life for her husband and her children.

She will work everyday to get this business off the ground and to make it a sustainable and profitable activity. Support a hardworking woman with a loan!

loans.use: to buy some chickens to raise and materials for fixing up a shed.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
A mother of two dependent children and living in Siem Reap province, Pheap is 36 years old. To support her family, she earns income through rice cropping. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 34,300 KHR per day. 

For Pheap, this is her fourth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She will spend her entire loan to buy fertilizer and pay plowing fees. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay plowing fees.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sohun's Group

texts.en:
Sohun, 33, lives with family members in a rural area of the Kampong Speu province. She is a mother of two children, one is in school and other one is too young. 

For her living, she can earn income via rice-selling and earn additional income via rice-cropping. This is Sohun's fifth cycle with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. 

In a group of two, Sohun is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can update her family's living and be healthier.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Mutuyuvwe Group

texts.fr: Cultivateur depuis son jeune âge, Kasoko a été accompagné et encouragé par ses parents. Devenu père de famillle , la production lui permet de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et les autres besoins. Pour lui, un crédit  est jusque là nécesssaire à cause de depenses qu'occasionnent les travaux de champ. Il espère dans le futur s'acquérir d'un vehicule pour le transport de la récolte et construire une maison. Il préside le groupe MUTUYUVWE et sur la photo, Kasoko est tout souriant portant une chemise bleue-blanche.
texts.en: A farmer from a young age, Kasoko was accompanied and encouraged by his parents. Having become a father, farming permits him to pay for his children’s schooling and for other needs. For him, a loan is necessitated by the field work. He hopes in the future to buy a vehicle for transporting the harvest and to build a house. He presides over the  MUTUYUVWE group, and in the photo, Kasoko is the one smiling, wearing a blue and white shirt.

loans.use: to pay for labor for weeding, harvesting, and transporting products

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children and four of her children go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. 

Diana operates a beauty salon in a shop that she rents and she also offers her products on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last ten years. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings to buy hair treatments, shampoo, hair oils, braids, weaves and relaxers. 

Diana's major business challenge is electricity. Her goal is to increase her sales; this can be done buying a fridge to so as to serve her customers better. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her main expenses are food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy braids, weaves, hair relaxers, oils and treatments, and shampoo

loans.name: Loi

texts.en: Loi is requesting a new loan to buy tools and equipment to produce vehicle spare parts. Loi's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment to produce vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Turkan

texts.en:
Turkan sells handmade goods, hair ties and accessories. In addition, she has started selling perfume to hair salons. Her brother is a hairdresser, and with his help she established connections with other hairdressers and began selling. With this loan she will buy perfume. 

Turkan has two girls who are university students, and she wants to be able to secure the necessary funds for their education. Turkan is the type of woman who puts her shoulder to the wheel.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Türkan Hanım,elişleri , toka ve aksesuar satışı yapmaktaydı.  Şimdi bunlarla birlikte,kuaförlere parfüm pazarlama işine girdi.  Kardeşi erkek kuaförü,onunda desteğiyle kuaförlerle bağlantı kurdu ve satışa başladı. Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile parfüm alacak.  2 kızı var,okuyorlar.  Eğitim için gerekli paraya ulaşmak istiyor.  Başarılıda.  Hayata sıkı sıkı sarılıyor.

loans.use: to buy perfume to sell

loans.name: Rubeiro

texts.es:
Rubeiro en su búsqueda por un futuro prometedor y unas buenas oportunidades para salir adelante, decidió iniciar un negocio que según él le dará todo eso que siempre ha soñado.

Montara un negocio de tienda de abarrotes en su casa en el municipio de Norcasia, con el cual planea obtener ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Para esto necesita la ayuda de un préstamo de la Corporación Interactuar para la compra de un enfriador, estanterías, vitrinas y surtido de productos básicos de la canasta familiar para abastecer e iniciar su negocio.

Apoya a los sueños emprendedores de un Colombiano con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Rubeiro, in his search for a promising future and good opportunities for getting ahead, decided to start a business that, according to him, will give him everything he has always dreamed about.

He will start a grocery store in his house in the municipality of Norcasia, with which he plans to earn money to support his family.

For this, he needs the help of a loan from Corporación Interactuar to buy a cooler, shelving, display cases, and a variety of basic family needs in order to stock and start his business.

Support the enterprising dreams of a Colombia with a loan today!

loans.use: to buy a cooler, shelving, display cases, and a variety of basic family needs.

loans.name: Daladier

texts.es:
Daladier es un hombre de campo y padre de 4 hijos por los que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de pollos y cerdos.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar algunos pollos y cerdos para la cría, alimento, concentrados y materiales para la construcción de un corral y un galpón.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para él y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y sus hijos.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a un hombre trabajador con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Daladier is a country man and father of 4 children, for whom he has had to go through a lot of adversity in his life. Nevertheless, he has had the strength to get ahead and to continue progressing with his family.

For some time he has wanted to start a business raising and selling chickens and pigs. That is why he is applying for economic relief to buy some chickens and pigs to raise, food, chicken feed, and materials to build a corral and a shed.

With this new business, he will be able to generate income for his family, which is everything for him, and he will be able to improve the quality of life for his wife and his children.

He will work everyday to get his business off the ground and to make it a sustainable and profitable activity. Support a hardworking man with a loan!

loans.use: to buy some chickens and pigs to raise, food, chicken feed, and materials to build a corral and a shed.

loans.name: Hom's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Siem Reap Province, Hom is 57 years old and the mother of three children. To support her family, she grows cassava as her main source of income and raises pigs to supplement her income. She can earn income of about 40,300 KHR per day.

This is Hom's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion on fertilizer and to pay for a plowing fee. She hopes that she can get more yields than she got this year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for a plowing fee.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sau

texts.en: Sau is requesting a new loan to buy a new motorbike for going to and from the market. This purchase will help her transport food to and from the market and will help her have good quality food to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in expanding the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for going to and from the market

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children who all go to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Joan sells fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX (Ugandan shillings) from MCDT SACCO to buy fruits and vegetables such as mangoes, carrots, onions, tomatoes, other vegetables, and pineapples.

She generates additional income from selling soft drinks. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality. She aspires to buy a plot of land to start farming to supplement her income.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables such as mangoes, oranges, cassava, tomatoes, onions, and cabbages

loans.name: Chapa Kazi Mwanangu Group

texts.fr: Après plusieurs tentatives de poursuivre ses études qui ont malheureusement échouées, Japhet a enfin suivi les pas de ses parents en devenant agriculteur. Cette activité lui permet de répondre à ses préoccupations sociales malgré l'insuffisance de fonds et le manque d'outils de transformation modernes. Il compte renforcer son activité, améliorer ses conditions de vie et accroitre son rendement. Tout souriant, Il préside le groupe CHAPA KAZI MWANANGU et tient un chapeau et un carnet dans sa main.
texts.en: After several tries at pursuing his studies, which unfortunately failed, Japhet finally followed in the footsteps of his parents in becoming a farmer. This business allows him to pay for his social concerns despite the insufficiency of funds and the lack of modern tools. He plans to strengthen his business, improve his living conditions, and increase his productivity. The one smiling, he presides over the CHAPA KAZI MWANANGU group and is holding a hat and a notebook in his hand.

loans.use: to pay for mechanical labor, transplanting, and harrowing

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en:
Koreti is 45 years old and married, with seven children. She owns and operates a shop, selling a variety of items, and also a large plantation. She has been doing this for five years.

Koreti needs a loan to buy a large chest freezer, two scales, frozen goods, canned items, bags of rice, sugar, and flour. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2009, to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a large chest freezer, two scales, frozen goods, canned items, bags of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Samorn

texts.en: Samorn is a 23-year-old Thai teacher the Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. He is also taking a Bachelor’s degree majoring in international relationship and diplomacy in his second year. Due to a lack of financial support to pay his tuition fee, he would like to apply for a loan. This loan will help him to go through the second year successfully. After graduation, he wants to work in a company with a reasonable salary to improve his living.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 41-year-old married mother of four, who has been working in Mouneh business (preserving food from one season to another) since 2013, to help her husband in covering their family's increasing living needs. Nadia had a restaurant but unfortunately she had to close it for personal reasons. 

Today, she is running her current business from her house, to make sure she can provide her family the necessary care and increase their much needed income.

Nadia is a hard-working woman who is working hard so that one day she can reopen her restaurant. In the meantime, her loan acquired through Al Majmoua, will be invested in paying for her trip expenses to holy sacred places.

She hopes that she can always make sure that she will respond to her family's increasing living needs.

loans.use: To pay for her trip expenses to holy sacred places

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is requesting a new loan, which she will use to buy a larger quantity of beverages to stock her shop, and to buy new furniture. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of beverages to stock her shop, and to buy new furniture.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as time-conscious. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, flour, cooking oil, and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a market area, and his primary customers are small-scale. He says his biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a larger stock of wheat flour and maize flour. He hopes that in the future, he will have a reliable business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia is a 44-year-old married mother of two children. Due to her husband's low financial situation, 10 years ago she started working as an artisan to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family.

Fadia has 20 years of experience in this domain for she learned it from her neighbor long ago. With her ambition, aptitude, and hard work, she gained professional skills in craft working, which helped her reach the level of an artist and win several prizes and certificates.

Today, Fadia is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary raw materials which will help her prepare creative crafts for the upcoming Christmas season. This loan will satisfy her customers and attract new ones. Fadia hopes to open her own craft shop in the future and participate in several exhibitions.

loans.use: to buy necessary raw materials

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Thorn, a local resident from Kampong Speu province, is 42 years old and a mother of seven children. She does rice cropping as her main source of income. Moreover, she works for others for pay to supplement her income. 

For Thorn, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can give her family good, healthy living conditions.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sandals, shoes, bags and accessories to resell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul grows pineapples in their field. His goal is to harvest plenty and good-quality fruit, so that he can sell for a higher price. Paul is married, and he has children who are attending to school. His income from his pineapple crops serves as their source of living. With this, he is working hard, to be able to obtain his goal.

Applying enough fertilizer will help him grow his crops quicker. Thus, Paul is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000. He will use it to pay for labor in growing pineapple crops. He will also use his loan to buy liquid fertilizer to apply. Paul hopes that he will obtain the loan and will use it wisely.

loans.use: to pay for labor and fertilizer for growing pineapple crops.

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia is a 45-year-old married mother of seven who has been working in a perfume selling business and preparing special home-made soaps since 2006, to help her husband cover their family's increasing living needs.
 
Fadia is running her current business from her house to make sure she can provide her family the necessary care and increase their requested income.
She is a hard working woman who is putting in so much effort so that one day she can open her own selling shop in a remarkable location.

In the meantime, her acquired Al Majmoua will be invested in paying for her trip expenses to Holy sacred places. She hopes that she can always make sure that she will reply to her family's increasing living needs.

loans.use: To pay for her trip expenses to Holy sacred places

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Most of Kenya’s young people struggle to make their way in the world because of unemployment and lack of capital. This is true for Jane, who is based in the Nkubu area of Kenya and is the mother of two lovely children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. She has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops, and some personal business she engages in to makes extra income.

Jane is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a humble time milking and feeding her cow.

A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from getting diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Jane believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Jane waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To build a dairy unit

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 5 years to 14 years. She describes herself as being focused. 

Eunice operates a retail business where she sells metallic boxes. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in an area with clients and her primary customers are retailers and wholesalers. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stocks of metallic boxes. She hopes that, in the future, she will educate her children. This is Eunice's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of metallic boxes to sell.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is a single woman. She has three children. She describes herself as faithful. She operates a retail business, where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for six years. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a profitable business, within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standard. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a stock of cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise.

loans.name: Kambua

texts.en: Kambua is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in an area with a good number of clients and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the perishability of some goods. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to have different businesses within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a great businesswoman. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a married woman. She has two children who are five and seven years old. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Silas

texts.en: Silas is a maize farmer from Galadima village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Silas would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Silas can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Silas, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samwel is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a tailoring shop, where he repairs and makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a developing area. He says his biggest business challenge is a lack of finances. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a stock of tailoring materials. His business goal is to be a designer, with his own clothing line, within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to meet his family's needs. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a single man. He describes himself as trustworthy. He operates a retail business, where he sells clothes and shoes. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an area with potential, and his primary customers are locals. He says his biggest business challenge is a lack of capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a larger stock of clothes and shoes. His business goal is to expand, within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a young woman from Nkubu who has had to overcome many adversities in her life. Nevertheless, she has always had the strength to come out ahead and continue progressing with her family. She has spent the past seven years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Julia is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life.
