Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and feed her animals. She is so close with her animals that she has nicknamed one of them “Kipara,” meaning no feathers on the head. Julia wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her poultry business, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES, which she will use to buy additional poultry. With your loan, Julia will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. Julia is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. Julia dreams of a secure future for her children. She awaits your kindness. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 45% of Kenya's gross domestic product, generates 70% of Kenya’s export revenue, and employs approximately 70% of Kenyans. Despite the importance of agriculture to Kenya and its economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition, because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Kenya remain underserved by financial institutions. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tiles, flooring, mirrors, lighting, paint and salon supplies such as hair extensions and coloring supplies

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has 3 children ranging in age from 4 years to 10 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. She also sells maize flour.

Jane's business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are loyal. She says that her biggest business challenge is price fluctuations. 

This is Jane's third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to replenish her inventory of tailoring materials.  She will use the anticipated profits to buy more items for her stock. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Al Ataa Group

texts.en:
Mona is the featured borrower of Al Ataa Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Mona is a 43-year-old married mother of three children. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, she started three years ago working as a cosmetic saleswoman to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family.
 
Mona is a hard worker who has a good reputation among her customers. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new cosmetics to satisfy her customers' needs and increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.
 
Mona is the first lady on the left of the photo. With respect to the other members of the group, Roukaya is the lady in the middle and Hala is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of milk

loans.name: Lin Group

texts.en:
Lin is a 46-year-old widowed rice farmer who lives with five children in a village in Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. She has cultivated rice since 1989. Two of her children help her with farming, two are garment workers, and the youngest one is a high school student. Together, they can earn approximately $13 a day. 

Now Lin, a group leader, would like to request a group loan. The group has three members.  She will use her portion to build a latrine. For her future plans, she is going to build a new house and help her youngest child to finish high school.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail business where she sells electronics. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of electronics. Her business goal is to open more business outlets within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of electronics

loans.name: Debora

texts.en: Debora is a married woman. She has four children. She operates a retail business where she sells tea and cereals. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a market area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tea and cereals. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tea and cereals

loans.name: Catrine

texts.en: Catrine is a married woman. She has eight children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a semi-urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to be the main supplier of vegetables within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a wholesaler. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be industrious. He operates a retail business where he sells motorcycle spare parts. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a strategic place, and his primary customers are regulars. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of motorcycle spare parts. He hopes that in the future, he will expand business more and improve family living standards.

loans.use: To buy more stock of motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Arnobia De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Arnobia es una mujer muy emprendedora y creativa, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio cultivo de hortensias

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo, al apoyo que recibe de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que deseen que ella salga adelante con su negocio través de Kiva

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar todos los insumos necesarios como semillas de hortensias, abonos, riegos, pesticidas, entre otros.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a una veterana llena de vida y empuje para su familia!
texts.en:
Arnobia is a very enterprising and creative woman. Since long ago she has wanted to be independent and have her own cultivation of hydrangea flowers.

Currently she can realize her dreams thanks to her great capacity for work, the support she receives from Corporación Interactuar, and the Kiva supporters who want her to succeed with her business.

She is asking for financial support to buy all the necessary inputs like hydrangea flower seeds, fertilizers, irrigation, pesticides, and other items.

With this loan you will be able to support an experienced veteran to meet her life goals and provide support for her family.

loans.use: to buy hydrangea flower seeds, fertilizers, irrigation, pesticides, and other items.

loans.name: Beb's Group

texts.en:
Beb lives in a rural area of Siem Reap province. Beb is 37 years old and a mother of five children. She grows rice, as her main source of income. Moreover, she can earn extra income via selling grocery items. She has been involved in this business for ages, and she earns her about 21,400 KHR per day.

In this group of three, Beb is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family will have clean water to drink.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Benedetta

texts.en:
Benedetta is a Kiva borrower. She has 2 children aged 5 years and 16 years. She describes herself as humble. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, cooking fat, washing soap, cereals and other items. She has been involved in this business for 11 years.

Benedetta's business is located in an area with high customer inflow and her primary customers are retailers. She says that her biggest business challenge is lack of enough working capital. 

This is Benedetta's second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to replenish her stock with more flour, sugar, cooking fat, washing soap and other items. She will use the anticipated profits to invest back into her business.

Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be independent and be able to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar, cooking fat, washing soap and other items for her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of timber, nails and other carpentry materials

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a retail business where he makes metallic boxes to sell. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of raw materials for making metallic boxes. His business goal is to increase production and improve profits within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of raw materials to make metallic boxes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as having potential. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes and also repairs them. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area with potential, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: To buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a taxi and transports customers. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an urban area, and his primary customers are businessmen. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds to expand his transport business. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a motorcycle for transporting customers. This will enable him to expand his transport business. He will hire someone to run it. He hopes that in the future, he will live a good life. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transporting customers

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu is a maize farmer from Galadima village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Salamatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Salamatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Salamatu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Narlis Maria

texts.es:
Narlis, una mujer de 37 años de edad que ha dado toda su vida en beneficio de su familia intentando sacarla  adelante y superando juntos las adversidades que se les han presentado en la vida; gracias a una tienda que con mucho esfuerzo, paciencia y sacrificio logro montar, ha generado los ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos. 

Buscando ser la mejor empresa familiar del sector quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido que le permitan aumentar su inventario como granos y abarrotes.

De esta forma ira superando dificultades como las bajas ventas y la competencia.

Este crédito será la gran oportunidad para consolidarse como la tienda más productiva en el barrio y le dará la oportunidad de cumplir ese sueño que tanto ha anhelado de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Apoya a Narlis con su negocio!
texts.en:
Narlis is a 37-year-old woman who has devoted her whole life to helping her family, attempting to make a living and overcoming together the adversities that have arisen in their lives. Thanks to a store that she managed to set up with much effort, patience, and sacrifice, she has managed to generate the income needed to provide for her children. 

In order to have the best family business in the sector, she is requesting a loan to buy supplies that will enable her to increase her stock, such as grains and groceries. In this manner she will be able to overcome difficulties such as low sales and competition. 

This credit will be a great oportunity to establish their store as the most productive in the neighborhood, and to satisfy the dream so long sought after, to improve the conditions of her house. 

Thanks for supporting Narlis and her business!

loans.use: to buy groceries and grains to stock her small store.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a single man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a welding business where he makes metallic doors and windows to sell. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals and institutions. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of welding materials. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful in business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of welding materials

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself as courageous. Fredrick operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for 3 years, and has regular primary customers. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cereal. Fredrick's business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life. This is Fredrick's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereal

loans.name: Seberina

texts.en:
Seberina is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells bananas and avocados. She has been involved in this business for 1 year.

Seberina's business is located in an area with potential for business and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is the perishable nature of the products she sells.

This is Seberina's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more bananas to sell. Her business goal is to have a big store within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be a distributor.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Hong's Group

texts.en:
Hong is 49 years old and lives with her two children and husband. Her husband works as a driver. For the past eight years, Hong has been running a coffee shop from the front of her house to earn an income to support her family.

Hong is the group leader of a five-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is second from the left and holding a book. Each of the other group members is requesting a loan to fund income-generating activities.

Hong is requesting a loan to purchase better-quality coffee and beverages to restock her shop. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better-quality coffee and beverages to restock her shop.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 42-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband has been working as a mason.

Hoa lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Hoa has run a business of selling fruits for twenty years. She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing a greater quantity and variety of fruits at wholesale price to better sell to her customers.

She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of fruits at wholesale price to better sell to her customers.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is a 35-year-old single man living with his family in rural Kyotera, where transportation is a challenge. He belongs to a poor family. Abdul studied until elementary education, but he couldn't complete his studies. He has been riding someone else's motorcycle to get some income, but he has to pay this person some daily income. Therefore, this makes his income very low.

He is seeking a loan to buy his own motorcycle, so that he can raise more income from the business, pay off the loan and also own the motorcycle. Abdul doesn't have enough money to do so. He applied for a loan from UGAFODE in order to purchase the motorcycle. He will use it as transportation, to save the money that he pays daily to the owner of the motorcycle, and also save on the money he spends on transport. He thanks the Kiva lenders through UGAFODE for making this happen.

loans.use: To pay for a motorcycle

loans.name: Sadika

texts.en:
Sadika is a 44-year-old divorced mother of one child who five years ago started selling lingerie and pajamas to cover the needs and expenses of her child for Sadika is the sole earner of her family.
Sadika is a hard worker and ambitious woman who has a good reputation among her customers for her honesty and product quality. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of winter pajamas and lingerie to satisfy her customers over the upcoming Christmas season.
Sadika hopes to develop her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of winter pajamas and lingerie

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself as a risk taker. She operates a bakery where she bakes cakes to sell. She has been involved in this business for 2 years.

Cecilia's business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are the general public. She says that her biggest business challenge is the perishable nature of cakes.

This is Cecilia's third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use this KES 60,000 loan to replenish her inventory of wheat flour, sugar and other baking materials. She will use her anticipated profits to improve the business.

Her business goal is to have a baking shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will have increased profits and improved living standards.

loans.use: to buy more wheat flour, sugar and other baking materials

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Khanh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers.

His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products.

He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store and increasing sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods to stock his general store.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother of four children, all of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She has a restaurant business; she has been in this business for 12 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, cooking oil, salt and rice. She generates additional income from selling vegetables like cabbages and fresh peas. 

She works at the market seven days a week, and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant with a fridge, so as to start selling soft drinks. She also wants to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas, beef, beans, flour, cooking oil, salt

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
Rafaela de 68 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo y tres hijas, solo dos de ellos estudian y los mayores le apoyan con los gastos y los trabajos. Únicamente creció con su madre, su padre murió cuando ella estaba pequeña. Vive solo con sus hijos.

Rafaela es comerciante, vende tortillas en su comunidad también dos o tres veces por semana hace tamales para vender, también elabora hamacas con sus hijos para vender los días domingos, tiene cerca de 40 años de experiencia en su trabajo. Solicita el préstamo para comprar 100 libras de hilo de seda para elaborar hamacas comenta que por acercarse las vacaciones se elevan las ventas de este producto y quiere estar preparada para ofrecer variedad. 

Rafaela espera terminar de mejorar su vivienda, poner ladrillo de piso para no estar con el riesgo de contraer enfermedades respiratorias por el polvo.
texts.en:
Rafaela, age 68, is a single mother with one son and three daughters.  Only two of them are still in school.  The older ones help her with expenses and work.  She grew up with only a mother; her father died when she was little.  She lives alone with her children.

Rafaela is a saleswoman, selling tortillas in her community.  Two or three times per week she also makes tamales to sell.  She also makes hammocks with her children to sell on Sundays.  She has about 40 years of experience in her job.  She is asking for this loan to buy 100 pounds of silk thread to make hammocks.  She says that since vacation time is approaching her sales of this product will go up and she wants to be ready to offer a variety.

Rafaela hopes to finish improving her home, installing a brick floor in order to avoid the risk of getting respiratory illnesses from the dust.

loans.use: to buy 100 pounds of silk thread

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer from Dogon Fako village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Musa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Musa, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Samaila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Lamek and Amaziya.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Samaila spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as a risk-taker. 

James operates a retail business where he sells radios. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. 

James will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more radios. His business goal is to have an electronics shop within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have improved profits. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was successfully repaid. He will use the anticipated profits to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more radios to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself as ambitious. George operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a competitive, place and his primary customers are the general public. George describes his biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. He will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of shoes. His business goal is to have a permanent business location within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved profits. This is George's second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use  the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be God-fearing.

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, washing soap, flour, and other items. Her primary customers are the general public. She describes her family challenge to be a shortage of water.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will access water easily.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Borin

texts.en: Borin is a 50-year-old married mother of an adult son. She lives in Kampong, Chhnang province of Cambodia. For her business, she sells groceries to workers at a big yam plantation in a nearby province and she has done so since 2009. Her son is a worker and her husband earns income by selling coffee. Now she would like to request a loan to buy more groceries to sell. This loan will help her improve her family’s finances. In the future, she is going to keep expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lorena es madre de 4 hijos entre los 7 y 14 años y vive en unión libre. Aparte de su familia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años. 

Aprendió de este negocio empíricamente, es decir a través de la práctica y la observación de otras personas. Ella y su familia viven en zona rural de Valencia, Córdoba en la cual no es fácil tener acceso a servicios financieros como los que ofrece la Corporación Interactuar. 

Su crédito lo piensa usar en la compra de insumos agropecuarios como semillas, productos para el control de plagas, y abonos para realizar mantenimiento y sostenimiento a sus cultivos de plátano.

Gracias a este crédito, la economía y  calidad de vida de su familia mejoraría pues podrá aumentar sus ingresos. 

Lorena sueña terminar con la legalización de los papeles de su tierra y así tener en pleno el control de sus tierras.

 ¡Impacte la vida de Lorena y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Lorena is a mother to four children, all between seven and fourteen years old. Lorena has a partner. As well as looking after her family, she has worked in farming for ten years.

She learned her trade by doing it and by observing others. Lorena and her family live in the rural Valencia area in Córdoba. There, it is not easy to access financial services, such as those offered by Interactuar.

Lorena plans to use this loan to buy farming supplies, such as seeds, anti-disease treatments and manure, in order to look after her plantain crops.

Thank to this loan, Lorena's family's financial situation and quality of life will improve as Lorena can increase her income.

Lorena dreams of finalising the papers on her land and of having full control of that land.

Make a positive impact on the life of Lorena and her family by offering a loan!

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, such as seeds, anti-disease treatments and manure, in order to look after her crops.

loans.name: Engel Antonio

texts.es: El sueño de Enyel de poner un negocio en su país a sus 31 años se hizo realidad porque lo que él quería era ser dueño de negocio y no empleado. Enyel está acompañado y tiene un pequeño niño, es de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de repuestos de bicicleta y llantas de vehículo. Hace ocho años se fue a trabajar a Costa Rica y logro guardar suficiente dinero para poner su negocio en Nicaragua, su esposa es su principal ayuda. Solicita el crédito para comprar repuestos de bicicleta y llantas en general. Este crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá incrementar su inventario. Su sueño próximo es poner otro local para ofrecerles mayor variedad a sus clientes y suplir la demanda existente.
texts.en: 31 year old Enyel's dream to open a business in his country has come true. He wanted to be a business owner, not an employee. Enyel is married and has a small son. He is a businessman with a business that sells bicycle parts and vehicle tires. Eight years ago he went to Costa Rica to work and was able to save enough money to open his own business in Nicaragua. His wife is his main helper. He seeks a loan to buy bicycle parts and tires. This loan will be much help in that he will be able to increase his inventory. His next dream is to open another location in order to offer a greater variety to his customers and supply the existing demand.

loans.use: to buy bicycle parts and tires.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna finished repaying her first loan early in order to take another loan for expansion. With her first loan, Edna succeeded in improving her business and sales. She acquired the needed kosher certification and has received backing from leaders in her community.

Edna now has the opportunity to sign with a local coffee shop-restaurant to sell her cookies. In order to meet demands, which will increase her 60-unit a week sales to 90-units a week, she needs a new professional mixer, an additional electric sieve, and to continue with her PR.

Edna wants to sell her cookies in a well-known cafe, which has branches throughout her area. She hopes to sign a contract with them one day and permanently put her cookies and bakery goods on their shelves.

loans.use: to purchase a professional mixer, supplies, and an additional electric sieve.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to expand her house.

loans.name: Eliphazi

texts.en: Eliphaz is a single father of one child who is in the cattle business and also grows beans and maize as his side business. He started his cattle business in 2001. He works seven days in a week and eight hours per day. Eliphaz started his business because most of his family members were in this business and he expected them to provide him with some knowledge about raising livestock. He also wanted to earn money to educate his child. He is acquiring this loan to purchase more cows to sell. His clients are cattle traders from different cities. His future hope is to expand the business and to continue to educate his child. The challenge he faces is limited capital to purchase the cows since they are so costly. He is a hard-working man who appreciates the support from lenders.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Obadiah Murtala

texts.en: Obadiah Maitala is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Obadiah Maitala would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Obadiah Maitala can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Obadiah Maitala is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell maize at low prices after harvest.

loans.name: Yohana

texts.en: Yohana is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yohana would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yohana  can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Yohana  expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices after harvest.

loans.name: Hadla

texts.en:
Hadla is a 33-year-old, single woman who has eight years of experience selling clothes. She opened her clothes shop a year ago to increase her income and help in covering the needs and expenses of her family.

Today, Hadla is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to increase her business merchandise with winter gulf cloaks, to satisfy her customers' needs. 

Hadla hopes to develop her business in the future and open a wholesale shop, in addition to the retail shop, to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with winter gulf cloaks.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Женщину на фотографии зовут Саломат. Ей 33 года. Она с семьей проживает в городке Турсунзаде. Саломат гордо носит статус жены и мамы. Саломат в течение 6 лет трудиться в торговой сфере. Она занимается продажей фруктов. Для нее это единственный заработок. Саломат держится за эту работу и старается противостоять конкуренции. Сзади, Вы можете увидеть коробки, в которых хранятся фрукты. Рано утром она их отвезет в торговую точку на продажу. Саломат хочет расширить бизнес и привести новые виды фруктов, чтобы им привлечь больше клиентов. Она не может совершить задуманный план, потому ей не хватает не много денежных средств. Саломат решила обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en: The woman in the photograph is called Salomat. She is 33 years old. She and her family reside in the town Tursun-zade. Salomat proudly carries the status of wife and mother. Over the course of six years, Salomat has been working in the trade sphere. She sells fruit. This is her only source of incomeaa. Salomat holds this job and tries to resist competition. Behind her, you can see the box, in which she stores fruits. Early in the morning, she takes them to the trade post to sell. Salomat wants to expand the business and to transport new types of fruit, in order to attract more customers. She cannot complete her imagined plan because she does not have very much money. Salomat decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to buy fruit for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy products such as cheese, milk, cottage cheeses, whey, and other items.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José con 52 años de edad, vive en unión libre y es padre de 5 hijos. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a diversas actividades de manera independiente, con lo que ha generado ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. 

Hace 40, comenzó a realizar la actividad de comercialización de cerdos, pues los compra, los cría, engorda y posteriormente los vende según el peso adquirido por el animal, esto le permite obtener los recursos para continuar con el cuidado y sustento de sus hijos. 

El titular es un hombre luchador, pujante, se esmera cada día para salir adelante motivado por su familia, esto lo impulsó a solicitar el crédito con la Corporación Interactuar, para invertirlo en la compra de cerdos y lechones, así podrá tener disponibilidad suficiente para cumplir con los pedidos que le solicitan y mejorará su margen de utilidad e ingresos. 

De esta manera, José espera avanzar un paso más hacia el cumplimiento de su sueño principal, que es formalizar su negocio y montar un expendio de carne, que sea rentable y perdurable en el tiempo y lograr una estabilidad económica para darle a sus hijos la oportunidad de una mejor educación y tener buenas condiciones de vida.


Mejora la vida de este colombiano con un préstamo!
texts.en:
José is 52 years old, lives in an open union, and has 5 children. During his productive life he has done a variety of jobs independently, with which he generates income and supports his family. A few years ago he began selling pigs. He buys, raises, fattens, and then sells them according to the weight of the animal. This enables him to generate the resources to continue with the care and feeding of his children. He has perseverance and strives every day to provide for his family successfully. This prompted him to seek a loan from Interactuar to buy pigs and piglets for his business. In this way he will have enough pigs to meet with the orders that he has and improve his margin of income and utility.

In this way Jose hopes to move one step closer to his main dream, which is formalizing his business and opening a meat business that is profitable and lasts over time, providing an economic stability in order to give his children an opportunity for a better education and to have good living conditions.

Improve the live of this Colombian with a loan!

loans.use: to buy pigs and piglets for his business.

loans.name: Pakouydong Group

texts.en:
Vongkeo's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams. However, the water from natural sources in Vongkeo's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. Vongkeo is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other waterborne diseases. 

Even though some people in the village, including Vongkeo’s, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users, by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Vongkeo and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water, by purchasing less charcoal or wood, and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Vongkeo's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters, so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina is a 44-year-old married mother of two, who has been running her clothes selling shop since early in the beginning of 2014.  She sells clothes for women, men, and children. This supports her husband, who works as a farmer, in covering their family's increasing living needs, especially their children's  requested education expenses.

She is a hardworking woman with a very good reputation in her region. She is putting so much effort in developing her business and increasing her merchandise, especially before the coming Christmas and New Year celebrations. She finds herself trapped, because she has to pay the necessary requested University fees for her daughter. That's why she found Al Majmoua her best place to help her manage the requested needs. Thus, for this reason, her acquired Al Majmoua loan will be invested in paying for her daughter's increasing university tuition fees.

She will also invest part of the loan in buying necessary diesel to warm up during the coming winter season. She hopes that in the future she can open a daycare for her daughter, and fulfill her dream of having her own business.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's increasing university tuition fees

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien is requesting a new loan to buy better food to sell from her stall. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better food to sell from her stall

loans.name: Hua

texts.en: Hua is requesting a new loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of soft drinks in bulk. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall, increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of soft drinks in bulk

loans.name: Pakouythong Group

texts.en:
Xaisana's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village, including Xaisana, are able to buy bottled water. The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    

Xaisana is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a three-fold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Xaisana, due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing the amount of money used to  purchase bottled water. 

The filter is guaranteed for two years, although most find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters, so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Muhriddin

texts.ru:
Мухриддин мужчина 23 лет. Он   женат, но пока не имеет детей. Он очень трудолюбивый парень, любит семью и старается для благополучия своей семьи. Мухриддин работает в пекарном цехе. Он печет лепешки. Дополнительно он занимается животноводством. Он хочет получить кредит для покупки скота. 
 Он заранее благодарит и говорит «Спасибо за поддержку и доверие!»
texts.en:
Muhriddin is a 23-year-old man. He is married, but does not yet have children. He is a very hardworking, young man, loves his family and strives for the well-being of his family. Muhriddin works in a baking shop. He bakes flatbreads. Additionally he raises livestock. He wants to receive a loan to purchase cattle.

He is grateful in advance and says, "Thanks you for the support and trust!"

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 43-year-old married mother of one child. She is working hard to provide him with the necessary living needs, since her husband traveled abroad seeking a better income business to support his family's living here in Lebanon. Amal is a hardworking woman. She runs her business from her home, to make sure that she can manage taking care of her house and financially supporting her family at the same time.

Amal sells clothes, accessories and Brazilian gold. She is well known in her region with her special products and the encouraging prices she sets.
Today, Amal's acquired loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with a special winter clothes collection, in addition to special Brazilian gold designs especially for the coming Christmas and New Year occasions. She hopes that in the future she can open her own separate shop, and attract more customers.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with a special  winter clothes collection, in addition to special Brazilian gold designs especially for the coming Christmas and New Year

loans.name: Duoc

texts.en: Duoc would like to take a further loan to buy more soft drinks to sell from her stall. Duoc's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Dorisa

texts.en:
Dorisa is 48 years old from the town of Carles, Iloilo. She is married with four grown children. For 25 years, fishing has been her source of livelihood, together with her husband. Dorisa would like to enhance her business but with limited funds, she can hardly do so. She is asking for a loan to buy an engine and fishing nets to support her business. It is her dream to see her business grow and for her to save so she will not depend on her children.



In the future, she hope to see her business more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy an engine and fishing nets.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru:
Шариф мужчина 50 лет,женат , отец пятерых детей.Он родился и вырос в сельской местности и с детства был приручен  к тяжелому труду на поле. После окончания школы,он хотел поступить в университет ,но в то время у его родителей не было средств ,чтобы оплатить его образование,поэтому он продолжил заниматься с отцом животноводством.В настоящее время он на своем участке земли ухаживает за домашним скотом.Его младший сын,который живет с ним ,помогает ему во всем,потому что Шариф уже в пожилом возрасте и нуждается в поддержке и помощи близких.Но несмотря на это Шариф с утра выходит на поле и пасёт своё стадо.
Он хочет закупить корм для скота на зиму и поэтому  обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой . Он рад что есть такие организации как МДО Арванд ,которые помогают людям с низким и средним уровнями жизни.
texts.en:
Sharif is a man of 50, is married, and is the father of five children. He was born and grew up in the countryside and since childhood was tamed to hard work in the field. After graduating from school, he would have enrolled in a university but at that time his parents did not have the resources to pay for his education. Therefore, he continued to engage in livestock breeding with his father. Currently, he tends to livestock on his own plot of land. His younger son, who lives with him, helps him with everything, because Sharif is already of an advanced age and is in need of the support and help of his family. But despite that, Sharif in the mornings goes out into the field and grazes his flock.

He wants to buy livestock feed for winter and therefore applied to MDO Arvand for financial support. He is glad that there are such organizations as MDO Arvand, which help people with low and medium levels of living.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed.

loans.name: Surajo

texts.en: Surajo is a maize farmer from Rafin Tabo village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Surajo would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Surajo can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Surajo, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: John Fredy

texts.es:
John vive con su pareja y tienen 2 hijos de 3 y 9 años, vive felizmente junto con su familia en zona rural del municipio de Caicedo.

En la actualidad ya cumplió 8 años de estar trabajando con la cría de cerdos de engorde, actividad con la que ha intentado sobrevivir y sacar adelante a su familia para que nunca les falte nada. 

Ha tenido dificultades económicas que han afectado su negocio y que lo han obligado a detener sus actividades en ciertas ocasiones, también por el largo desplazamiento que debe realizar para llegar a su sitio de trabajo.

Sueña con mejorar la utilidad de la cría de sus animales y también con tener una planta de engorde de cerdos, por esto hace la solicitud de un préstamo, el cual invertirá en la compra cerdos de engorde los cuales tienen muy buena aceptación por la buena crianza y mantenimiento de los mismos. 

Su calidad de vida y la de su familia se incrementará en la medida que aumentan las ventas de sus animales y alcance las metas establecidas para  un futuro no muy lejano.

Con el apoyo de este préstamo John podrá continuar trabajando y podrá darle a su familia todo lo mejor.
texts.en:
John lives with his wife and has two children who are 3 and 9 years old. He lives happily with his family in a rural area of Caicedo municipality. 

He has now been working for eight years raising and fattening pigs. Through this work he has tried to survive and provide for his family, so that they will always have all they need. 

He has had financial problems that affected his business, and that have forced him to suspend his work on certain occasions, also for the long journey he has to make to get to his place of work. 

He dreams of improving his profits from raising animals, and also of having a feedlot for pigs. For this he is requesting a loan, that will be used to buy hogs to fatten. His pigs are well accepted because he raises and maintains them well. 

His quality of life and that of his family will increase as he sells more animals and reaches the goals he has set for a short-term future.  

With the help from this loan John can continue working and give his family all the best.

loans.use: to buy hogs for fattening as part of his production.

loans.name: Bahodir

texts.en: Bahodir was born in 1970. He is a careful father of three children. Bahodir has been busy with animal husbandry. He has worked in this field for more than 20 years, and has great experience in this field. Bahodir mainly feeds cows. His wife helps him with feeding cows. He sells cows in a local market. Bahodir needs financial support, as he must buy coal for the winter season. Bahodir is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy coal for the winter season. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy coal for the winter season

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children, all of whom attend school. She has no additional family members. She has been operating a stall selling green bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes in the market at retail for twenty-five years, working seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes for sale.

Her challenges include thieves and transportation. Her dream is to buy more land for farming. She joined MCDT because of good customer care.

She stays in her own house with access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and utilities.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Housin

texts.en:
Housin is a 20-year-old single man from Rafah City. He lives with his parents in a simple house in the city. His father is an employee where he gets a low wage. Two years ago, Housin started working to help his father with part of the family's expenses. He sells food in a stall in the city. 

Housin took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his food stall to resell. This will increase his sales and also his income. 

Housin appears in the photo while at work.

loans.use: to buy more products for his food stall to resell

loans.name: Sabaya Wbas Group

texts.en:
Najla is the featured borrower for Sabaya Wbas Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Najla is a 38-year-old married mother of two children. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, she decided to help him in agriculture to satisfy their children's needs and expenses. Today, Najla is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to open a new clothes business and buy a new collection of winter clothes to attract customers and satisfy their needs. 

Najla is the second lady on the right of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Amani is the first lady on the right, Samar is the first lady on the left, and Rouba is the second from the left in the photo.

loans.use: to open a new clothes business and buy a new collection of winter clothes

loans.name: Suhad

texts.en:
Suhad is a conservative lady, so she asked her son Yazan to appear in the photo instead.

Suhad is a 45-year-old mother for four children. One of them is Yazan, a 21-year-old single man who attends university to get his bachelor's degree in accounting. Yazan is now in his third year and is doing well at school. Because of the rising cost of the private university's tuition, Suhad is requesting a loan to help Yazan pay for his next semester's fees and buy the books he needs.

loans.use: to help her son Yazan pay for his next semester's fees and buy the books he needs.

loans.name: Usman

texts.en: Usman is a maize farmer from Badamasi village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Usman would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Usman can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Usman, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Isah

texts.en: Isah is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Isah joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Aminu, Naziru and Nasiru.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isah would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isah can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Isah  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, and eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a maize farmer from Bazana I village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Amina would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Amina can now store her maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Amina, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland, and hopes to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alh.

texts.en: Alh is a maize farmer from Karofi village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alh would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Alh, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en:
Alhassan is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Alhassan joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Mansura, Hafizu and Yusuf.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alhassan would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alhassan can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Alhassan spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Martha Yudy

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de campo con empuje y perseverancia, vive con sus dos hijos en una humilde finca en zona rural de Caparrapi. Ella es madre responsable y junto con su esposo intenta sacar su familia adelante.

Ella se gana la vida con la cría y producción de cerdos de engorde, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años con el fin de obtener los recursos suficientes para la manutención de su familia, además vende cervezas y bebidas para complementar sus ingresos.
 Ella trabaja todos los días ya que sus cerdos requieren de aseo, alimentación y monitoreo constante para su correcto desarrollo y posterior venta.
Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar cerdos, concentrado y alimento para sus animales, dándole la oportunidad de tener unas crías mejor alimentadas y con mejores condiciones para el consumo.
Ella sueña con ver a sus hijos como profesionales y con la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Martha is a woman from the countryside with drive and perseverance. She lives with her two children on a humble farm in rural Caparrapi. She is a responsible mother and along with her husband works to support her family. She works raising and producing meat pigs, a business she has been doing for 10 years with the objective of having enough financial resources to support her family. In addition she sells beer and beverages to complement her income.

She works every day as her pigs require her attention, food, and monitoring for their correct development and subsequent sale.

She seeks a loan to buy pigs, concentrate and food for her animals, giving her the opportunity to have better-fed animals and better product for consumption.

She dreams of seeing her children become professionals through the best education possible.

loans.use: to buy pigs, concentrate and food for her animals.

loans.name: Murtala

texts.en:
Murtala is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Murtala would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Murtala can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Murtala expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, ensure his children Hardin, Hamza and Hassan are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Bitrus Saha

texts.en:
Bitrus Saha is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Bitrus Saha joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Sule, Azaya and Zainaf. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bitrus Saha would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bitrus Saha can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Bitrus Saha spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Edilsa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Edilma, a sus 40 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, a los que ha sacado adelante con arduo esfuerzo y dedicación. 

Durante hace unos meses ha trabajado como comerciante independiente en su negocio de venta de celulares; allí trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas y ha logrado generar los ingresos para solventar las necesidades familiares. Es un negocio único en la región y es una gran oportunidad de salir adelante.

Expresa que su interés con el crédito es invertir en la compra de surtido al por mayor de equipos celulares para abastecerse lo suficiente y poder satisfacer los gustos de su clientela con la variedad que ofrecerá; esto le ayudará a mejorar las ventas, además le hará frente a su mayor desafío que es el costo de los insumos y la mercancía.
 
Edilma manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y pagar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Edilma is 40 years old and mother of three children. She has raised them with a lot of effort and dedication. For a few months she has worked as an independent salesperson in her cell phone business. She works every day for 8 hours and she has been able to generate revenue to pay for the family needs.

It is the only business of this kind in the region and has great opportunity to succeed. She says that she is interested in the loan to invest in the purchase of wholesale cellular equipment to build stock and to be able to satisfy the likes of her customers with the variety she will then be able to offer.  This will help her increase her sales and it will help her with the biggest challenge which is the cost of the supplies and of the merchandise.

Edilma states that her biggest wish is to improve the condition of her home and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a selection of celullar equipment in bulk to build enough stock.

loans.name: Sheraly

texts.en:
Sheraly was born in 1992. He is married but has no children. Sheraly is very hardworking and smart man. He studies at the university, and he does well. Sheraly studies economics and wants to be a good specialist after graduating from university. 

Sheraly now needs financial support because he must pay for tuition. He is asking for a loan to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Luis Rosendo

texts.es:
Luis desde hace 8 años se dedica a la producción agrícola y diariamente se levanta para trabajar y atender sus tierras en las cuales tiene cultivos principalmente de plátano.
Es una actividad aprendida de manera empírica y poco a poco ha ido perfeccionando sus técnicas y habilidades en este campo.
Adicionalmente genera ingresos alternos gracias a su trabajo como jornalero.
Hoy en día se siente orgulloso de lo que ha podido construir con su esfuerzo y se siente muy agradecido con la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva por las oportunidades que le brindan de progresar.
El pide un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de abonos, riegos y pesticidas, de este modo mantener sus tierras en optimas condiciones para los cultivos.
Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia y allí poder disfrutar de su vejez al lado de su esposa.
texts.en:
Luis has been farming for 8 years. Every day he gets up to work and ten his land where he primarily grows banana. He taught himself to farm and little by little has been perfecting his techniques and abilities. He also generates income as a day laborer.

Today he is proud of what he has built with his effort and is very thankful to Interactuar and Kiva lenders for the opportunity to grow. He seeks a loan to buy manure, irrigation, and pesticides and in this way maintain his land in optimal condition for his crops.

His main dream is to have his own home and be able to enjoy his old age there with his wife.

loans.use: to buy manure, irrigation, and pesticides and in this way maintain his land in optimal condition.

loans.name: Manuel De Los Reyes

texts.es:
Manuel es un veterano con mucha experiencia en el campo. 
Es humilde y sencillo, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para poder cualquier cultivo a producir.

El tiene un cultivo de plátano y yuca el cual trabaja todos los días para vender sus cosechas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Tierra Alta.

Gracias a sus años de experiencia y enseñanzas que le dio su padre desde niño, tiene plena capacidad para trabajar y para asesorar en estos temas a los demás agricultores de la zona que necesiten ayuda con su producción. 

El solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, semillas de plátano y pesticidas, de esta manera inyectara capital a su actividad y mejorara sus cosechas de una manera significativa enfrentando la dificultad más grande que tiene que son el clima tan cambiante que afecta su cosecha.

 Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y grandes esperanzas en las personas solidarias que apoyan a los campesinos trabajadores del Colombia como lo hace la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya a un humilde agricultor para que pueda sacar adelante sus tierras con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Manuel is a veteran with a lot of farming experience. He is a simple, humble man, with great people skills and enough energy to bring any crop to harvest.

He grows plantains and yucca, and works the fields every day so he can sell his crops in the market of the municipality of Tierra alta.

Thanks to his years of experience and the teachings received from his father since childhood, he is fully capable of working and also advising other farmers in the area who may need help with their crops.

He is requesting the loan to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, plantain seeds, and pesticides. This way he will inject capital into his business and it will significantly improve the harvests. The biggest difficulty he faces is the changing climate affecting the crops.

Manuel has great faith in his business and high hopes for the caring people who support the farm workers of Colombia, as does Corporación Interactuar.

You can help this humble farmer with a loan so that he can continue to work his land.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, plantain seeds, and pesticides for his crops.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is 23 years old. He is not married and lives with his parents. Hasan had been in business with a taxi service since he graduated from school. Hasan began his business thanks to the support of his father.

He has been busy with the taxi business for more than five years. He works from 6:00 o’clock in the morning until 8:00 o’clock in the evening. Hasan, little by little, is developing his business.

Now, he has an Opel. He wants to buy a new car and develop his business further. He is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy a new car. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a new car.

loans.name: Mario Desiderio

texts.es:
Mario, un hombre de 50 años de edad lleno de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, vive en una finca en el municipio de Sincelejo y se gana la vida con la producción y venta de pollos y huevos.  
Con este trabajo intenta sostener a su familia compuesta por su esposa y 5 hijos.
Es un trabajo que ha venido ejerciendo desde hace aproximadamente 4 años con el fin de salir adelante.
Pide un apoyo económico para la compra de pollos, gallinas ponedoras, alimento y materiales para su galpón.
Con este préstamo podrá tener un negocio más sostenible y consolidado.

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Mario!
texts.en: Mario is a 50 year old man full of dreams and aspirations for his life. He lives on a ranch in Sincelejo municipality and earns a living by producing and selling chickens and eggs. With this work he supports his family, which consists of his wife and 5 children. This is work he has been doing for approximately 4 years. He seeks economic support in order to be able to have a business that is more sustainable and consolidated. With the loan that you make today you will be able to improve Mario's life and business!

loans.use: to buy chickens, laying hens, feed and materials for his farm.

loans.name: Zakariya

texts.en:
Zakariya is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Zakariya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Zakariya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Like other Babban Gona members, Zakariya is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sur Group

texts.es:
Marioly es una mujer de 18 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un bebe recién nacido, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
Ella es emprendedora, dulce, cariñosa, sensible, sincera, Inteligente, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, una zona residencial de nivel medio en donde se encuentra el Aeropuerto el Trompillo que opera con vuelos domésticos o nacionales y el muy conocido Cementerio Jardín ‘El Pajonal’,  y también tiene el Estadio Real Santa Cruz. Se caracteriza por tener muchas áreas verdes, entre ellas el parque de la Fuerza Armada Boliviana, plazas y parques con canchas poli funcionales. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el die entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Marioly es de tez morena, estatura media, cabello negro largo amarrado, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por el comercio (sentada al centro, usa blusa blanca). Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que se dedica al transporte y su bebé que tiene 9 meses de nacido, viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Sus deseos por ampliar su negocio la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de vajillas, venta de celulares, venta de carne de pollo, venta de flores, servicio de té y taller de costura, para solicitar un préstamo y continuar con sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de las marcas; esika, l’bel, cyzone y otros que realiza en un puesto fijo de venta y también de forma ambulante a clientes constantes. Los productos más vendidos son; lápiz labial, perfumes, cremas anti edad, mascara para pestañas, aretes, tratamientos faciales, etc. “comencé mi negocio por la necesidad de ayudar a mi familia, actualmente cuento con varios clientes constantes que realizan pedidos mediante catálogo, y tengo mi puesto de venta donde los perfumes se venden solos…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un distribuidora de cosméticos y desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de un stock de cosméticos de temporada  por mayor, para satisfacer la demanda de temporada. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 meses que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marioly solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos por mayor para satisfacer la demanda de la temporada y con los beneficios pagar los gastos de su bebe recién nacido.
texts.en:
Marioly is an 18 year old woman. She lives with her spouse, has a newborn baby, and has a business where she sells cosmetics. She is entrepreneurial, sweet, caring, sensible, sincere, intelligent, responsible, hardworking, and a good mother. She does business in the south of the city in a middle class neighborhood. The area is near the domestic Trompillo Airport, the well-known "El Pajonal" cemetery gardens, and the Santa Cruz Stadium. It has many green areas like the Bolivian Air Force park, plazas, and parks with many multi-use fields. It is warm, tropical, and humid, with a temperature that varies between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius during the day. 

Marioly has brown skin, is medium height, and wears her long hair tied up. Her native language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish for work. She is kneeling in the center of the photo and is wearing a white blouse. She lives with her partner who works in transportation, and their 9-month old baby. They live in a rental home that has running water, electricity, and a septic system. 

Her desire to expand her business led her to form a group of people with business like silverware sales, cell phone sales, chicken sales, flower sales, tea sales, and sewing services so that they could request a loan and continue with their businesses. She sells brands of cosmetics like Esika, L'Bel, Cyzone, and others. She has a storefront and also walks to her frequent customers. Her most sought-after products are lipstick, perfumes, anti-aging creams, mascara, earrings, facial treatments, etc. 

She says, "I started my business because I needed to help my family and I currently have many frequent customers who place orders through the catalog and I have a shop where I sell perfumes." Her dream is to have a cosmetics distributor and she hopes to make an investment in her business by purchasing a supply of cosmetics in bulk in order to satisfy the seasonal demands.

This is why Marioly has requested a loan, in order to purchase cosmetics in bulk in order to satisfy seasonal demands so that she can support her newborn baby with the income.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics in bulk to meet demand this season so that she can support her newborn with the income.

loans.name: Wardeh

texts.en:
Wardeh is a 28-year-old single lady from Jabalia. She lives with her family in a small, simple house. One year ago, Wardeh opened a beauty salon in the city. She now has very good experience in this field, and she is well known in her area.

Wardeh requested a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more beauty products that she frequently uses in her salon. By taking this loan, Wardeh will be able to improve her business and increase her income.

Wardeh appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products that she frequently uses in her salon.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Caught between unemployment and land fragmentation, many of Kenya’s young people struggle to make their way in the world. But for Damaris, 42, who is based in the Chuka area of Kenya and is a mother of four lovely children, she has been practicing mixed farming for the past 20 years. She has managed to earn a decent income. The rich soil of this area makes it one of the nation’s biggest maize growing regions lending it the nickname of “maize region.” For the past 20 years, she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. These ventures have allowed her to earn a decent income. Damaris passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of funds. However, this challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family and children,” she said. She mobilized other enterprising woman like her in her village and they have joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a micro finance that assists small-scale farmers through giving out loans and training. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi kilimo via Kiva lender to buy additional poultry. Having gone through training on loan management, she is educated on how to utilize the loan and save more money. Through this loan, Damaris will generate enough income to take care of the farming costs and expand her poultry business.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en:
Hauwa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hauwa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Ayuba, Istifanus, and Lidiya.

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hauwa would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hauwa can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Hauwa spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children. She hopes to eventually make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell her corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.en:
Nafisa is a kind woman. She is not married and lives with her family in North Tajikistan. Nafisa did not have the opportunity to apply to the university and get higher education, as they live poorly.

Nafisa has been busy with animal husbandry during the past three years. She earns a living in this way and helps her parents with family expenses. She works hard every day and hopes she is successful in the future.
