texts.en: Philippe is 28 years old. He is not married. He has a shop, and he has been working in a business for four years. With the loan requested, he would like to buy more rice, sugar, and cooking oil to resell.  The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, and cooking oil to resell.

loans.name: Sarafina

texts.en:
Sarafina is a woman of the countryside, and mother to three children, for whom she has had to go through many adversities in her life. However, she has always had the strength to get ahead and continue progressing with her family.

For some time, she has wanted to improve her farming by buying good fertilizers and seedlings. This is why she asks for a great economic support to purchase fertilizers and seedlings. With this improved productivity, she will be able to generate income for her family, who are everything for her, and will be able to improve the quality of life of her husband and their children.

She will work every day to boost her farm and to make it sustainable and profitable. Support this hard-working woman with a loan!

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Xochitl Nayiris

texts.es: Doña Xochitl quiere que su hija se prepare y sea una profesional es por eso que ha realizado muchos esfuerzos para sacar a sus hijos adelante. Su hija Fátima está a punto de culminar los estudios de secundaria y comenzar una nueva etapa la universidad, es por eso que Doña Xochitl solicita un crédito para cubrir los gastos de la promoción y la ceremonia así como adelantar el arancel de la matrícula de la universidad donde estudiara el próximo año. Las dos están agradecidas con el crédito porque es una oportunidad que tienen para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Xochitl wants her daughter to be prepared and be a professional.  This is why she has made many efforts to move her children ahead. Her daughter Fátima is about to finish secondary school and start a new phase in college.

This is why Xochitl is requesting a loan to cover the costs of promotion and ceremony as well as to pay the advance tuition fee of where her daughter will study next year.  They are both grateful for the loan because it is an opportunity for them to succeed.

loans.use: to cover the cost of promotion and ceremony as well as to pay the advance tuition fees for where her daughter will study next year.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en: Antonio is 21 years old and works in administration in a private transport company. He works with his parents and has been working for the last three years. He describes himself as a hardworking person, full of projects and goals, with the drive to achieve them. Antonio is asking for a loan to make some home improvements in his house. He says that after the rainy season, the house needs some urgent repairs due to water leaks.

loans.use: to make some home improvements, such as waterproofing and painting

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es: Herminio de 67 años de edad es un hombre casado que habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos ya mayores de edad que le apoyan económicamente. Él es un hombre trabajador que se esfuerza por sostener la economía de su hogar, por medio de su trabajo como jornalero actividad que desarrolla desde hace 50 años y que lo ha llevado a sacar adelante a sus hijos de los que se siente muy orgulloso. Herminio desea adquirir un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: reparación del sistema de energía solar y comprar una batería para el mismo, ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que espera contar con el apoyo de este crédito lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Herminio, 67 years old, is a married man who lives in his own home with his wife and their 3 adult children who support them financially. He is a hard working man who strives to maintain the household finances through his work as a day laborer. He has done this for 50 years and it has allowed him to move his children forward, of whom he is very proud.

Herminio wishes to acquire a loan from FUSAI to invest in: repairing the solar energy system and to buy a battery for the same, since it is currently decayed. This is why he hopes to have the support from this loan as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in: repairing the solar energy system and to buy a battery for the same.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan (pictured with his wife) is 49 years old. He works, selling fruits and vegetables, in a Mexico City Market. He has three sons, ages 27, 22, and 17 years. He works with his wife. Juan is asking for a loan, which he will use to buy merchandise for the end-of-year season, and also to make some repairs to the truck that he uses to move the merchandise. He describes himself as honest, and he likes to pay his debt on time.

loans.use: to buy some merchandise for the end-of-year season and to fix his truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his college graduation papers.

loans.name: Diego

texts.en:
Diego has lived with his wife, Estela, for more than 30 years. He has four children, but only one lives with them. The others are independent. Diego manufactures clothing for companies that outsource their work. He works for companies that sell to big department stores. He hires employees; some of them do their work in the shop located in his house, but he also does outsourcing.

He is asking for the loan for working capital, because his business has been growing. He started working in this field when he was 16 years old, and opened his own business 26 years ago.

loans.use: to have working capital for the manufacture of clothing.

loans.name: Maria Doralba

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de La Dorada desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de comidas por encargo como lo son los tamales, chorizos, empanadas, arepas, entre otros.
Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Maria y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.
Maria desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de algunos utensilios de cocina y compra de insumos para continuar realizando sus recetas como pollos, harina, queso, entre otros.
Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia, oportunidad que le brinda la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Maria is a humble and hard-working woman who has dedicated much of her life to raising her children. She lives in the city of La Dorada, where she works spectacularly in the kitchen. Her business is in making food by order such as tamales, chorizos, empanadas, corn tortillas, and other dishes.

She sells this food primarily to neighbors who know Maria’s seasonings and who know they will always get delicious and well-prepared food from her.

Maria wants to grow her food sales business and she wants to work more comfortably so she is requesting a loan to buy some kitchen utensils and supplies to keep cooking recipes with chicken, flour, cheese, and other items.

This loan will allow her to move her business forward so she can earn the necessary income to give her the opportunity to keep sustaining her family, an opportunity provided by the Corporación Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy some kitchen utensils and supplies to keep cooking recipes.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis un humilde agricultor que cada mañana sale a trabajar en su campo, dedicado en pleno a su trabajo, este hombre solo piensa en progresar y entregar un buen producto pues sabe que muchas personas lo consumen y por ello cada gota de sudor que sale de su frente es el empeño que pone para que su productos salgan puros y de calidad, 
Como todo buen agricultor, quiere siempre implementar arreglos y mejoras para a sus cultivos pero sabe que estos arreglos o implementaciones son muy costosos por esta razón solicita un crédito para adecuar sus campos y construir una canalización con el único propósito de mejorar su manera de cultivar, hacer más fácil su trabajo y darle al cliente final un producto de calidad
texts.en:
Luis is a modest farmer who goes out to work in his fields every day.  Completely devoted to his work, this man thinks only about making progress and delivering a good crop.  He knows that a lot of people will consume his products, so every drop of sweat from his brow is the effort he makes for his crops to come out pure and high quality.

Like all good farmers, Luis always wants to make modifications and improvements to his crops.  He knows this is very costly, though, so he's requesting a loan to improve his fields and build a channel.

His only goal is to improve his growing technique, make his job easier, and give his customers a quality product.

loans.use: to improve his fields and build a channel.  His only goal is to improve his growing technique

loans.name: Jose Eliseo

texts.es:
José, es casado, junto a su esposa tienen el privilegio de ser padres de dos niñas de 4 y un año de edad, la familia vive junta; es propietario de una moto taxi, la cual adquirió con esfuerzo propio, hoy en día es su medio de subsistencia, sus servicios de transporte lo ofrece todos los días desde hace aproximadamente 4 años.
El capital le servirá para pagar los costos de abogado que le está tramitando las placas de la moto taxi, le permitirá tener la documentación requerida en regla de su unidad de transporte y ampliar el área de sus recorridos, espera atender de mejor manera a sus clientes y tener nuevos ingresos.
Su visión es seguir trabajando cumplir con sus compromisos y a futuro comprar una nueva unidad (moto taxi) para generar empleo y tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
José is married.  He and his wife have the privilege of being the parents of two daughters, ages 4 and 1.  The family lives together.

He owns a motorcycle taxi, which he acquired on his own with a lot of effort.  Currently it's his means of support.  He has offered transportation services every day for about four years.

The capital will serve to pay the costs for the lawyer who's handling the paperwork for the license plates for José's taxi.  It will allow him to have the papers for his taxi in order and to expand the area of his runs.  He hopes to better serve his customers and earn additional income.

José's dreams are to keep on working to fulfill his commitments and, in the future, buy a new vehicle (motorcycle taxi) to generate work and earn more income.

loans.use: to pay the lawyer who is handling the paperwork for his motorcycle taxi license plates

loans.name: Las Misioneras Group

texts.en:
Poverty in Guatemala is closely associated with a lack of access to social and economic assets and resources. It is impossible for an impoverished person, especially a woman, to secure a loan from a bank. Fortunately, there are non-governmental organizations like Friendship Bridge that are a beacon of hope for over 22,000 indigenous women. With its “Microcredit Plus” Program, combining small loans and education, the ladies gain the tools to empower themselves and create a brighter future for their families and communities.

The eight women of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Misioneras” have just successfully concluded a loan cycle funded by Kiva lenders. They are requesting an additional loan to sustain and expand their small businesses that include textile production and sales, as well as the sale of snacks and fruit.

We would like to share the story of Santos, a 35-year-old woman with four children. Three of them are in school. Santos is a strong and visionary lady, determined to change the future for her children and she realizes that education is the key. Her business fabricates “cortes,” or traditional “wrap-around” skirts that are woven in various beautiful designs. She is requesting a loan to buy a new loom, as well as a substantial quantity of thread in various colors and textures. She, along with her husband who works in the business, want to fulfill all orders, especially at this time of year when business increases. In her words she says, “Thank you, Kiva investors, for the opportunity to take out a loan because I can buy the supplies that I need to work and make a better income.”

Kiva lenders are much appreciated by the ladies in the Trust Bank for believing in them and their dreams. We look forward to providing a follow-up story on Santos and her friends in the very near future! Thank you!

loans.use: to buy a new loom, as well as a substantial quantity of thread in various colors and textures.

location.town: Santa Cruz del Quiche, El Quiche

loans.name: Francisca De Los Angeles

texts.es: Francisca de 33 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza cada día para poder sostener la economía de su familia apoyada en su negocio de venta de ropa, actividad que le permite sostener la economía de su hogar, desde hace mucho tiempo. Ella habita en vivienda propia al lado de sus 3 hijos 2 varones de 14 y 12 años de edad y una niña de 1 año de edad. Francisca desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI que le permita invertir en: faldas, blusas, pantalones, camisas, vestidos, etc. Y de esta manera obtener más y mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Francisca, 33, is an enterprising woman who makes an effort every day to be able to support her family with her business selling clothing.  The job has allowed her to support her household budget for a long time.

She lives in her own home with her three children: two boys, ages 14 and 12, and a girl, 1.

Francisca wants to get a loan from FUSAI so she can invest in skirts, blouses, pants, shirts, dresses, and so on.  That way she'll earn more and better profits.

loans.use: to invest in skirts, blouses, pants, shirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Donabel

texts.en:
Donabel is 38 years old and lives in Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children who are now of school age.
 
Donabel has been engaged in rice “palay” trading for two years already. She is also receiving monthly support from her husband who is a seaman. She earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month doing this type of business activity. This amount is so helpful to meet some of her family's needs. She requested a loan to purchase more sacks of rice “palay’ for milling and retailing. 

Donabel has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Donabel hopes to acquire an additional parcel of rice land to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice "palay" for milling and retailing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: rent a field and pay for labor and harrowing.

loans.name: Dalila Marisol

texts.es: Dalila es una mujer que se esfuerza para salir adelante apoyada en su negocio de venta de platillos típicos como: pasteles de carne, enchiladas, yuca, nuégados, empanadas, etc. la cual realiza en su vivienda desde hace 3 años, por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 3 años de edad. Dalila desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI que le permita invertir en: yuca, maíz, tomates, repollo, carne, plátano, leche, etc. Para poder seguir ofreciendo sus deliciosos platillos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dalila is a woman who works to move forward through her business selling traditional dishes such as shepherd’s pie, enchiladas, yucca, nougat, empanadas, and others. She has been making them at home for three years. She already has many customers who request her products.

She lives in her own home with her life partner and 3-year-old daughter. Dalila wants to acquire a loan with FUSAI to allow her to invest in yucca, corn, tomatoes, vegetables, meat, plantains, milk, and other items so she can keep offering delicious food to her customers.

loans.use: to invest in yucca, corn, tomatoes, cabbage, meat, plantains, milk, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for advertising for his holistic health care practice

loans.name: Esteban

texts.en:
Esteban and his wife run a landscaping business in Florida. “I’ve always liked to work independently,” he says. Originally from Colombia, Esteban lives with his wife and one of his daughters. The landscaping business employees four people. Esteban supports one of his daughters, as well as his wife’s relatives.

Five years ago when Esteban started his company, he knew it was a good idea. “Businesses are good as long as one makes the effort, is determined and exercises imagination.” His clients include plant nurseries, commercial properties, and residential properties. He is also working on expanding the business, exporting tractors for agriculture to Colombia. Esteban’s educational background includes work in Economics and International Business; combining this with his landscaping business seemed like a natural fit.

Esteban will use this loan, his first with Accion, to purchase equipment to prep and clean surfaces. He believes this equipment will complement his existing landscaping activities. Looking to the future, Esteban wants “to consolidate the company in the U.S.” and “help out good people by creating jobs.”

loans.use: to purchase landscaping equipment

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica’s infectious energy and passion for helping others are just two of the things that set her apart from the rest. After many years of working at a preschool for special needs children, she decided to follow her dreams and obtain her real estate broker’s license. 
   
She was very successful in real estate at Coldwell Banker, but in 2008, things took a turn for the worse when the real estate market crashed.  After this happened, she decided to go back to working with people with special needs, by getting a job at a property management company that housed seniors. 

Working with special needs adults reminded her how much she loved to help people though her work. She started thinking of a way to give back to the community, while doing what she was most passionate about: real estate. It was then that Gratitude Real Estate was born. With every home sale she makes, Jessica gives back 15 percent of her commission to the charity of the buyer’s choice. 

Jessica will use her Kiva loan to pay for marketing as well as building a new website, which will be a resource for the community by listing volunteer opportunities as well as home buying information.  

Jessica’s hope for the future is that she will be able to make a difference in people’s lives, as well as helping them fulfill their homeowner dreams.

loans.use: to pay for marketing as well as building a new website

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis, a native of Uruguay, came to the U.S. as a young man. For nearly 30 years, he has worked in the construction industry. His company specializes in home building, renovations and additions. 

A loan of $3,250 will help him to purchase some additional supplies and equipment as well as provide working capital for his growing business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and have working capital.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a true lover of the arts. She began with Mexican art, specifically from Frida Kahlo, but her passion didn’t end there. She began collecting all kinds of art from Mexico. Then she expanded her appreciation to art of Latin America, and New Age and spiritual artifacts. One day, Sonia hopes to open a store with items from all over the world that enchant and delight.

The challenge for Sonia has been in finding wholesalers to work with, and finding a direct connection with artists whose work she loves. She also hopes, one day, to be able to sell her goods at the Hillcrest Farmers’ Market.

Sonia will use her Kiva loan to pay for inventory. The size of the loan will allow her to get volume discounts that she wasn’t able to get previously.

Accion San Diego is also helping get Sonia’s foot in the door with the Hillcrest Farmers’ Market, which Sonia really appreciates! With the help of generous Kiva lenders, Sonia’s business will continue to grow and thrive.

loans.use: to pay for more inventory.

loans.name: Enrica

texts.en: Enrica is 54 years old and lives in Baga, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is separated from her husband with three children now at their adult age. Enrica is the sole breadwinner and has earned a living from her honorarium as a Barangay Record Keeper (BRK) for more than 10 years already. Enrica earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase construction materials for house repair and renovation. Enrica has been a member of PMPC for almost five years. In the future, Enrica hopes to engage in business to add to her monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Johairah

texts.en:
Johairah is 27 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of cellphone accessories in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional cellphone accessories to sell for her business.

Johairah has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of cellphone accessories business for seven years and earns an income from buying and selling dry goods.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional cellphone accessories to sell for her business

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
By investing in a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, Rogelio decided to produce his own renewable energy (biogas) from his cows' waste. He used to buy significant quantities of the expensive fossil fuel-based LP gas for his home as well as for his milking activity. By taking advantage of his cows' manure and the natural methanisation process taking place inside the biodigester, he will become self-sufficient in his energy supply, thus saving a considerable amount of money every month. The biodigester also produces a nutrient-rich and organic fertilizer, which Rogelio will spread on his fields to improve the quality of the soil and increase his crops' yield, displacing the unsustainable chemical fertilizers. His animals' waste will not liberate greenhouse gases in the atmosphere anymore, nor contaminate underground water sources. Once he has repaid his loan, Rogelio plans to use the generated savings to increase his milk production capacity by investing in equipment and additional cows.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase an 8m3 waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.en:
By acquiring his 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, Edmundo made a crucial step towards reaching his ideal of living in a more sustainable way. Indeed, the biodigester will allow him to rapidly and definitively displace the non-renewable and expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizers he used to purchase for the operations of his farm. Through this investment, he will now produce his own biogas and biofertilizer simply by taking advantage of his animals' waste and closing the natural cycle of his farm. His and his family's living standards will improve and they will live in harmony with society and their environment, all of this while saving money! 

This loan represents 23% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 6m3 waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando owns many different animals on his farm: cows, horses, sheep and many hen who walk around the house. All these animals produce important quantities of manure, and Fernando has been looking for a waste treatment solution. Since he found out about Sistema Biobolsa and his biodigester has been installed, he is putting his animals' waste in the system, turning his farm into a cleaner place and above all producing his own biogas and organic fertilizer at no cost! He is looking forward to completely displacing the expensive LP gas and unsustainable chemical fertilizers he uses on his field, which will result in significant money savings. His animals' waste will not attract flies anymore, nor contaminate underground water sources, and his wife will be able to cook using biogas instead of the wood she used to collect in the surroundings every day. Her health will improve as the toxic smoke of the burning wood will be eliminated from the house, also limiting deforestation. The natural and nutrient-rich fertilizer will increase the yield of Fernando's corn fields, and he will therefore sell larger quantities in the local market, and earn more. With the savings and additional income, he plans to expand his cheese production. 

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in an 8m3 waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.en:
Griselda is a proud and ambitious young farmer who decided to invest in a biodigester in order to save money and protect the environment. She used to buy expensive LP gas, chemical fertilizers for her crops, as well as wood to cook and heat water. By using her biodigester and taking advantage of her animals' manure to produce her own biogas and biofertilizer, she is looking forward to living in a more sustainable way, transforming waste into resources. Prior to this investment, her cows, horses, sheep and poultry were producing important quantities of useless waste, which was contaminating and attracting swarms of flies. Using the waste as the main input for her biodigester allows Griselda to treat it and become more self-sufficient in terms of energy supply and fertilizers. She can now cook with biogas instead of wood, eliminating the toxic smoke from her house and reducing deforestation. The nutrient-rich and organic fertilizer produced by bacteria inside the biodigester will nourish the soil of her field and increase the yield of her vegetables, corn and oats, which she partly sells in the local market. She aims at expanding her vegetable production to diversify her family's food sources. Instead of spending money on LP gas, she will now use it to maintain her children in school for a longer time.

This loan represents 16% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to buy a 6m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Văn

texts.en:
Văn has worked in agriculture for more than 10 years, farming food.  She is 61 years old and married, with 4 children, but lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province, Vietnam.  The main harship that she faces in her life is not having a hygeinic latrine.

This is Văn's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build toilet.

With her business profit, Văn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick, to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods

loans.name: Uslizar

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Uslizar. Uslizar is a one of the Ruma agents who lives in Bekasi, the satellite city located in the east of Jakarta. Uslizar is happily married, and he and his wife have been blessed with two daughters; one is 13 years old, and the other one is 3 years old. 

As the head of the family, his main source of income comes from the small stall he manages that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits, and provides utility bill payments service.  It was about three months ago that Uslizar met a Ruma field staff who introduced him to Ruma. He decided to join Ruma by selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing utility bill payments to his surrounding community. Uslizar now has become a successful agent since his customers are people in the peri-urban area who are in needs of access to such services.
 
As the business continues to run, Uslizar hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva that will be used to process more mobile airtime and bill payment transactions, especially on the weekends. In the near future, Uslizar plans to add more products from Ruma to the things he serves, such as e-commerce for low income communities. In the photo, Uslizar is pictured with his elder daughter in their small stall.

loans.use: to have additional working capital to provide more mobile payment services in his community

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is single and buys and sells livestock as a business in the Philippines.  She requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell, and has been in this business for 1 year now.

Angeline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Tươi

texts.en:
Mrs. Tươi operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat.

Tươi is 48 years old and married with three children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Tươi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tươi has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tươi has been involved in her business for eight years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a biogas system. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a biogas system.

With her business profit, Tươi hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a biogas system.

loans.name: Thúy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thúy operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit.

Thúy is 48 years old and married with three children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thúy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thúy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Thúy faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build toilet.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 63 years old and a widow who has eight children. 

Herminia is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Herminia has been in the business for two years now and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is 56 years old and married with two children. San lives with two dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, San joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. San has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that San faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, San hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Mrs. Hà works in agriculture raising food. She is 28 years old and married with one child. Hà lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hà's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for four years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hà hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung has operated a food stall/restaurant selling soup for 1 year.  She is 50 years old and married with 3 children, living in the Hau Loc district in Thanh Hoa province, Vietnam.  One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Dung is not having a hygeinic latrine.

This is Dung's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, and she is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profits, Dung hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Renilda

texts.en:
Renilda is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Concepcion, Iloilo. Renilda runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her town. Renilda has been in the business for more than three years now.

Renilda is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods. With a loan, Renilda will be able to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Renilda hopes of making her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods

loans.name: Nghĩa

texts.en:
Nghĩa works in agriculture farming food. Nghĩa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Nghĩa is 42 years old and is married with three children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nghĩa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Nghĩa faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

Nghĩa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Bắc

texts.en:
Bắc has worked in agriculture farming food for more than 10 years.  She is 52 years old and married with 2 children, living and working in Thanh Hoa City, in Thanh Hoa provide, Vietnam.  The main harship that Bắc faces in her life is not having money to repair her latrine.

This is Bắc first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to repair her latrine/toilet.

With her business profit, Bắc hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to repair her latrine/toilet.

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en:
Lalaine is married, 38 years old, and has five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lalaine has a vulcanizing business in the Philippines. Lalaine has requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase welding machine supplies for her shop.

Lalaine has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: purchase welding machine supplies for her shop

loans.name: Rugongo Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Janet; she is a member of Rugongo Self Help Group.  She is 42 years old, married, and a mother of three children.  Hand in Hand Eastern Africa has helped her realize her strengths by training her on business management.  She operates a kiosk selling flour, cooking fat, salt, sugar, and other house hold items.  

Janet has taken a Kiva loan to buy more stock for her shop.  She hopes this will enable her to meet the customer's rising demand, which will improve income.  This will enable her provide basic needs for her family such food.

Janet is very happy to have Kiva.

loans.use: to buy  flour, cooking fat, salt, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Winarsih

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Winarsih. Winarsih is a housewife who has been blessed with three children: two sons and one daughter. Her husband works as a staff member in a local private company.  They live in Bekasi, a satellite city located to the east of Jakarta. The kids are going to the same elementary school. Winarsih and her husband realize that they have to save more to continuously support their children’s education. 

Therefore, to support her family, Winarsih runs a business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving utility bill payments in her community. She was introduced to this business by a Ruma agent who is her friend. Winarsih has been a member of Ruma for three years and she is one of the agents who is performing very well. As a stay-at-home mom, she has an advantage to sell to her peers who are mostly housewives in her neighborhood. These customers are getting familiar with mobile phones and internet, which is a good thing. Winarsih has become the pioneer in her community in providing mobile payment services. 

As the demand for transactions increases, Winarsih is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payments transactions, especially on the weekends. 

In the photo, Winarsih is the woman standing on the left with her friend who is a Ruma agent on the right. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services in her community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 12 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Liên

texts.en:
Liên works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Liên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Liên is 57 years old and is married with two children. Liên lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

Liên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Hảo

texts.en:
Hảo works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Hảo has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Hảo is 46 years old and is married with two children. Hảo lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Hảo joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hảo has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Hảo faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Hảo hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Châu

texts.en:
Châu works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Châu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Châu is 46 years old and is married with two children. Châu lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Châu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve his business. Châu has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Châu hopes for his children to find good jobs, for his family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 39 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are in school. 

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Lanie has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vegetables like bananas, radishes and so on to sell. Lanie has been selling vegetables for 21 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables like bananas and radishes to sell.

loans.name: Hiền

texts.en:
Hiền operates a food stall/restaurant selling bread. Hiền has been involved in this business for one year. Hiền is 31 years old and is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hiền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

Hiền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Vĩnh

texts.en:
Vĩnh has a retail business selling sugar, milk and salt. Vĩnh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Vĩnh is 43 years old and is married with two children. He lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Vĩnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Vĩnh faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

Vĩnh hopes to make enough money to provide for his kids, for his business to do well, and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Doan

texts.en:
Doan is 62 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

The main hardship that Doan faces in her life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build two latrines. This is Doan's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

Doan works in agriculture, farming food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. With her business profit, Doan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build two latrines.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is a 53-year-old widow and a mother of seven children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in her fishing business for more than 12 years now. This is the source of her income.

Liberty is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters. This loan will help her to improve her fishing business, thus augmenting her profit and income.

In the future, Liberty hopes to make her fishing venture more sustainable and profitable. She also wants to save some money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters

loans.name: Mậu

texts.en:
Mậu is 54 years old and married with three children. She lives and works in the Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Mậu works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. With her business profit, Mậu hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

In 2010, Mậu joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Mậu has successfully repaid one loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic toilet. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is 25 years old and married with two children. She lives in the Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. 

In 2014, Dung joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Dung operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish, and has been involved in this business for eight years. Dung has successfully repaid one loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Dung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her children to find good jobs.

The main hardship Dung faces in her life is not having a hygienic toilet. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Shella May

texts.en:
Shella May is a 27-year-old married woman with a six-year-old child from Concepcion, Iloilo in the Philippines. She earns a living through her retail sales of soft drinks. This has been the source of her income for the past two years now.

Shella May is asking for a loan to buy more soft drinks to sell. This loan will help her improve her stocks thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.

In the future, Shella May hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a 12 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 56 years old and widow with two children.

Rosita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosita has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and a rice retailing businesses.

Rosita aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Xuân

texts.en:
Xuân has a service business shipping goods. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

Xuân is 23 years old and he is married with 1 child. He lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Xuân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns his is not having latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build toilet.

In the future, Xuân hopes for his children to do well in school, to maintain a successful business, and for his business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build toilet.

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Edelmira es que su hogar puede tener una vida digna.
El prepara y vende comidas por encargo como desayunos y almuerzos en el municipio de La Dorada, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.
Su esposa e hijos son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.
El espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra de un horno, este impulso se lo pueden dar la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva.
Con estos elementos ella podrá tener sus alimentos disponibles para sus clientes en todo momento.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener un restaurante en la misma zona para no perder a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Thanks to her perseverance and courage, Edelmira and her household can have a decent life.

Edelmira prepares and sells meals to order, including breakfasts and lunches, in the municipality of La Dorada. Edelmira learned this trade in order to earn another income to support her family.

Edelmira's husband and children and her greatest motivation to work hard every day in order to be better.

Edelmira hopes to give her business a push forward by buying an oven. She can does this with the help of Interactuar and Kiva lendes.

With this oven, Edelmira can have her meals ready for customers at any time.

Edelmira's biggest dream is to have a restaurant nearby so that she would not lose customers.

loans.use: to buy an oven.

loans.name: Thương

texts.en:
Thương has been running a food stall/restaurant selling fish for 3 years. She is 31 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Thương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has already successfully repaid 1 loan from them.

The main harship that Thương faces in her life is not having a latrine. Therefore she is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Thương hopes for her children to do well in school, to be able to maintain a successful business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Thắng

texts.en:
Thắng has a service business laying bricks, and she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is 52 years old and married with 4 children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thắng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main harship that Thắng faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. Therefore she is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Thắng hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 48-years-old and married. She has five children, three of whom are in school, and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rebecca has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for food production. She has been in this business for 23 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food production

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 29-year-old, married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo, and she is the mother of a 4-month-old baby. 

Emily runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. She has been in this business for more than 4 years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits and bread, condiments, rice and other products. Emily believes that a loan will help her to improve on the stock she holds and thus attract more buyers into her store.

In the future, Emily dreams of making her business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits and bread, condiments, rice and other products

loans.name: Mainumby Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mainimby  hace once ciclos que se formo, son de la ciudad de Encarnación, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que a través de la encuesta de los 50 indicadores pueden conocer la situación de vida de cada una de ellas, y conforme a ello poder trabajar y crecer y poder ayudar a sus familias.
Elba es integrante de este grupo y comenta que tiene una despensa en su casa,  a la vez también hace comidas para vender en su despensa, comenta que todos los días empieza su trabajo desde muy tempranas horas, ya que siempre va en busca de productos frescos para sus clientes, es muy conocida en el barrio por ser amable y muy simpática.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, carne, frutas, productos a granel y demás.
texts.en:
The group named “Mainumby” has completed 11 loan cycles since its formation. The members are from the city of Encarnación and are participating in the poverty elimination program. By taking the survey of 50 indicators, the members are able to become familiar with each of their life situations. As a result, they are able to work and grow so that they can help their families.

Elba is a member of this group. She says that she has a store in her house, but she also prepares food that she sells from her business. Elba states that she begins her work every day in the early morning hours. She is always looking for fresh products to sell to her customers. Elba is well-known in the neighborhood for being friendly and courteous.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy various supplies for her store such as vegetables, meat, fruits, bulk goods, and other products.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fruits, bulk goods, and other products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria de 64 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tamales de pollo desde hace 20 años, vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias y ya tiene clientes establecidos,  ella vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar y esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de verduras, pollos, maíz, tomates, etc. para seguir con sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Victoria, 64, has made a living selling chicken tamales for twenty years. She travels to various communities to sell her products, and she already has established clients. She lives in her own house with her family. She is applying for a loan to buy vegetables, chicken, corn, tomatoes, etc. to continue with her sales and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, chicken, corn, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Dario Miguel

texts.es:
Dairo es un productor agrícola que como muchos tiene su historia desde sus antecesores que años atrás formalizaron el negocio y que hoy le toca hacerse responsable y velar por su manteamiento.
Todo lo relacionado con el cultivo y la cría de animales lo aprendió de su padre y es en honor a él que quiere levantar su negocio y hacerlo más productivo pues por mucho tiempo estuvo siempre produciendo lo mismo y él tiene la idea de ampliarlo y hacer llegar sus productos a mas hogares.
Por dicha razón Dairo solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos como abonos, riegos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, insecticidas etc.
Con este crédito expandiera sus cultivos y mejorar sus ventas, soñando un día con dejarle a algunos e sus dos hijos una finca muy productiva y sostenible en el tiempo.
texts.en:
Dario is an agricultural producer, just like many of his ancestors. He started his business years ago and today he conducts himself responsibly and sees to it that his business is maintained.

Everything that he knows about farming and raising animals was learned from his father. To honor his father, Dario wants to improve his business and make it more productive. For quite some time, his production level has always remained the same. His plan is to increase his production and deliver his crops to more households.

For this reason, Dario is requesting a loan in order to pay for inputs such as compost, irrigation, fertilizers, pesticides, insecticides, and other items. With this loan, he will be able to expand his crops and improve his sales. One day he dreams of leaving something for his two children and still have a productive and sustainable farm over time.

loans.use: to pay for compost, irrigation, fertilizers, pesticides, insecticides, and other items.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Esperanza es una mujer de 44 años de edad que se gana la vida con  su negocio de venta de productos básicos, actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años y en la que se ha apoyado para salir adelante con su familia. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que habita al lado de su compañero de vida y su hijo. Esperanza sabe que para invertir en su negocio necesita de una gran inversión con la cual no cuenta actualmente, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: jabón, detergente, cloro, champú, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, etc. Para poder ofrecer de esta manera un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a 44-year-old woman who earns her living by selling basic products. She has been in this business for three years and it has allowed her to support her family so that they can get ahead. Esperanza is a hardworking woman who lives with her life companion and her son. She knows that she must invest in her business. However, she does not have the funds at the moment.

For this reason, Esperanza is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in soap, detergent, bleach, shampoo, rice, sugar, snack foods, and other products. This will allow her to provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergent, bleach, shampoo, rice, sugar, snack foods, and other products.

loans.name: Yazmina

texts.es: Yazmina es una mujer de 56 años de edad, tiene un negocio de almacén misceláneo en el que comercializa artículos como detalles para toda ocasión, talcos y perfumes, accesorios entre otros, además elabora artículos para bebes como pañaleras, canastas para productos de aseo personal, cubrelechos, sábanas, cojines y demás . Su idea de negocio inicio como una oportunidad de generar ingresos para su familia y  ocupar su tiempo libre, actualmente lleva 10 años en esta actividad y con una clientela fidelizada; vecinos, familiares y amigos.  Sus compras las hace en almacenes de Soledad y Barranquilla, quienes les ofrecen facilidad de pago, ella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual comprará ropa, artículos para bebes como jabones, perfumes, pañales. Aunque su gran desafío es el capital insuficiente que posee, Yazmina tiene como meta a futuro fortalecer su capital de trabajo para tener mejor rentabilidad en su negocio, es por ello que esta emprendedora mujer trabaja muy comprometida 10 horas diarias. Ella es madre de cuatro hijos y su meta familiar es mejorar sus condiciones y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yazmina is 56 years old. Her business is a store where she sells miscellaneous items such as gifts for any occasion, powders and perfumes, and accessories, among others. She also makes items for babies, such as diaper bags, baskets for personal cleaning products, blankets, sheets, cushions, and others. 

Her business idea started as an opportunity to earn an income for her family and spend her free time. She has now had this activity for ten years and has a faithful clientele of neighbors, family and friends. She buys her products in warehouses in Soledad and Barranquilla which offer her payment facilities.

She is applying for a Kiva loan, her first with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy clothing and items for babies such as soap, perfumes, and diapers. Her great challenge is her lack of capital. Her goal for the future is to strengthen her working capital to have a more profitable business. Therefore, this female entrepreneur is committed to working ten hours per day. She is a mother of four children, and her goal in terms of her family is to improve their conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing and items for babies such as soap, perfumes, and diapers.

loans.name: Jorge  Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 7 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jorge, 58, lives in his own house with his wife. He has had a store located in his home for seven years. He has many clients due to the good prices and his friendliness when making sales. He is applying for a loan to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc. so that he can have a better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an assortment of banana trees to capitalize on his business.

loans.name: Nohemy Arely

texts.es:
Nohemy, tiene un comedor en el que trabaja con un horario de 10:00 a 9:00 p.m., todo lo relacionado con la cocina le ha gustado desde muy jovencita, el negocio lo inicio por iniciativa propia y como una fuente de ingresos para cumplir con sus compromisos, está casada, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en casa de su hermano.
Invertirá en el pago de la remodelación del local de su negocio, con está cambio de imagen atraerá la atención de sus clientes, brindara un servicio cómodo e higiénico, espera tener mayores ventas e ingresos, de esta forma resarcirá su deuda.
Sus aspiraciones son lograr tener un local propio y tener un patrimonio para ayudar a sus hijos a que se superen académicamente.
texts.en:
Nohemy has a diner where she works from 10:00 A.M. to 9:00 P.M. She has always enjoyed everything about cooking from a young age. Nohemy started her business on her own and it has become a source of income that allows her to fulfill her commitments. She is married and lives at her brother’s house with her husband and children.

Nohemy will invest in renovations to her business location. Changing the appearance will attract the attention of her customers and allow her to provide comfortable service in a sanitary environment. She hopes to have increased sales and more income, which will allow her to repay her debt.

Nohemy’s aspirations are to have her own business and to leave a legacy to her children by helping them succeed academically.

loans.use: to invest in renovations to her business location since a new appearance will attract the attention of her customers.

loans.name: Ana Betty

texts.es:
Ana, esta necesitando de un nuevo crédito para comprar maíz, leña, gas propano y cal, para seguir trabajando en la venta de tortillas, al invertir en la materia prima al por mayor tiene un mejor margen de ganancias.
Los buenos beneficios de invertir el crédito anterior en su negocio son que tiene clientes satisfechos y recursos económicos para cubrir las deudas y necesidades familaires.
texts.en:
Ana needs a new loan to buy corn, firewood, propane gas and lime to continue working in tortilla sales. By investing in wholesale raw materials, she has a higher profit margin. 

The good benefits of investing her previous loan in her business are that she has satisfied clients and financial resources to cover her debt and family needs.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, propane gas and lime to continue working in tortilla sales.

loans.name: German Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Germán es un mecánico de todo tipo de vehículos muy experimentado. 
Ha adquirido muchas habilidades a través de pequeños estudios en diferentes academias y otra parte la ha aprendido empíricamente.

Adicional a su labor como mecánico también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de repuestos automotrices en el cual ofrece distintos tipos de repuestos en diferentes marcas.

Es un hombre muy trabajador y honrado que conoce el significado que tienen los vehículos para sus dueños y es por esto que siempre trata de ofrecer un excelente servicio, de buena calidad y de una manera eficiente.

Comprar herramientas de mano, adecuar su local y comprar surtido de repuestos para abastecerse.
texts.en:
Germán is a very experienced mechanic for all types of vehicles. He has gained many skills through his studies in various academies, and he also learned empirically. Aside from his job as a mechanic, he also has a small auto parts business where he offers various types and brands of spare parts.

He is a very hardworking and honest person who knows the meaning that vehicles have for their owners. This is why he always tries to offer an excellent, good-quality service in an efficient manner.

He will buy hand tools, outfit his property, and buy an assortment of spare parts to stock his business.

loans.use: to buy hand tools, outfit his property and buy an assortment of spare parts to stock his business.

loans.name: Kuña Katuoyry Group

texts.es:
Kuña Katypyry se formo en la ciudad de Encarnación con la unión de 22 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, como un medio de poder superarse y salir adelante.
Todas y cada una de ellas se están esforzando por poder crecer, destacándose entre ellas la Sra. Máxima, quien se dedica a la costura, oficio con el que ayuda a su familia, con mucho sacrificio. Ella comenta que tuvo que pasar por muchos obstáculos, pero que eso la hizo fuerte para poder seguir creciendo y luchando. Comenta que ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le lleva trabajos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás, que son muy necesarios para su trabajo y que le serán de mucha ayuda. Agradece por la oportunidad que reciben sus compañeras de poder seguir creciendo como lo hacen.
texts.en:
“Kuña Katypyry” was formed in the city of Encarnación as a result of 22 women who joined together. All of them are friends and neighbors from this city. They are participating in the poverty elimination program, which will help them be able to succeed and move forward.

All of the members are striving to grow. One member who stands out is Sra. Máxima, who works as a seamstress with great sacrifice in order to help her family. She says that she has had to face many obstacles, but she continues to grow and push forward, which has made her stronger. Máxima states that she has a very good clientele who is always giving her work to do.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics, thread, elastics, buttons, and other supplies that are needed for her work. This will be a great help. Máxima is grateful for the opportunity that she and her fellow group members have received so that they can keep growing as before.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, elastics, buttons, and other supplies.

loans.name: Gloria Concepción

texts.es:
Gloria, de 56 años de edad, estudió hasta 3º grado de educación básica, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, tienen 1 hijo que vive con ellos, además vive con su madre y una sobrina.

Gloria, desde su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió por medio de su familia pues la mayoría de sus miembros se han dedicado a la siembra de maíz y frijol, actualmente trabaja sembrando para su consumo, por lo general siembra 14,000 metros cuadrados de frijol y 7,000 de maíz, camina  unos 20 minutos para ir a ayudarle su hijo.

Anteriormente, ella solocito un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas, pero en esta ocasion es para pagar la mano de obra que necesita para sacar la cosecha y cortar el maíz y el frijol, este préstamo le beneficiaria mucho a Gloria, ya que por el momento no puede realizar esas labores por motivos de enfermedad. 

Gloria, espera poder recuperarse de la enfermedad que padece, para seguir trabajando y ayudar a su familia en las siembras postreras.
texts.en:
Gloria, 56, studied up until the third grade of elementary school. She is married and her husband is a farmer. They have one child who lives with them. She also lives with her mother and a niece.

She has worked in agriculture since childhood. She learned about this profession from her family, as the majority of her family members have made a living planting corn and beans. She currently plants for her consumption. She generally plants 14,000 square meters of beans and 7,000 of corn. She walks for twenty minutes to go help her son. 

She applied for a previous loan to buy farm supplies, but this loan will be used to pay workers she needs to harvest and cut her corn and bean crops. This loan will greatly benefit Gloria as she currently cannot do this work due to illness.

Gloria hopes that she will be able to recover from her illness to keep working and helping her family in future harvests.

loans.use: to pay the workers she needs to harvest and cut her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Rafael Eduardo

texts.es:
Rafael es un hombre soltero dedicado a la producción agropecuaria, un negocio que inicio por gusto al trabajo independiente y que aprendió gracias a  su padre.
Desde el año 1999 emprendió su propio camino   cultivando frutos y verduras que distribuye en la plaza de mercado, su idea es solicitar un crédito para aumentar sus cultivos invirtiendo en semillas, abonos, riegos, fertilizantes.
Con la ayuda de este crédito Rafael tendrá mejores ventas  que le permitan juntar dinero para comprar una vivienda.
Anímate Rafael espera tu ayuda
texts.en:
Rafael is a single man who is devoted to agricultural production. He started this business because he enjoys working independently. Thanks to his father, he was able to learn this trade.

Rafael started down his own path of growing fruits and vegetables in 1999. He sells his products at the plaza market. His plan is to request a loan so that he can increase his crops. He will invest in seeds, compost, irrigation, and fertilizers.

With the help of this loan, Rafael will have better sales. This will allow him to set aside money toward the purchase of a home.

Encourage Rafael with your support.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, compost, irrigation, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Turyaningsih

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Turyaningsih. She is happily married, and she and her husband have been blessed with two children; a six-year-old daughter and a two-year-old son. They live in Bekasi, the satellite city located to the east of Jakarta. Turyaningsih’s husband works as a staff member in a local private company. 

About nine months ago, Turyaningsih decided to join Ruma. She was excited about becoming a Ruma agent because she wanted to start a business and learn about mobile phone technology. Turyaningsih is now running a small stall that sells mobile phone air-time services and utility bill payments. The stall is located in front of the family’s house so she can multi-task between taking care of the children and managing the business.
 
Turyaningsih is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva to help the business continue to operate. She will use the capital to process more mobile phone air-time credits and utility bill payment transactions, especially on the weekends.
 
In the photo, Turyaningsih is sitting in her small stall with her daughter who is smiling at us.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone air-time credits and utility bill payment transactions in her community

loans.name: Rumsari

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Rumsari. She is a micro-entrepreneur who runs a small stall that sells women’s fashion products: dresses, pashminas, veils, etc. In her stall, she also sells mobile phone sim cards, mobile phone air-time credits and utility bill payments.The stall is located in front of the family’s house so Rumsari can multi-task between taking care of her family and managing the business. 

Rumsari is happily married, and she and her husband have been blessed with a five-year-old son. They live in Bekasi, the satellite city located to the east of Jakarta. About three months ago, Rumsari decided to join Ruma. She was excited about becoming a Ruma agent because she wanted to start a business and learn about mobile phone technology. 

Rumsari is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva to help the business continue to operate. She will use the capital to process more mobile air-time credits and utility bill payment transactions, especially on the weekends.
 
In the photo, Rumsari is the one standing behind the small cabinet with her son: she is looking at her phone while serving her customer who is looking at us.

loans.use: to process more mobile air-time credits and utility bill payment transactions in her community

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Siti. She is a housewife who runs a micro-business by selling mobile phone air-time credits and utility bill payments. Siti is happily married, and she and her husband have been blessed with two beautiful daughters: one is five years old; the other is one year old. They live in Bekasi, the satellite city located to the east of Jakarta. 

About one and a half years ago, Siti decided to join Ruma. She was excited about becoming a Ruma agent because she wanted to start a business and learn about mobile phone technology. Siti is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva to help the business to continue to operate. She will use the capital to process more mobile air-time credits and utility bill payment transactions, especially on the weekends.
 
In the photo, Siti is the one who is looking at us: she was serving her customer when the photo was taken. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone air-time credits and utility bill payment transactions in her community

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado kuña kyrey  está en su ciclo número 8 º  del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están dentro del programa de la eliminación de la pobreza, a través del cual están mejorando bastante, gracias a las capacitaciones que van recibiendo.
La Sra. Miguela es un digno ejemplo quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir que ha superado su situación de pobreza extrema a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo, ya que es consciente que debe seguir esforzándose. Miguela se dedica a hacer chipas, el cual es un alimento típico paraguayo, y por medio de este trabajo tiene los medios para ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus chipas para la venta, y de esa forma seguir con su emprendimiento, quiere comprar harina de maíz, queso, anís, huevo, manteca y demás.
texts.en:
The group named “Kuña Kyrey” is in its eighth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. The members are also participating in the poverty elimination survey, which will help them to improve thanks to the training they have received.

Sra. Miguela is a fine example of this. Her latest survey indicated that she is at a Stage 3 poverty level. This means that she has been able to overcome her extreme poverty situation through her efforts and continuous work. She is aware that she must continue to do her best. Miguela makes “chipas” (cheese bread), which is a traditional Paraguayan staple. Through her work, she is able to help her family.

Miguela is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies so that she can continue making “chipas” to sell and keep her business in operation. She wants to buy cornmeal, cheese, aniseed, eggs, shortening, and other items.

loans.use: to buy cornmeal, cheese, aniseed, eggs, shortening, and other supplies for making cheese bread.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 60 years old, single and works hard to help her nephews.

She has a buy and sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Valentina is borrowing 27,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional stock of medicine to sell for her buy and sell herbal medicine business.

Valentina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of medicine to sell.

loans.name: Tunas Rahayu Group

texts.en:
The members of the Tunas Rahayu group have repaid their previous loan of 15,000,000 IDR to MUK on time. They tell us that they have been earning an increasing amount of profit during the six-month loan period. The pigs have been able to grow fat and healthy. They can sell the pigs for a high price because there is a lot of demand from the market. This situation stimulates their spirit to run their business. The Tunas Rahayu group hopes that the cooperation between MUK, Kiva and themselves as clients continues smoothly and lasts a long time. 

Ayu Komang, as the Treasurer of the group, is responsible for controlling and monitoring the members of her group. She has been helped by other boards. She has sold all her pigs and has earned a satisfactory profit. She has saved all the profit and will be using it later for business capital.

The Tunas Rahayu group has received a new loan of 15,000,000 IDR. The loan will be used to increase the number of piglets, renovate their pens and purchase superior feed. The group still needs a loan until they have enough capital to run the business by themselves. Now they already have savings and are using them for capital.

Ayu Komang is using the loan to purchase two superior quality piglets and pig feed. She hopes that she will soon have enough savings and be able to continue the business by herself. Ayu Komang and the group members feel happy to be receiving support for all this time from lenders, Kiva and MUK.

loans.use: to purchase two superior quality piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is a married man from Ormoc, Leyte. He has six children. four of whom still attend school. Alberto has been raising and selling pigs for three years now. In the photo, Alberto is standing by sacks of pig feed.

Alberto is encountering financial problems and is in need of capital to sustain his livelihood. He is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy additional pigs and pig feed. In this way, Alberto would then be able to raise and sell more pigs in the coming months. This could lead to constant improvement in his earnings, thus providing his family with a healthy diet.

Alberto would like to expand his pig raising business so it becomes productive and, hopefully, this could support his children's education.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Berta Luz

texts.es:
Berta encontró en la producción de leche la mejor manera de mantener a su número familia pues criar 7 hijos no es para nada una tarea fácil.
Sus conocimientos de producción de leche los aprendió de sus padres quienes le heredaron el negocio. 
Berta tiene unos ahorros pero necesita dinero para completar el valor que tiene una vaca lechera por tal razón solicita una ayuda pues con esta vaca podrá aumentar su producción de leche y buscar un mejor bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Berta discovered that milk production is the best way for her to support her large family. Raising seven children is not an easy task. She gained her knowledge of milk production from her parents and inherited this business from them.
