Berta has some savings, but she needs additional funds to cover the price of a dairy cow. For this reason, she is requesting assistance. With another cow, she will be able to increase milk production and improve the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to add to her savings so that she can purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more retail goods

loans.name: Osias Jr.

texts.en:
Osias Jr. is a businessman from Concepcion, Iloilo. He is 44 years old. He runs a sari-sari or variety store in his place. He sells goods like rice, condiments and toiletries. He also sells dried fish.

Osias Jr. is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like rice, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, sugar and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, and dried fish. 

With a loan, Osias Jr. will be able to improve his stock, thus allowing him to sell more to his customers.

In the future, he dreams of expanding his store so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like rice, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, sugar and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, and dried fish

loans.name: Ambrosio

texts.en:
Ambrosio owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells basic merchandise ranging from powdered milk, cooking oil, eggs, vinegar, noodles, and vegetables to canned goods. He is a 65-year-old married man, and has five grown children. He lives in Ormoc, Leyte. He has been operating a store for five years already.

Ambrosio is asking for a loan of 38,000 PHP to buy additional groceries like dried goods, toiletries, beverages, noodles and soft drinks.  These supplies will be of great help to the Ambrosio's store; it helps attracts more buyers to shop and purchase, and eventually increases his earnings.

In the future, he dreams of expanding his business to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries like dried goods, toiletries, beverages, noodles and soft drinks

loans.name: Maria Carmenza

texts.es:
Maria cuenta con una experiencia de 20 años en la actividad de la confección, tiene su taller de confección a terceros en su casa desde hace 7 años. 
Trabaja durante todo el día y con su taller genera empleo a una familiar.
Esta actividad la aprendió de su madre quien le enseñó desde muy pequeña y con la experiencia en otros talleres. La ventaja es que ya tiene reconocimiento en el sector y la calidad de sus productos es muy buena, lo que le ha permitido cada vez conseguir más clientes para su negocio y también se ha transformado en buenos pedidos. 
Debido a que en la actualidad su capacidad de producción no alcanza para satisfacer a todos sus clientes, Maria requiere de un préstamo para comprar una máquina recubridora para aumentar la capacidad de producción.
Su mayor anhelo es salir adelante con su taller de confección y poder tener en su hogar unas mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar junto sus 2 hijos.
texts.en:
Maria has 20 years of experience in tailoring work. She has had her tailoring workshop in her home, where she sews for third parties, for the past 7 years.  She works all day in her workshop where she also employs a family member.  She learned this skill from her mother who taught her since she was very young.  She also learned from her experience in other workshops.

She has the advantage of already having recognition in the sector, and also that the quality of her work is very good.  This has allowed her to gain more and more customers for her business and has resulted in good orders.  

Due to her current production capacity, she is not able to satisfy the demands of all of her customers.  Because of this, Maria needs a loan to buy a coverstitch sewing machine in order to increase her production capacity.  Her biggest dream is to get ahead with her tailoring workshop and to be able to have better economic opportunities for her family so that she can advance together with her two children.

loans.use: to buy a coverstitch sewing machine to increase her production capacity.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 47, married, and a mother of seven children. They live in Lahore. Her husband runs a small printing press in a small market in Lahore. He has 25 years of experience in this business. He is hardworking and disciplined. Though he makes earnings, but given his big family, it gets difficult to cover all the family expenses. Now that their children are grown up, they also need to save money for their children's marriages.

Rubina's husband wants to increase his business by taking more printing orders for which he needs toner, inks, different varieties of paper, etc. 

Due to lack of money, Rubina is requesting loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva field partner. This loan is a ray of hope for their family. 

They are thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's printing press supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bricks and cement to make the necessary renovation for the backyard of the house.

loans.name: Harwoma Abagambakamu Group

texts.en:
Jack is a 43-year-old hard working married man with five children, aged 15, 10, 7, 5 and 3 years, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a member of the group where every member guarantees the other in accessing a loan. He acquired his start-up capital from farming. He opened up a retail shop with general merchandise to help him look after his family, and has been in business for six years. 

Jack has a personal goal of educating his children, and dreams of building a permanent home for his family and a business goal of trading into wholesale.  

Jack is requesting a loan to purchase sodas, beer, sugar and salt for the retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, beer, sugar and salt for the retail shop.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez, a 48-year-old housewife, is a mother of five children. She lives with her family in a rented house in Lahore. Her husband has a fruit and vegetable shop. He has been in this business for the last 10 years. Given their family's big size, meeting the regular expenses is not easy. Their children are growing up, and so are their needs. 

With the hope to make his business more lucrative, her husband wishes to buy fresh seasonal fruits like oranges, bananas, apples, etc. With this investment, he is hopeful that he will attract more customers and increase his customers. 

Kaneez has therefore requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva field partner, to help her husband. 

They are pleased and hopeful to reap its benefits in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruit for her husband's business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a food vendor from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is 41 years old, married, and has five children. Marites cooks and sells foods and sweets to the people in her place. This is her source of income for more than 13 years now.

Marites is asking to take a loan to buy more ingredients like fruit, milk, sugar, meat, vegetables and others. With this, she will be able to cook more and sell more to her customers. 

In the future, Marites hopes of making her business a success, and sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money to pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like fruit, milk, sugar, meat, vegetables and others

loans.name: Furaha's Group

texts.en:
Furaha is a 35-year-old Komaza tree farmer. She has five children, four of whom are in school. Furaha is married, and her spouse is a clearing and forwarding agent. In addition to growing trees, Furaha also supports her family with subsistence farming. 

She decided to join Komaza because she knows that she will benefit in the future after selling the trees, and plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to buy a plot and build a permanent house for her family. 

Furaha’s favorite part about working with Komaza is growing cowpeas as part of the short term crops program. 

Furaha is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Kabibi's Group

texts.en:
Kabibi is a 35-year-old Komaza tree farmer. She has three children, two of whom are in school. Kabibi is married, and her spouse is a driver. In addition to growing trees, Kabibi also supports her family with growing vegetables to sell and subsistence farming. 

She decided to join Komaza to improve her family's living standard. After harvesting the trees, and she plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to to pay school fees for her children. 

Kabibi’s favorite part about working with Komaza is growing cowpeas and sorghum as part of the short term crops program. Kabibi is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Uhuru's Group

texts.en:
Uhuru is a 46-year-old Komaza tree farmer. He has seven children, four of whom are in school. Uhuru is married, and his spouse is a farmer, too. In addition to growing trees, Uhuru also supports his family with subsistence farming and being a security guard. 

He decided to join Komaza to improve his family's living standard, and plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to start a business. Uhuru’s favorite part about working with Komaza planting cowpeas and keeping the harvest to feed his family. Uhuru is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 42-two year old Komaza tree farmer. She has eight children, all of whom are in school. Eunice is married and her spouse is a farmer, too. 

In addition to growing trees, Eunice also supports her family with subsistence farming. She decided to join Komaza because she was encouraged to do so by existing Komaza farmers. She plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to start her own business. 

Eunice’s favorite part about working with Komaza is growing cowpeas as part of the short-term crops program.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Kadzo's Group

texts.en:
Kadzo is a 38-year-old Komaza tree farmer. She has nine children, four of whom are in school. Kadzo is married, and her spouse is a farmer, too. In addition to growing trees, Kadzo also supports her family with subsistence farming and making charcoal to sell. 

She decided to join Komaza because she heard positive things about the microforestry program from other Komaza farmers. She plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to buy flour to feed her family, and to educate her children. 

Kadzo’s favorite part about working with Komaza is growing cowpeas and sorghum as part of the short term crops program. 

Kadzo is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Mita

texts.en:
Mita is 32 years old and a married woman who lives in Sridharkati village, West Bengal. She has a son who is studying in school. 

She is an active volunteer of Sundarbans Seed Producers Group, which is maintained by the NGO “Sahaja Samrudha.” This organization is engaged in empowering the local communities through promotion of health and social development-related awareness since 1988. 

Mita is hard worker. She is working under Sundarbans Seed Producer Association in seed production, processing and packaging. She is passionate to excel in organic seed production and eager to share her learning with the local communities to earn additional income through diversified crop planning and organic seed production, for which she is in need of financial support. 

She is requesting a loan from Kiva to improve seed production, processing and packaging. Help Mita to have better future.

loans.use: to improve seed production.

loans.name: Linda Maria

texts.es:
Linda es una mujer dedicada a su familia y a su labor. Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido salir adelante, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que se le han presentado. 
Desde hace 14 años inició su propio negocio, un salón de belleza cerca a la casa donde reside, además, también presta el servicio a domicilio, según el requerimiento de sus clientes. 
Esto le ha permitido generar los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y a solventar las necesidades de su único hijo. 
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de un secador para el cabello e insumos al por mayor (tratamientos capilares, shampoo, acondicionador, esmaltes para uñas, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y prestar un servicio más completo a sus clientes, de una manera más ágil y eficiente; lo que beneficiará el margen de utilidades que percibe por su labor. 
Linda manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder continuar con su labor, acreditar y fortalecer bien su negocio para lograr ser más competitiva en el mercado y así tener la capacidad para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Linda is a woman who is dedicated to her family and her work. Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to get ahead and overcome a variety of obstacles she has encountered. 

Fourteen years ago, she opened her own business, a beauty salon near the house where she lives. Additionally, she offers her services in the home, according to her customers' needs. 

This has allowed her to generate sufficient resources to support her husband with the economic responsibilities of the household and pay for some of her only child's needs.

The loan that she requests will be invested in the purchase of a hair dryer and supplies in bulk (hair treatments, shampoo, conditioner, and fingernail polish, among others), this will permit her to continue in her work and offer more complete services to her customers, in a more flexible and efficient way, which will benefit the margin of utilities that she gets from her work.

Linda states that her greatest desire is to be able to continue working, be recognized, and strengthen her business to become more competitive in the market and, so, to have the capacity to offer a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a hair dryer and supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is married and a loving mother of three children. She is caring and supports her children to grow in their lives. 

One of her sons runs a small general store in their community. He is obedient and hardworking. He started this business at a very young age; therefore, Kalsoom wants to support him financially to make his business sustainable. 

Her son wishes to buy more inventory for his shop to increase sales and make it more lucrative. But with insufficient funds it is not possible. Kalsoom has therefore requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan to help her son. She is hopeful for her son's better future.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her son's general store.

loans.name: Dean Jersei

texts.es:
Dean es un hombre muy emprendedor y tenaz, con grandes deseos que ha estado cultivando y tratando de cumplir.
Tiene un pequeño negocio de preparación y venta de comidas rápidas.
Con esta actividad intenta día a día  salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia compuesta por su esposa y su hijo de 2 años quienes son el motor de su vida y su motivación para luchar diariamente.
Su mayor dificultad es la competencia del sector, pero con su gran capacidad de trabajo es capaz de sostenerse y progresar.
Dean solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de insumos para sus recetas y mantenimiento de su carro de comidas.
Con esta ayuda podrá cumplir su sueño de otorgar una buena educación a su hijo
Con tu ayuda Dean Podrá pagar la educación de su hijo que es uno de sus más grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Dean is an enterprising and determined man, with great desires that he has been cultivating and attempting to achieve. 

He has a small business of preparing and selling fast food.

With this work, he tries day by day to get ahead and improve the living conditions of his family, which is made up of his wife and his 2-year-old child who are the driving force in his life and his motivation to struggle daily. 

His greatest difficulty is the competition in the area, but with his great capacity to work, he is capable of sustaining himself and progressing. 

Dean asks for a loan to purchase supplies for his recipes and to do maintenance on his food cart. 

With this help, he will be able to realize his dream of offering his child a good education.

With your help, Dean will be able to pay for his child's education, which is one of his biggest dreams!

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his food preparation and do maintenance on his food cart.

loans.name: Samson's Group

texts.en:
Samson is a 39-year-old Komaza tree farmer. He has two children, one of whom is in school. Samson is married and his spouse is a farmer, too. 

In addition to growing trees, Samson also cultivates and he supports his family with being a tout for a matatu (public transportation vehicle).

He decided to join Komaza because trees are important to him and he's happy when he sees them growing well. He plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to pay school fees for his children. 

Samson’s favorite part about working with Komaza is being taught how to plant trees in rows with the correct spacing. Samson is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Ovidio Alexander

texts.es:
Ovidio, tiene como negocio la crianza de ganado y el cultivo de granos básicos, de muy joven ha trabajado en el campo, con esfuerzos a comprado ganado para tener ingresos extras, su familia está integrada por su esposa y dos hijos, un niño de 6 años y una niña de 6 meses de nacida, por el momento no representa dificultades en su negocio.
El crédito le servirá para pagar obreros que le ayuden a la recolección de la cosecha de maíz y frijol, con el resto invertirá en el transporte de la misma hacia su casa para tener un mejor fruto de su trabajo, su esperanza es tener una situación económica más favorable.
Anhela aumentar las cabezas de ganado para ir mejorando su negocio y tener ingresos estables con los que saldrá adelante con su familia y resarcirá su deuda.
texts.en:
Ovidio has as his business raising cattle and growing basic grains. Since he was very young, he has worked in the countryside. With hard work, he has purchased cattle to have extra income. His family is made up of his wife and two children, a 6-year-old boy and a 6-month-old girl. For the moment, there are no difficulties in his business. 

The loan will help him to pay the workers who help him with the harvest of his corn and bean crops, with the rest he will invest in transporting the crops to his house to have better fruits of his labor. His hope is to have a better economic situation.

He wants to increase his heads of cattle to continue improving his business and to have stable income with which he will get ahead with his family and will pay off his debt.

loans.use: to pay the workers who help him to harvest his corn and bean crops, with the rest he will invest in transporting this harvest to his house.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence is a 52-year-old Komaza tree farmer. She has thirteen children, three of whom are still in school. Florence is married and her spouse is a farmer, too. 

In addition to growing trees, Florence also supports her family with subsistence farming. She decided to join Komaza because she heard positive things about the microforestry program from other Komaza farmers. She plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to buy a dairy cow.

Florence’s favorite part about working with Komaza is growing cowpeas as part of the short-term crops program. Florence is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Alphonce's Group

texts.en:
Alphonce is a 21-year-old Komaza tree farmer. He is not married and has no children. In addition to growing trees, Alphonce also supports supports himself with subsistence farming. 

He decided to join Komaza to overcome the challenges of poverty. He plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to to start a business and pay school fees for the children he hopes to have someday. 

Alphonce’s favorite part about working with Komaza is the planting and taking care of his tree farm. Alphonce is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Jorge Enrique

texts.es:
Jorge ha sido un padre muy dedicado, siempre pendiente del cuidado de su familia conformada por sus 3 hijos; desde siempre le ha gustado trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a vender mercancía desde hace 5 años, pues es responsable de llevar la carga económica de su hogar.

Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos del sector, trabaja solo todos los días en su negocio y encuentra en su labor la ventaja de poder estar pendiente de su familia, al mismo tiempo que logra ser productivo como comerciante.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor de productos de aseo como detergentes líquidos y desinfectantes, pues es una gran oportunidad en esta época del año, esto le permitirá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de navidad, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para su familia.

Jorge manifiesta que su mayor deseo es poder seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia y dar educación a todos sus hijos, para verlos convertirse en profesionales y tengan un futuro próspero y exitoso.

Jorge espera tu colaboración para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos!
texts.en:
Jorge has been a very dedicated father, he is always taking care of his family, made up of three children. He has always liked to work as an independent salesperson, he began to sell merchandise 5 years ago, since he is responsible for the economic needs of his household. 

His customers are his neighbors, family, and friends in the area. He works alone every day in his business and finds in his work the advantage of being able to be available to his family and at the same time manage to be productive as a sales person. 

Currently, he is asking for a loan to purchase a bulk supply of cleaning products such as liquid detergents and disinfectants, since this season is a great opportunity. With this, he will be able to stock more variety to satisfy the demand that increases in the Christmas season, giving as a result more income for his family. 

Jorge says that his greatest desire is to be able to continue supporting his family economically and providing all his children with an education, to see them become professionals and that they have a prosperous and successful future.

Jorge waits for your collaboration to improve his quality of life and that of his children!

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cleaning products in bulk such as liquid detergents and disinfectants.

loans.name: Kakala's Group

texts.en:
Kakala is a 65-five-year old Komaza tree farmer. He has five children, one of whom completed primary school. The rest were educated through year five. Kakala is married and his spouse is a farmer, too. 

In addition to growing trees, Kakala also supports his family with farming and he retired as a driver. 

He decided to join Komaza because he heard from other Komaza farmers that the trees provide a good windbreak and he will earn money after harvesting. 

He plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to build a permanent house for his family. 

Kakala’s favorite part about working with Komaza is the growing cowpeas as part of the short-term crops program. Kakala is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Kahindi's Group

texts.en:
Kahindi is a 70-year-old Komaza tree farmer. He has 11 children, all of whom have completed primary school. Kahindi is married and his spouse is a farmer, too. In addition to growing trees, Kahindi also supports his family with farming and tapping coconut trees for local wine. 

He decided to join Komaza to earn income from harvesting the trees. He plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to buy a cow so he can plow his fields more efficiently. 

Kahindi’s favorite part about working with Komaza is the growing cowpeas as part of the short-term crops program. Kahindi is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Kasena's Group

texts.en:
Kasena is a 55year-old Komaza tree farmer. He has six children, four of whom are in school. Kasena is married and his spouse is a farmer, too. In addition to growing trees, Kasena supports his family with subsistence farming. 

He decided to join Komaza when he saw existing farms and was encouraged by other Komaza farmers. He plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to pay school fees and buy food and clothes for his family. 

Kasena’s favorite part about working with Komaza is the growing cowpeas as part of the short-term crops program. Kasena is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 46-year-old Komaza tree farmer. She has five children, all of whom are in school. Joyce is married and her spouse is a farmer, too. In addition to growing trees, Joyce also supports her family with subsistence farming. 

She decided to join Komaza to improve her family's living standard after harvesting the trees. She plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to be able to provide her family with three meals a day. 

Joyce’s favorite part about working with Komaza is growing cowpeas as part of the short-term crops program.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr:
Fatimatou est âgée de 33 ans, revendeuse ambulante de détergents dans les quartiers Adzougba et ses environs, elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant et vit dans le quartier Agoè. Elle s’approvisionne dans le grand marché de Lomé deux fois par mois. 
Fatimatou demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et d’en tirer le maximum de bénéfices.
texts.en: Fatimatou is 33 years old. She is an itinerant saleswoman of detergents in the Adzouba district and surrounding area. She is married with one child and lives in the Agoe neighbourhood. She buys her supplies at the big market in Lomé twice a month. Fatimatou requests a loan to increase her stock in order to satisfy her customers and make as much profit as possible.

loans.use: to buy  22 packets of washing powder.

loans.name: Iterimbere Group

texts.fr:
Jeanne  fait partie du groupe  Iterimbere et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 32 ans et est mariée à Désiré, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 4 à 10 ans, dont  2 étudient.
 
Elle fait le commerce des produits vivriers (bananes, pomme de terre,…) depuis 10 ans. 

Elle est à  son cinquième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Jeanne is a member of the Iterimbere group and lives in Gitega. She is 32 and married to Desiré, who is a salesman. They have three children between the ages of four and ten, two of whom go to school.

She has been selling food products (bananas, potatoes,...) for 10 years.

This is her fifth loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan that she requests, she intends to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas for resale to earn more.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Benjamin Rafael

texts.es:
Benjamín, mantiene con vida su negocio de diseño gráfico, escaneo y fotocopiadora, con ayuda de préstamos ha ido mejorando y adquiriendo equipo para dar un buen servicio, sus ganancias le permiten cubrir el pago de sus deudas y tener el sustento diario para su familia.
Opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar una computadora con sistemas actualizados, papelería, tintas y otros materiales para realizar mejor su trabajo y seguir atendiendo a sus clientes de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Benjamín is keeping his graphic design, scanning and copying business alive. With the help of loans he has been improving and acquiring equipment to provide good service. His profits allow him to cover his debts and have daily support for his family.

He has decided to take out another loan to buy a computer with up to date systems, paper items, ink and other materials to do better work and continue to serve his customers in the best manner.

loans.use: to buy a computer with up to date systems, paper items, ink, and other materials to do better work and continue to serve his customers in the best manner.

loans.name: Eunesimo De Jesus

texts.es:
Eunesimo en su búsqueda por un futuro prometedor y unas buenas oportunidades para salir adelante, decidió iniciar un negocio que según él le dará todo eso que siempre ha soñado.

Montara un negocio de tienda de abarrotes en su casa en el municipio de Bello, con el cual planea sostener a su familia compuesta por sus dos hijos y su esposa.

Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital para trabajar.

Para lograr esto necesita la ayuda de un préstamo con la Corporación Interactuar que le permita comprar un enfriador, estanterías, vitrinas y surtido de productos básicos de la canasta familiar como abarrotes, granos, galletas y otros alimentos para abastecer e iniciar su negocio.

Apoya a los sueños emprendedores de un Colombiano con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Eunesimo, in search of a promising future and good opportunities to get ahead, decided to start a business that according to him will give him everything he has always dreamed of.

He will open a general store in his house in the town of Bello. With it, he plans to support his family made up of his two children and his wife. His main difficulty is a lack of working capital. 

To do this, he needs the help of a loan with Corporación Interactuar that will allow him to buy a cooler, shelving, display cases and an inventory of staple products such as groceries, grains, cookies, and other food to stock and start his business.

Support the enterprising dreams of a Colombian with a loan today!

loans.use: to buy a cooler, shelving, display cases and and inventory of staple products.

loans.name: Los Penocos Group

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 30 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de refrescos y helados tipo bolo.
Ella es buena madre, comprensiva, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, fuerte, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘Cotoca´ un área reconocida, a escala nacional, por su tradicional producción de jalea y melao (derivados de la caña de azúcar), como también de horneados de maíz y yuca, como el sonso, roscas, arepas, cuñapés y bizcochos. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía entre 21-35 grados centígrados a medida que avanza el día.
Carmen es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo amarrado, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español para el comercio (al centro, usa blusa celeste, pantalón floreado color blanco y negro). Su vida la realiza junto a sus hijos, el mayor estudia en la escuela y el menor se encuentra a su cuidado. La necesidad por incrementar sus ventas para generar mejores beneficios económicos, la llevaron a formar un banca de personas con negocios como; librería, comercio de cosméticos, venta de ropa, venta de fruta, venta de tomates, confección de tejidos, venta de pescado y venta de empanadas, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de refrescos al paso como; Mocochinchi (preparado con duraznos secos hervidos), Chicha (preparada en base a maíz), Somó (similar a la Chicha pero incluye el hervido del maíz), Quinoa con Manzana (quinoa hervida con manzana hervida), y otros. También vende helados tipo bolo que son muy populares por su precio accesible y por ser elaborados de fruta natural de todo tipo. “la venta de refrescos comienza muy temprano debido al calor, a media mañana los helados son refrescantes, ambos productos son muy consumidos por todas las personas de todas las edades…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda de gaseosas completa en el mercado, con mesas y sillas para que los clientes puedan descansar y refrescarse por un momento en el lugar y desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de gaseosas por mayor y así aumentar un producto más a su oferta diaria. Esta es la tercera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad independientemente. 
Es por esos motivos que Carmen Solicita un préstamo para la compra de gaseosas por mayor para aumentar un producto más a su oferta diaria.
texts.en:
Carmen is a woman, 30 years old, single, who has 2 children, ages 7 and 3. Her business is selling scoops of ice cream.

She is a good mother, understanding, patient, a good listener, supportive, strong, responsible, and hard-working. She has her business int he "Cotoca" zone, a well-known area, at the national level, for its production of traditional jelly and melao (sugar cane derivatives), as well as corn and yucca fried dishes such as sonsos, roscas (donuts), arepas (pancakes), cuñapés (filled rolls), and bizcochos (cakes). It has a warm climate, tropical and humid, with a temperature that varies from 21-35 degrees centigrade as the day advances. 

Carmen is tanned, short, has long black hair, her native language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish for business (she is in the center with a light blue shirt and black and white flowered pants). She makes her life alongside her children, the oldest is a student at school and the youngest is in her care. The need to increase her sales to generate more income led her to form a bank with people whose businesses are a bookstore, cosmetic sales, clothing sales, fruit sales, tomato sales, making woven products, fish sales, and empanada sales, to ask for a loan and expand their businesses. Her business is the the sale of soft drinks such as mocochinchi (made with boiled dried peaches), chicha (prepared with a corn base), somó (similar to chicha but it includes boiling the corn), quinoa with apple (boiled quinoa with boiled apple) and others. She also sells scoops of ice cream which are very popular for their accessible price and because they are made from all sorts of natural fruits. "Soft drink sales begin very early due to the heat, by mid-morning, the ice creams are refreshing. Both products are eaten a lot by all people of all ages..." she says. Her dream is to have a full soft drink shop in the market, with tables and chairs for the customers to rest and refresh themselves for a moment in that place, and she wants to make an investment in her business through purchasing soft drinks in bulk, and in this way increase the products in her daily offerings. This is the third loan cycle with the institution in the three years that she has been doing this work independently.  

For these reasons, Carmen asks for a loan to purchase soft drinks in bulk to increase the products in her daily offerings.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks in bulk to increase the products in her daily offerings.

loans.name: Awoussi

texts.fr: Awoussi est une femme mariée et mère deux enfants; Agée  de 53 ans; elle vit à Agoè et fait le commerce de Jus qu’elle vend dans une boutique dont elle est propriétaire. Awoussi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché d’Agoè depuis 2001. Dans le souci d’améliorer sa fréquence d’approvisionnement, elle sollicite un crédit pour aussi faire face à la concurrence afin de mieux vendre pour épargner en vue d’aider son marie dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en: Awoussi is a married woman with two children; aged 53, she lives in Agoe and sells fruit juice in a stall that belongs to her. Awoussi has been buying her supplies once a month at the market in Agoe since 2001. Hoping to improve the frequency of the supply of her provisions, she requests a loan which will also help her shape up against competitors to sell more so that she can save more and help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 27 bowls of hibiscus.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela es una joven con toda la energía y disposición para enfrentar el mundo y superarse.

Desea iniciar un negocio de venta de ropa interior, accesorios y otras mercancías, con este negocio podría obtener ingresos para poder mantener y sostener sus madre.

Es una joven muy aplicada pues estudia y tiene deseos de salir adelante y ser profesional.

Solicita un crédito para la compra surtido de este tipo de mercancía.

Con este préstamo puede cumplir su sueño de ser independiente, poder pagar sus estudios y progresar gracias al apoyo de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya el proyecto de una joven emprendedora Colombiano!
texts.en:
Daniela is a young woman with the energy and disposition to face the world and get ahead. She wants to start a business selling underwear, accessories and other merchandise. With this business she will be able to obtain income to support and help her mother.    

She is a young woman who is very industrious. She goes to school and wants to get ahead and graduate from college. She is asking for a loan to buy inventory of this type of merchandise. 

With this loan she can make her dream come true of becoming independent, being able to pay for her education and progressing, thanks to the support of  Kiva and Corporación Interactuar.

Support the project of a young, enterprising Colombian!

loans.use: to buy inventory of underwear and accessories for her business.

loans.name: Santos Isaac

texts.es:
Santos, agradece el apoyo que la institución le brinda con los préstamos cuando lo ha solicitado, ha podido tener recursos económicos para comprar ganado y recolectar la cosecha de granos básicos, está teniendo mayores ingresos, le da un nivel de vida más digno a su familia y puede satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes.
Hace la solicitud de un nuevo financiamiento para invertir en alimento y vitaminas para ganado, también pagara el alquiler de los potreros en donde están pastando, le permitirá prepararse para la época de verano.
texts.en:
Santos is grateful for the support that the institution offers him with loans when has asked for them. He has been able to have the economic resources to purchase cattle and harvest the basic grain crop, he is having more income He gives a more dignified level of life to his family and he is able to meet his customers' needs. 

He asks for this new loan to invest in food and vitamins for cattle, and also he will pay the rent for the pastureland where they are grazing, it will allow him to prepare for the summer.

loans.use: to invest in food and vitamins for cattle, and also to pay the rent for the pastureland where they are grazing, this will allow him to prepare for the summer.

loans.name: Samy You

texts.es:
Samy, de 31 años, inicio con un negocio de fotografía hace aproximadamente 1 año con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.
En el momento, encuentra su motivación para trabajar incansablemente en sus tres hijos y es así como desea ofrecerles lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.

Hoy en día sus hijos tienen 7,12 y 14 años y se han convertido en la alegría de esta mujer trabajadora.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como luces, sombrillas, vestuario, entre otros.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener su negocio y a sus hijos brindándoles una calidad de vida mejor.

Apoya a Samy para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Samy, 31 years old, opened her photography business approximately a year ago with the desire to look for a job that generates the income to be able to survive.

At the moment, she finds the motivation to work tirelessly in her three children and it is in this way she wants to offer them the best for their life and development.

Today, her children are 7, 12, and 14 years old, and have become the joy of this hardworking woman. 

She asks for a loan to purchase supplies such as lights, umbrellas, and a wardrobe among others.

With this loan she will be able to sustain her business and offer her children a better quality of life.

Support Samy so she can continue with her work!

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as lights, umbrellas, and a wardrobe, among others.

loans.name: Donaldo Ismael

texts.es:
Donaldo, con 56 años de edad, se ha dedicado por muchos años a vender abarrotes en una tienda en el municipio de Tierra Alta; de esta forma complementa los ingresos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos.
Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido luchar incansablemente, siempre buscando la manera de salir adelante, esto lo impulsa a solicitar el crédito para comprar una vitrina y comprará surtido al por mayor (mecato, gaseosas, dulces, productos de panadería, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y tendrá más variedad de artículos para ofrecer a los clientes, mejorando así las ventas y los ingresos.
Donaldo manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir un local propio ubicado en el centro de la ciudad para montar su negocio y lograr que sea mucho más rentable y que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
El confía en el apoyo de la Corporación interactuar y en los prestamistas de Kiva para lograr este objetivo.
texts.en:
Donaldo, 56 years old, has worked for many years selling groceries in a store in the municipality of Tierra Alta. In this way, he gets the income with which he has gotten his children ahead. 

His determination and perseverance have allowed him to struggle ceaselessly, always looking for a way to get ahead. This pushes him to ask for the loan to purchase a display case and he will purchase a supply in bulk (cakes, soft drinks, candies, and bakery products, among others); this will allow him to continue with his work and he will have more variety of products to offer his customers, in turn, increasing his sales and income. 

Donaldo states that his greatest desire is to get his own retail space located in the center of the city to establish his business and manage to be much more profitable and that it would guarantee a good economic stability to offer a better quality of life to his family.

He trusts in the support of the Interactuar organization and the Kiva lenders to be able to achieve this goal.

loans.use: to purchase a display case and purchase supplies in bulk (cakes, soft drinks, candies, and bakery product, among others)

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
La señora Sandra es una mujer muy emprendedora y creativa, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de comercialización de productos de uso personal.

 Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo, al apoyo que recibe de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que deseen que él salga adelante con su negocio.

De este negocio dependerán su esposo (Ver Foto) y sus dos hijos a los cuales desea enseñarles del negocio y dejarles un legado.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar surtido de desodorantes, cremas, lociones, entre otros.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora!
texts.en:
Sandra is a very enterprising and creative woman. For a long time she has wanted to be independent and have her own business selling personal use products. Now her dream can come true thanks to her great capacity for work, and to the support she is receiving from Corporación Interactuar and the people who want her to get ahead with her business. 

Her husband (see photo) and their two children will depend on this business. She wants to teach them the business and leave them an inheritance. She is asking for financial support to buy inventory of deodorants, creams, lotions and more. 

With a loan you can support an enterprising and hardworking woman!

loans.use: to buy inventory of deodorants, creams, lotions and more.

loans.name: Maria Ligia

texts.es:
Maria en su búsqueda por un futuro prometedor y unas buenas oportunidades para salir adelante, decidió iniciar un negocio que según ella le dará todo eso que siempre ha soñado.

Montara un negocio de tienda de abarrotes en su casa en el municipio de Medellín, con el cual planea sostener a su familia compuesta por sus hijos.

Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital para trabajar y la competencia del sector.

Para lograr esto necesita la ayuda de un préstamo con la Corporación Interactuar que le permita comprar un enfriador, estanterías, vitrinas y surtido de productos básicos de la canasta familiar como abarrotes, granos, galletas y otros alimentos para abastecer e iniciar su negocio.

Apoya a los sueños emprendedores de una Colombiana con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Maria, in search of a promising future and good opportunities to get ahead, decided to start a business that according to her she has always dreamed of.  She will open a general store in her house in the city Medellín. With it, she plans on supporting her family, made up of her children.  

Her main difficulty is a lack of working capital and the area competition. 

To achieve this, she needs the help of a loan from Corporación Interactuar, which will allow her to buy a cooler, shelving, display cases and inventory of staple products such as groceries, grains, cookies, and other food to stock and start her business. 

Support the enterprising dreams of a Colombian with a loan to day!

loans.use: to buy a cooler, shelving, display cases and inventory of staple products.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José tiene 48 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su  esposa y su hija de 17 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando . José se gana la vida por medio de la venta de cocos, leche y flores. Este negocio le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. José ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a  FUSAI para invertir en la comprar mayor cantidad de flores  y así poder mejorar sus ventas e ingresos  así poder continuar dando el estudio a su hija.
texts.en: José is 48 years old and lives in his own house alongside his wife and their 17-year-old daughter who is a student. José earns a living by selling coconuts, milk, and flowers. This business allows him to bring sustenance to the household and give his family better living conditions. José has decided to ask for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of more flowers, and in this way, improve his sales and income, and in turn continue to provide his daughter with an education.

loans.use: to purchase flowers to sell and in this way continue providing education for his daughter.

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
Diana es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo brindándole una educación de buena calidad.

Diana vive en unión libre con su pareja y desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a vender productos de uso personal a través de catalogo, con gran esfuerzo a superado muchos problemas que se le han presentado.

Actualmente Diana tiene unos muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y responder a los grandes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y desde este poder ofrecerles a su hijo una mejor estabilidad económica, sabe que de la mano de Interactuar podrá lograrlo.

Mejora la vida de esta colombiana con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Diana is a very hard-working person who, thanks to her daily efforts, has managed to get her child ahead, offering him a good quality education.

Diana lives in a common-law marriage with her husband and, a long time ago, began to sell personal products through a catalog; with a great effort she has overcome many problems she has encountered.

Currently, Diana has many good orders from her customers, and due to not having much capital, she seeks a loan to purchase personal use products and respond to the large orders her customers have. 

Her greatest dream is to get ahead with her business and from this be able to offer her son more economic stability. She knows that with Interactuar's hand, she will be able to achieve it.

Improve the life of this Colombian woman with a loan!

loans.use: to purchase personal products.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a fifty-one year old Komaza tree farmer. He has four children, three of whom are in school. Stephen is married and his spouse is a farmer, too. 

In addition to growing trees, Stephen supports his family with teaching. He decided to join Komaza because when he looks at the trees, he appreciates them because he knows he will get money from them.  He plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to start a large-scale farming endeavor. 

Stephen’s favorite part about working with Komaza is growing cowpeas as part of the short term crops program.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Federico

texts.es:
Con la ilusión de salir adelante y superarse, Federico desea montar un pequeño negocio de venta de frituras ubicado al frente de su casa en el municipio de Medellín.

Esta idea surge a partir de la necesidad económica que actualmente sufre. Aunque él siempre ha querido ser independiente, nunca había tenido el valor de arriesgarse a iniciar con un negocio; pero ahora se siente con la fuerza y capacidad para hacerlo.

El solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de frituras y comestibles para abastecerse y tener un buen inventario.

Con estos elementos podrá iniciar con este proyecto y podrá cumplir así su sueño de ser independiente.

Con el apoyo a este crédito estarás impulsando las ideas emprendedoras de una hombre colombiano humilde!
texts.en:
Federico wants to start a small business selling fried food outside his house in the town of Medellín so he can get ahead and improve himself.  This idea comes in part from his current financial need.  Although he has always wanted to work for himself, he never had the courage to take the risk of starting a business.  Now, however, he feeds the strength and ability to do it.

Federico's requesting a loan to buy a supply of fried foods and food to have a good inventory.  With these items he'll be able to begin his project and realize his dream of being independent.

With the support of this loan you'll be motivating the enterprising ideas of a modest Colombian man!

loans.use: to buy fried foods and food to stock up and have a good inventory

loans.name: Romelia Elisa

texts.es:
Romelia es una mujer de buenas ideas y de mente creativa, siempre está tratando de buscar actividades para aumentar sus ingresos familiares.
El desea montar un café internet desde vender alternativamente algunos elementos de papelería en el mismo negocio.
Ella tiene 54 años y tiene todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar los desafíos que la vida le tenga preparados.
Ella solicita un apoyo económico para comprar un computador, algunos elementos de papelería para surtir un poco sus vitrinas y exhibidores. 

Con este dinero podrá invertir en el montaje de su negocio y atraerá clientes impactando de esta manera sus utilidades de una manera positiva.

Su mayor sueño es tener una gran sala de internet con buenos ingresos y generar empleo.
texts.en:
Romelia is a woman with great ideas and a creative mind. She is always looking for activities that can improve the family income. 

She would like to set up an Internet café and alternatively sell some stationary items and school supplies in the same business. 

She is 54 years old and all her batteries are charged to take on the new challenges that life has prepared for her. 

She is requesting financial help to buy a computer and some stationary items, so she can have stock to show in her windows and display cases. With this money, she can invest in setting up her business and attracting clients, and in this way create a positive impact on her family’s earnings. 

Her dream is to have a big Internet hall that provides a good income and creates jobs.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some stationary items, so she can have stock to show in her windows and display cases.

loans.name: Kadzitu

texts.en:
Kadzitu is a fifty-two year old Komaza tree farmer. He has five children, two of whom are in school. Kadzitu is widower. 

In addition to growing trees, Kadzitu supports his family with cultivating and subsistence farming. He decided to join Komaza because he knows he will earn a good income from harvesting the trees.  He plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to to pay school fees for his children. 

Kadzitu’s favorite part about working with Komaza is planting cowpeas and keeping the harvest to feed his family.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Jairo Antonio

texts.es:
Jairo es un campesino, humilde y trabajador con el empuje y verraquera que distingue a los hombres y mujeres del campo.

Es un Hombre de mente emprendedora y desde muy pequeño aprendió todos los oficios del campo como cultivos y crianza de animales, tanto así que hoy en día tiene su propio cultivo café; alimentos que vende en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Caicedo.

Este personaje tiene como propósito aumentar sus cultivos y mejorar los que actualmente tiene y es por eso que acude a la ayuda de un crédito con la Corporación Interactuar para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes, abonos y la compra de semillas de café.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de progresar como empresario y como persona, además de aumentar sus ingresos y seguir aportando el sustento en su hogar.

Él lo único que quiere es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Jairo is a hard-working and humble farmer who with drive and desire stands out from other men and women from the country. He is a man with an enterprising mind and since he was small has been learning all the work in the fields like growing crops and raising animals. Today he has his own coffee crops; food which he sells in the market plaza in the municipality of Calcedo.

This person has the goal of increasing his crops and improving those he has. This makes him come to request the help of a loan from the Interactuar corporation to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizer, manure and coffee seeds. The loan will give him the opportunity to progress as an entrepreneur and as a person. As well it will increase his income and continue to support the sustenance of the household. He is the only one who has the ability to improve the family's quality of living.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizer, manure and buy coffee seeds.

loans.name: Claris

texts.en:
Claris is a thirty-two year old Komaza tree farmer. She has two children, one of whom is in school. Claris is married and her spouse's occupation is sales and marketing. 

In addition to growing trees, Claris also works as an account clerk to support her family. She decided to join Komaza because she saw the existing farms of her neighbors and decided to join the microforestry program.  She plans to spend the money earned, from the Komaza tree farm, to go to college so she can seek better employment opportunities. 

Claris enjoys taking part in all Komaza projects because they are good.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh works as a driver on his own motorcycle. He is a 22-year-old, married man, living with his wife in their own house in Haja City, Yemen.  

In the past, Saleh was working as a driver on his friend's motorcycle with a weekly wage. Now, he has his own motorcycle. 

Saleh's mobile phone broke down and his wife has no phone. He needs to connect with her without delay. He doesn't have sufficient money to purchase phones. Therefore, Saleh applied for a loan of 66,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase two phones for him and his wife.

Saleh hopes to purchase a taxi to drive which will help him make a better future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase two phones for him and his wife.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: María tiene 40 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 17 años, 15 años y 8 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando. María es una mujer admirable quien se dedica a la venta de pupusas y tamales. Este negocio le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus ventas e ingresos ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de insumos como: maíz, frijoles, queso, tomates, repollo, etc. para seguir vendiendo sus ricas pupusas y tamales.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old and lives in her own home together with her husband and their three children. Their children are aged 17, 15 and 8 and are all studying. 

Maria is an admirable woman who makes a living selling pupusas and tamales. This business allows her to support her household. With the desire to improve her sales and earnings, Maria made the decision to request this loan from FUSAI. 

The loan will be used to purchase: corn, beans, cheese, tomatoes, cabbage, etc, in order to continue selling her delicious pupusas and tamales.

loans.use: to purchase: corn, beans, cheese, tomatoes, cabbage, etc, in order to continue selling her delicious pupusas and tamales.

loans.name: Yessica Yamileth

texts.es:
Yessica, de 37 años de edad, estudió hasta octavo año de secundaria, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, la albañilería y también trabaja elaborando tejas.- Vive junto con sus 3 hijos, todos están estudiando.

Yessica, se dedica al cuido del hogar y de sus hijos, actividad que viene realizando desde que que se casó hace 15 años.

Ella necesita el préstamo para terminar de comprar un de terreno, y posteriormente construir una casita en donde puedan vivir dignamente.

Yessica, sueña con tener una casa de ladrillo en la cual puedan vivir más cómodos.
texts.en:
Yessica is 37 years old, and she studied until eighth grade in high school. She is married, and her husband makes a living in agriculture, bricklaying, and the production of roof tiles. She lives with her 3 children, all of them currently study.

Yessica is a homemaker and take cares of her children, both of which she has been doing since she got married 15 years ago.

She needs a loan to finish buying a piece of land, and subsequently build a house where they can live with dignity.

Yessica dreams of having a brick home in which they can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to finish buying a piece of land, and subsequently build a house where she can live with dignity.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a 57-year-old married woman and a mother of five grown-up children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This has been the source of her income for the past 20 years now.

Mila is asking to take a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, candies, biscuits and snack foods, condiments and others. This loan will enable Mila to augment her stocks, thus attracting more buyers in her store.

In the future, Mila hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, candies, biscuits and snack foods, condiments and others.

loans.name: Deyanira Del Socorro

texts.es:
Deyanira, a sus 35 años de edad, es una mujer carismática y servicial que se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició por la necesidad de generar ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. 
A pesar de las adversidades, ella tuvo la fortaleza y la determinación para levantarse y seguir adelante y, gracias a ello lleva 1 año de trayectoria en esta actividad.
Su propósito en la vida es seguir progresando y por ello desea fortalecer su negocio acreditándolo con la compra de surtido de productos como abarrotes, granos, frituras, bebidas gaseosas y en general productos básicos de la canasta familiar, de esta forma podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad y servicio, logrando aumentar notablemente sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe de sus ventas.
Deyanira manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo su negocio con la ayuda de Interactuar y en un futuro desea convertirlo en un supermercado, en el que los clientes puedan encontrar todos los artículos que necesiten. 

Apoyando a este crédito estarás contribuyendo con el emprendimiento de las mujeres Colombianas!
texts.en:
Deyanira at 35 years old is a charismatic and helpful woman who is dedicated to working in her own business, a grocery store. She started it from the need to generate income to get her family ahead. In spite of the adversities, she had the fortitude and determination to raise herself and continue forward. Thanks to this she has been in business for one year.

Her goal in life is to continue to progress and she wants to strengthen her business by buying an assortment of products like groceries, grains, fried foods, soft drinks, and general basic food items. In this way she can offer better quality and service to her clients. She will increase her sales notably and the income that she receives from these sales.

Deyanira says that her greatest wish is to continue to expand her business with the help of Interactuar and in the future she would like to convert it into a supermarket where the customers could find everything they need. Supporting this loan will contribute to the entrepreneurship of the women of Colombia.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of products like groceries, grains, fried foods, soft drinks and general basic food items.

loans.name: Yanira Guadalupe

texts.es: Yanira de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella posee desde hace 2 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yanira, age 51, lives in her own house with her life partner and their two children.  She has had a small store at her house for two years.  She has a lot of customers because of the good prices and the kind way in which she conducts her sales.

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, and sweet breads, etc.  This way she will be able to have better earnings in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, and sweet breads, etc.

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.es: Gudelia 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica desde hace 5 años a la elaboración y venta de antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, tamales, etc. que vende de forma ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia, adicional a eso también vende tortillas, ella solicita nuevamente un crédito pero esta vez para la compra de aceite, papas, maíz para los tamales, plátanos y todos los ingredientes para su elaboración y así poder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar.
texts.en: Gudelia is 47 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her son. For the past 5 years she has been working making and selling snack food like fried potatoes, fried yucca, empanadas, tamales, etc. She sells them in the streets close to her home. Besides this she sells tortillas. She is requesting a new loan but this time to buy oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, plantains and the other ingredients to make her food. Then she can cover the expenses that might occur.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, plantains and other ingredients.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is a 40-year-old Komaza tree farmer. He has eight children, five of whom are in school. Evans is married, and his spouse is a nursery school teacher. In addition to growing trees, Evans also supports his family by serving as a community health worker. He decided to join Komaza to make the environment clean and help him develop himself after earning income from harvesting. He plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to buy a plot and build a permanent house for his family. Evans’ favorite part about working with Komaza is the planting and taking care of his tree farm.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Karisa

texts.en: Karisa is a 39-year-old Komaza tree farmer. He has five children, four of whom are in school. Karisa is married, and his spouse is a farmer, too. In addition to growing trees, Karisa also cultivates and supports his family with subsistence farming. He decided to join Komaza to earn money to improve his family's living standard. He plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to educate his children. Karisa’s favorite part about working with Komaza is growing cowpeas as part of the short term crops program.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Josenette

texts.en:
Josenette is 41 years old and married with two children, two of whom are in school. Josenette works very hard to provide for them.

Josenette runs a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business such as sugar, milk, flour, etc.

Josenette has been in this business for 15 years.

Josenette would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business such as sugar, milk, flour, etc

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Sololá se caracteriza por ser una ciudad bien poblada con casas muy bien estructuradas y modernas,  construidas con materiales muy sofisticada. El desarrollo socioeconómico ha sido un factor principal pero también la mano de obra por albañiles y constructores calificados como es el caso de Agustin albañil de 60 años de edad con una familia de siete  hijos, los dos primeros hijos ya tiene familias separadas y los cinco últimos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad.

La actividad que el realiza es la albañilería el lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 25 años y se a convertido en una muy buena fuente de ingresos par el y su familia,  el es muy dedicado a su trabajo lo realiza de la forma más correcta y rápida para dejar las construcciones de su comunidad muy bien hechas.

El crédito que ha solicitado lo quiere utilizar para la compra de herramientas de albañilería para poder trabajar y realizar su trabajo con más rapidez y bien hecho, uno de sus sueños mientras corre el tiempo es convertirse en un maestro de obras y enseñarles a sus hijos el mismo oficio y que ellos estudien para que sean profesionales en el mañana.
texts.en:
Sololá is known for being a very populated city with well-constructed, modern houses built with very sophisticated materials.  Socioeconomic development has been a main factor, but so has the labor of bricklayers and qualified builders, as in the case of Agustín, 60.  He has a family of seven children.  The two oldest have their own families and the other five are excellent students in the school in the community.

Agustín's work is bricklaying.  He has been doing this work for 25 years and it has become a very good source of income for his family.  He's very devoted to his job and he works in the most precise and efficient way so the buildings in his community are well made.

He wants to use the loan he has requested to buy bricklaying tools so he can work and do his job faster and better.

One of Agustín's dreams is to become a master teacher as time goes on and teach his children the same trade.  He also wants his children to go to school and become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy construction tools

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
Remodelar y adecuar su barbería es el objetivo de Juan, un joven lleno de esperanzas y aspiraciones para su vida.
Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 3 años aprendiendo de la actividad por medio de cursos y capacitaciones.

El préstamo solicitado con la Corporación Interactuar le permitirá cumplir ese objetivo de remodelación y de esta forma podrá a tender a sus clientes d una amanera mucho mas cómoda y con mejor servicio.

Entre sus sueños más latentes se encuentran el poder garantizar la sostenibilidad de su barbería en la zona rural del municipio de El Carmen De Viboral.
texts.en:
Remodeling and customizing the barber shop is Juan's objective. He is a young man filled with hopes and aspirations for his life. He has been working as a barber for 3 years learning through courses and trainings. 

The loan he is requesting with Corporación Interactuar will allow him to realize his goal of remodeling and help him tend to his clients in a more comfortable way and with better service. One of his most latent dreams is to be able to guarantee his business' profitability in this town's rural zone of El Carmen De Viboral.

loans.use: to remodel and customize his barber shop.

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en:
Vusal is 28 years old, married, and has two kids. He loves his children very much and tries to provide them with a good upbringing. He is a kind and hardworking man. According to his friends’ opinion, Vusal is very outgoing and welcoming. They live in the Agdash region. He couldn’t get higher education, so instead he decided to start his own business. For that he chose farming. He is growing fruits and vegetables in his own yard. Vusal has seven years of experience in this field, thanks to his father, but Vusal's situation is very hard. He needs to raise fruits and care for them, but the lack of water in the region makes a problem for him. Because of this problem, the productivity has fallen, and he can’t cover the family’s needs. He applied for a 1200 AZN loan in order to be able to supply water to his garden weekly. This will increase the productivity again, and the family’s income will rise.

His goal is to continue working to support his children in all that they need, particularly to help those that are studying in school. Please support him.

loans.use: to supply water to his garden

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Caren, a youthful 26-year-old mum, a wise farmer whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Nandi, in the Rift valley region of Kenya. Caren is happily married and together with her husband, blessed with one lovely child. For the past 7 years she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been growing maize, tea, cabbage, tomatoes and also, she keeps dairy cows. Caren has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. Although she has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of timely delivery of the produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up; “I have to do something for my family,“ she said.

Caren mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo which is a micro finance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Caren is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge hence suffering so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetable and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price, and through this loan Caren is going to achieve her dream and goals. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle but Caren feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help out women so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts.

The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Caren will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market and also, she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market hence increased income level. Caren is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, Caren will improve her living conditions and assure her child, siblings and grandchildren to come of a secure future.

Support this woman with a loan and makes her dreams a reality!

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver products to the market in a timely manner.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en: Odette is 41 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 14 and 20 years; all of them go to school.  She has a shop and has been in business for 6 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar and maize flour to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and maize flour to resell.

loans.name: Manuel Adan

texts.es:
Manuel es un veterano con mucha experiencia en el campo. 

Es humilde y sencillo, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para poder cualquier cultivo a producir.

El tiene un cultivo de frijol el cual trabaja todos los días para vender sus cosechas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Sonsón.
Gracias a sus años de experiencia y enseñanzas que le dio su padre desde niño, tiene plena capacidad para trabajar y para asesorar en estos temas a los demás agricultores de la zona que necesiten ayuda con su producción. 

El solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, semillas de frijol y pesticidas, de esta manera inyectara capital a su actividad y mejorara sus cosechas de una manera significativa enfrentando la dificultad más grande que tiene que son el clima tan cambiante que afecta su cosecha.
 
Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y grandes esperanzas en las personas solidarias que apoyan a los campesinos trabajadores de Colombia como lo hace la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya a un humilde agricultor para que pueda sacar adelante sus tierras con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Manuel is a veteran with a lot of experience in the fields. He is humble and simple. He has a gift with people and enough energy to produce any kind of crop. He has a bean crop that he works every day to sell his crops in the plaza of the municipal market of Sonsón. Thanks to his years of experience and what his father taught him since he was a child, he has a great capacity for work and to help advise the other farmers in the area that need help with their production.

He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizers, bean seeds and pesticides. In this way he will inject capital in his business and improve his harvest in an significant given the biggest problem that he has which is the changeable climate which is affecting his crops. He has a lot of faith in his business and great hope in the united group of hard-working farmers of Colombia like the Interactuar corporation helps. Support this humble farmer so he can get ahead with his land with a loan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizer, bean seeds and pesticide.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: Olivia de 53 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con sus dos hijas, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 8 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene  muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor para continuar con sus ventas ya que le ha ido muy bien en estos meses y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Olivia, 53, lives in the family home with her 2 children.  She's had a business selling tortillas for 8 years.  Her business is located in her home, and she has a lot of customers.  Olivia is requesting another loan so that she can buy corn at wholesale to continue with her sales, because her business has been doing very well in recent months, and this way she can increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es: Martha de 46 años vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace varios años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Martha, 46, lives in her own home with her life partner and their 3 children.  She's had a small store for a number of years.  The store is located in her house, and she sells a variety of products there, including: snacks, drinks, consumer staples, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatin, sugar, etc.  Martha is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise at wholesale, because this is her only source of income.  This way, she will be able to have better earnings and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 52 years old and married with five children, one who is in school. Julieta works very hard to provide for them.

Julieta runs a buy and sell soft drinks in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional case of soft drinks to sell.

Julieta has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional case of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Olive
